description: Open to local candidates in Singapore and Hong Kong  At Hex Trust, we‚Äôre building trust In the digital ecosystem and we‚Äôd like you to help us deliver that message to our prospects. Providing institutional custody services like ours takes in-depth industry knowledge, confidence, and persistence. We‚Äôre seeing tremendous demand and growth in the space and we‚Äôve created this role to partner with our Head of Sales. We‚Äôre a small, but rapidly growing FinTech company looking for an energetic individual to work independently, build relationships, and help broaden our client base and take our business to the next level!  RESPONSIBILITIES  - Partnering with our Head of Sales and Business Development on client acquisition and retention efforts to achieve growth targets - Own all elements of the business development, sales and partnership life cycles: initial scoping, framing of value, negotiation of term sheets and contracts, implementation and post sales - Strategize on plans for market engagement, client management, and be seen as a thought leader, across the digital asset ecosystem - Lead sales pitches, contact prospects and clients, and handle enquiries, feedback and requests - Ad hoc projects as needed  REQUIREMENTS  - Ability to operate and excel in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with minimal supervision - Ability to create relationships with both FinTech companies and traditional financial institutions - Be an effective communicator and ability to collaborate across teams - Demonstrate a curiosity for and knowledge of the digital asset ecosystem - Attention to detail - Positive attitude  WHY HEX TRUST?  Make a difference and get yourself noticed in a rapidly growing company, providing multiple opportunities for career and personal development. We are a dynamic, multi-cultural team of smart, motivated people across Asia. We‚Äôll give you tough challenges, while offering rewarding results to match, as well as regular team and social events and flexible working arrangements when needed.  Diverse and inclusive team: A diverse and international team across Asia, who come from over 15 countries with diversity of both thought and background on a mission to disrupt the digital asset industry. We support each other and take pride in our achievements. We attract talent from well known global multinational companies and institutions.  Ownership & learning-curve: Opportunity to make an active contribution to the growth story of one of the leading disruptors in the FinTech industry.  Communication: We treat our staff like owners by being open, transparent, and providing regular communication about our direction and progress. We provide regular insight into decision making, strategy, and corporate-wide objectives and key results progress so that each of our employees is aligned and empowered. And we constantly strive to improve how we can communicate more effectively.  Office: We offer both the flexibility to work remotely or to work in style and comfort from our modern office.

As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world‚Äôs leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that‚Äôs through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Requirements  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Enterprise Sales Executive with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to enterprise companies? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The impact you will have:  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the Americas region. As an Enterprise Sales Executive you will become an expert in Elliptic‚Äôs value proposition, helping our prospective customers navigate and enter the cryptocurrency market with your knowledge and understanding of our product and compliance and regulatory environments.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What you‚Äôll do: Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota  You will be a great fit here if you: Can understand the customer‚Äôs business model, and how digital assets fit into their strategy Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities  Our ideal candidate has: Significant demonstrable full sales cycle experience selling Enterprise SaaS solutions Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset. You‚Äôre comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy  Bonus Points for: Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to Financial Services Borderline obsession with emerging technology  Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays + additional day for your birthday Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it‚Äôs important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don‚Äôt all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.

description: Singapore based B2B Fintech start-up  Position: SDR  Experience: 0-3 years of technology sales experience in South East Asia  Location: Singapore (Open to remote applicants)  Salary Range: S$3,000 - S$3200 + Commission  Submit your CV + cover letter: work@peakflo.co  ### üöÄ What we‚Äôre building  - Unhealthy cash flow is amongst the top 3 reasons why businesses struggle to scale! So we started Peakflo with one goal in mind - to democratize access to key financial tools that improve B2B SME cash flows and increase net margins by up to 2%! - In just the past few months, we launched Peakflo, booked over US$100k in ARR from our early customers and raised pre-seed funding led by a billion-dollar global VC fund with participation from prominent angels and Entrepreneur First - Most importantly, we have begun building an environment that encourages intellectual curiosity, problem solving, and ownership. An environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to succeed, learn, and grow ‚ù§Ô∏è  **üí™ What you‚Äôll do**  - Work with the Regional BD lead to close 18 mid-market customers by end Q4 2021 in a fast-paced and high-intensity environment - Generate qualified leads and build relationships by nurturing prospects - Educate cold leads on value of our products and qualify them - Represent our company‚Äôs products and services, starting with a comprehensive understanding and leading to consumer research to identify how our solutions meet customer need - Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage account executives for next steps - Identify best practices to refine the company‚Äôs lead generation playbook - Utilize CRM for executing and recording cold outreach via calls and emails to generate new sales opportunities - Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services - Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities - Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market - Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers and sales executives - Report to regional BD lead with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results - Be result-oriented, have a mindset of doing what it takes to grow fast  ### ü§ùüèº Who you are  - You are customer-driven: Understand deeply what our customer needs. - You make it happen: You learn fast. Execute with speed and embody a relentless work ethic. - You collaborate: You embrace diverse perspectives with curiosity and respect. - You foster meritocracy: You nurture a nonhierarchical and caring meritocracy.  ### ü§© Bonus Points  - Experience in vertical industries (B2B marketplaces, reservations marketplaces, manufacturing, logistics, trading, distribution/wholesale) - Formal SaaS sales training in an extremely competitive sales environment - Experience selling cloud-based solutions to mid-market or enterprise-level finance and executive teams  ### Benefits  üìà Stock options - As repeat founders, we truly believe in building something valuable as a team with a strong sense of shared ownership  üè• Medical insurance - We provide comprehensive group medical insurance so that you're always covered  üè° Flexibility - We support a remote friendly culture centered around trust and meritocracy

The ideal candidate is an energetic self-starter with the ability to identify influencers and key decision-makers within accounts. You will discover qualified opportunities by responding to inbound interests and targeted outbound prospects to build rapport and establish long-term relationships.   Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1 - 2 years' of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work  This job suits someone who has the grit, resilience and energy to meet and exceed our growth KPIs. You'll get to learn how a startup scales from 0-1000, and be a part of the #hybridwork revolution as we forge the path towards the future of flexible work.

We are looking for a Software (SaaS) Sales Development Representative to develop new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers. To be successful in this junior role, you should have previous experience developing leads from scratch and meeting sales quotas in the software (SaaS) or technology industry. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you closed or passed on a deal. If you are motivated and results-driven, if you enjoy working in a team environment, we‚Äôd like to meet you! Ultimately, you will boost sales and contribute to our long-term business growth.  The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, time management skills, a startup mindset, the ability to function successfully both as an individual and on a team, and should be a globally-minded individual valuing diversity.  Responsibilities Qualify leads from marketing campaigns, events and self search as sales opportunities. Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails. Present our company to potential clients. Build long-term trusting relationships with clients. Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market. Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Account Executives. Report to the Sales Manager on weekly sales results. Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans.  Requirements 1-2 years of work experience in sales development. Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls). Track record of achieving sales quotas. Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, hubspot, etc.). Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts). Understanding of sales performance metrics. Excellent communication skills. Associates Degree (BS in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field is preferred but not required).  About Glue Up Founded in 2013, Glue up, formerly EventBank provides all-in-one engagement management cloud solutions that give professional communities the power to streamline operations, enrich audience engagement, and maximize value underpinning expansive networks. Our cutting-edge platform has helped hundreds of organizations in more than 60+ countries modernize processes and eliminate engagement challenges. Glue Up has offices in Hong Kong, Singapore, Philippines, China, Malaysia, India, Indonesia, USA, LATAM, EMEA and Russia.  Our core products are Event Management Software and Chamber of Commerce & Association Management Software.

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Sales Development Team is a critical component of our growth plan. All inbound and outbound engagement with prospective customers starts with the SDR team. As a Outbound Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will be responsible for generating interest in Coursera by contacting prospects, presenting our solutions, and qualifying leads for our sales team. You will work closely with sales and marketing teams to ensure we operate as a seamless organization to build our pipeline of business.  The ideal individual will have experience with enterprise sales/partnerships and be interested in working for a social enterprise. Your knowledge of Edtech, and enterprise learning combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities, will shape Coursera‚Äôs B2B business to help us provide more access to education globally.  Responsibilities Build a pipeline of leads for the sales team by qualifying inbound inquiries and reaching out to high-potential prospects Conduct effective discovery and qualification conversations with prospects through your deep understanding of our product value proposition and use cases Develop creative strategies for engaging and nurturing prospects using content, email, phone, social media and any other strategies that work Partner closely with members of the sales and marketing teams to coordinate engagement strategies and improving processes Use your frontline knowledge of customer needs to educate the broader team on learnings and opportunities Basic Qualifications A graduate degree or professional experience of 2+ years Preferred Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communications and listening skills Experience selling or marketing software or services and meeting a quota Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments Experience with sales and or marketing tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, DiscoverOrg, Lusha Post-Graduate degree, preferred If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Connecting with Sales Prospects  Work Smarter, Not Harder: Time Management for Personal & Professional  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

description: Available for the following locations: Sydney, Australia | Singapore, Singapore  Hello, We're TechnologyAdvice.  At TechnologyAdvice, we are dedicated to educating, advising, and connecting buyers and sellers of business technology. As a trusted resource across hundreds of technology verticals, our unbiased research and crowd-sourced product reviews help buyers find the right software to grow their business.  TechnologyAdvice has been named as one of the Inc. 5000 list of America‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Private Companies four times, as well as inclusion in the Inc Best Workplaces list for 2021. In 2019, TechnologyAdvice received a Nashville Business Journal Small Business Award and was named the Market Mover in the Nashville Chamber‚Äôs NEXT Awards. We are also a five-time recipient of the annual Tennessee Top Workplaces awards.  TechnologyAdvice is based in Nashville, Tenn, with a diverse workforce and client base located across the globe. We‚Äôre growing and always interested in expanding our team with top talent...make sure to check out our perks and benefits listed below!  The Opportunity‚Ä¶  We are seeking a highly motivated individual, with a passion for sales and marketing! If you have previous experience in customer service, enjoy networking, and have a high competitive drive, we would love for you to apply! The Sales Development Rep‚Äôs main objectives are to identify new prospects and help the sales team exceed revenue targets by creating sales meetings and opportunities. The SDR is often the first point of contact our clients have and will be the first experience the customer has with TA. Using a consultative approach, the Sales Development Rep is to uncover customer needs, introduce TA‚Äôs solutions and connect prospective customers with the appropriate Sales Lead.  How You'll Contribute‚Ä¶ Create engaging videos, emails and LinkedIn messages to help break through the noise Respond, engage, and qualify leads and inquiries from technologyadvice.com/partners Exceed daily client engagement goals through phone, email, and social media touches Cold prospect and find new contacts and accounts Create and articulate compelling value propositions around TA offerings Establish effective outreach cadences and cold calling tactics/strategies Communicate with prospects and coordinate their calendars with the AE who will be taking the call Work with the Sales leaders to pass off opportunities  What You Bring‚Ä¶  We're looking for someone who's hungry to learn and can do so quickly, while also bringing new ideas and creativity to the team. Bonus points if you're technical enough to already know your way around Salesforce, Salesloft, or another CRM platform! Some other things about you include: Excellent communication and presentation skills Fast learner and passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach Enthusiastic and outgoing conversation skills A confident and determined outlook Resilience - the ability to cope with rejection Competitive mentality Being coachable is a must  Why You Want Us... MacBook Pro or PC laptop, your choice Ongoing Career Development Meetings Subscription to the Headspace App Monthly Team Outings and Quarterly Volunteer Opportunities Professional development opportunities and incentives Milestone celebrations for birthdays, weddings, work achievements, and more Employer sponsored medical and dental options Comprehensive life insurance and disability programs Long Service Award, a thank you to our employees for their service  To see all job openings and learn more, visit our.  Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.  We believe that our differences make us stronger and foster a diverse and inclusive culture where people feel safe being themselves. TechnologyAdvice is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.  Pre-employment screening required.  COVID-19 RESPONSE:  TechnologyAdvice is committed to the safety and wellness of each of our employees. In response to the COVID-19 Pandemic, we follow all CDC and local protocol.  Powered by JazzHR  Vai23t3CQ8

description: Sales Development Representative  Description  ethiXbase is currently seeking a high achieving Sales Development Representative to join our Go To Market function as part of the Marketing team. You will play a critical role in qualifying leads, profiling prospects and customers and providing input on which campaigns generate the best leads. Working in collaboration with our Global Sales Development and Field Sales professionals, your primary goal is to identify and qualify opportunities across all ethiXbase business units across our primary target markets in APAC. You will own the inbound lead qualification process and will look to move leads into and through the sales funnel - from an unaware contact through to sales qualified opportunity for the Sales team to convert. This full time role is both home/remote working with some time in the office with the APAC team, which is located in Singapore.  Background on ethiXbase   About us  ethiXbase is a RegTech business that delivers robust technology and data analytics to assist corporates and third parties, create and maintain sustainable business practices. We play a strategic role in helping businesses globally, elevate their third-party supply chain by understanding and applying the standards and principles set out by the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC), including: Human Rights, Labour, Environment and Anti-Corruption.   How we do it?   We create the most intuitive, robust, and entirely configurable platform, which helps elevate sustainability throughout the global business network. We make the process of accessing and understanding millions of records and complex data sets simple. Facilitating a transparent information exchange between corporates and third parties.   Our Mission  To accelerate the worlds progress towards sustainability, by crafting the most compelling solutions, that help our clients build and maintain sustainable supply chains that benefit the world.   Job Spec   Reporting line and structure  This role reports into the Global Head of Growth Marketing and sits within the Marketing department, though it will work very closely with the Head of Sales for APAC and Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) in the UK.  Payment Structure Pay is dependent on experience, however you will earn a generous wage, as well as a monthly commission for every sales qualified meeting that meet a prescribed criteria.  What you get to do in this role:   The Sales Development Representative builds sales pipeline while achieving monthly, quarterly, and annual objectives.   Follow up on Marketing-generated leads to qualify them for potential Sales opportunities  Create, manage, and drive all inbound leads to Sales acceptance  Provide account team with detailed call notes in the CRM to ensure opportunities are understood and next steps are clearly identified  Collaborate with Marketing in executing various demand generation campaigns  Drive attendance to all company events and regional trade shows  Understand how ServiceNow solutions address various customer pain points and  Research, identify, and prioritise target accounts for prospecting activities  Build prospecting contact lists  Create org/account mappings of prospective clients  Acquire, update, and maintain contact information within Salesforce  Build and manage reporting Salesforce dashboards along with technical team to showcase ROI based on activity  Utilise and leverage internal and external technology to identify, develop and manage marketing leads effectively  Knowledge of Marketing Automation Platforms (Desirable)  To be successful in this role you should have:  An ambitious, creative, goal-oriented, and customer-focused mindset  A basic understanding of Cloud computing and SaaS offerings  Excellent listening, verbal, and written skills  Ability to build meaningful business relationships with ethiXbase customers, prospects, and internal colleagues  A growth mindset, consistently working to improve your skills and adapt in a constantly changing environment  Humble confidence and the ability to articulate the value of ethiXbase to customers  Ability to work flexibly and pivot focus based on company needs or industry changes  A digitally focused mindset   Other   Based in the Singapore, Philippines or Malaysia, remote working but with time in the office with the APAC team Start date in October  We provide competitive compensation and a professional atmosphere. This is a collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and positive attitude will have opportunities to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.     ethiXbase is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity, or veteran status. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at hr@ethixbase.com for assistance.

The Future Is What We Make It  Senior Sales Manager  Singapore  Honeywell offers employees the opportunity to work on the world‚Äôs most exciting projects, redefining the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us.  We are currently seeking a Senior Sales Manager to join our Building Technologies (HBT) team in our Singapore office. Reporting to a Product Sales Leader, your focus will be oversight of new prospects and maintain existing customers to drive sales; Facilitating connection between channel partners, M&E Contractors, M&E consultants, architects, developers and users for specifications; assessing market intelligence support and covering the developments going into the market place by competitors and their pricing.  Responsibilities  Drive product sales that bring together both hardware and software products add value to the team with your expertise by driving ideas for new products, principles, theories and concepts. Help Honeywell be the customer's top choice by improving upon Product Sales solutions. Responsible for the market development and growth of HBT business in Singapore. This includes identifying & appointing key customers (Developers / Architects / Interior Designers / M&E Contractors) to increase pipeline. Manage the business and the existing customers to grow the HBT business. Understand the local markets and identify opportunities where our businesses can succeed with current offerings in all relevant market verticals especially Residential, Commercial, Leisure & Entertainment Hospitality, and Healthcare. Develop and execute an overall business plan to achieve the growth targets set for the business in terms of Revenue and margin expansion. Coordinate sales opportunities with the correct engineering and product deliverable. Undertake regular consultant/customer visits for ongoing product and sales training, joint sales calls, and open project reviews Manage any channel/M&E contractors conflict that may arise Evaluating competitors in the local market Establishing and owning the plans and strategies aimed at serving and expanding the customer base Responsible for the strategy and execution of the sales plan for a specific system and vertical market. Accurate forecast of revenue and growth opportunities You Must Have 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience in Project related sales background (Electrical and building management systems knowledge) Bachelor's degree, or equivalent Project / Product Sales Experience Proven track record preferably within the building solutions industry preferred. Excellent written and oral presentation skills. Ability to present and communicate complex technical solutions clearly at all business levels. Ability to work in diverse cultural and multi lingual environments. Proactive mindset and able to work efficiently within virtual and distributed teams We Value A proficient understanding of the principles and best practices in Product / Project Sales Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization About Us  The world is changing. And it‚Äôs a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We‚Äôre building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.  Discover More  We‚Äôve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we‚Äôre creating what‚Äôs next. There‚Äôs a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/  If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you‚Äôll love working at Honeywell.  The future is what we make it. So join us and let‚Äôs do this together.  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status. description: Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  As an Account Manager, Client Services, you‚Äôll join a high functioning team of passionate support professionals whose performance is critical to Coinbase achieving its mission. You will serve as a primary subject matter expert for Coinbase‚Äôs institutional suite of products (Prime Broker and Custody), providing world-class service and support to our most valued institutional clients such as hedge funds, investment managers, market makers, and private wealth managers. Diligent, empathetic, and have a bias towards action, you will play a crucial role in the success of the Client Services organization as we help build the cryptoeconomy.  What You'll Be Doing (i.e., Job Duties) Serve as the primary account manager for a group of Coinbase‚Äôs highest value institutional clients, co-owning the relationship with our Institutional Coverage sales teams from top of funnel through on platform support Build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing Coinbase institutional clients, driving successful integrations with the institutional product suite and impact to the overall business Provide a best in class experience for our clients through effective stakeholder management, decisive prioritization, and efficient execution across institutional teams Understand complex, multi-product client workflows and strategies to ensure that our institutional clients are integrated appropriately and using our product suite optimally Effectively triage, manage and prioritize incoming client requests. Manage requests through to resolution, including delegating across teams of subject matter experts Facilitate prospect and client demo calls, serving as subject matter expert on product features, answering technical cryptocurrency related questions, and demonstrating how Coinbase can fit into their overall strategy Distill client feedback to internal teams including Advocacy, Engineering and Product when surfacing bugs, incidents, and product feedback What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) Motivated by Coinbase‚Äôs mission and creating a seamless, white-glove support experience for our highest value individual and institutional clients Experience managing relationships with Market Makers and Introducing Brokers and working with Engineering and Product teams. Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in an institutional client partner / services / advisory role in financial services or technology industry Experience with relationship or account management for institutional clients, liaising with executive leadership, management, and/or senior operations contacts In depth knowledge of global financial markets, prime brokerage, margin, lending, derivatives, trading platforms, custody, and/or crypto Experience with different channels of support, including voice, e-mail and/or chat Fantastic communication skills in order to operate across multiple departments, stakeholders, and clients Flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a high-growth and fast paced organization Travel requirements up to 20% to Coinbase offices and client locations (depending on business need) Nice To Haves High level of proficiency in cryptocurrency and Coinbase products Advanced degree in business, finance, project management or client experience ID: G1774  Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans. Additional Information  Please apply by 31 October 2021

description: The most important characteristic of our Business Development team is that we love talking about Chainalysis. Our job is to help understand customers‚Äô pain points and determine whether or not our solution will help them overcome the challenges they‚Äôre facing.  Business Development Reps are great at asking the right questions, never get discouraged, and are incredibly persistent. We measure our success by the number of introductions we make to the Account Executive team and the overall revenue that started with our outreach.  In one year you‚Äôll know you were successful if... You‚Äôve introduced prospects to the Account Executive team that turned into valuable customers You can talk to anyone at any skill level about Chainalysis, our solutions, and how they‚Äôre driving the cryptocurrency industry You are an expert Salesforce, SalesLoft, and Linkedin Sales Navigator user There‚Äôs no objection you haven‚Äôt heard or overcome in the last 12 months A Background Like This Helps Previous experience in a sales/lead generation role for a SaaS or cryptocurrency business An overachiever in whatever makes you tick - sports, drama, music, underwater basket-weaving, etc. Curiosity and interest in the cryptocurrency industry At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we‚Äôre ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women‚Äôs Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant‚Äôs Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.  Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA Employees are not required to attend in-person meetings at this time. All in-person, Chainalysis attendees must be vaccinated* prior to the in-person event/meeting You must follow cleaning protocols. This includes washing your hands before and after meetings or using a disinfectant or alcohol solution with at least 70% alcohol If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, they must immediately notify the People team *A USA employee is considered fully vaccinated if they meet any of the following criteria: It has been 2 weeks since their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or It has been 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson‚Äôs Janssen vaccine, or A person has recovered from a COVID-19 infection and was treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma and are within 90 days of the treatment. Please note that once 90 days has passed after the monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma treatment, an employee will not be permitted to meet in-person or go to a customer meeting until they meet the above criteria of being fully vaccinated Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA  As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. Employees in the EU and the UK are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed ‚Äúgreen or amber‚Äù by the EU and the UK authorities. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines: International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC  With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.

description: We are looking for a Sales executive that will serve as the point of contact between a business and its prospects or clients and have a range of responsibilities including identifying and educating prospective customers while supporting existing clients with information and assistance that relates to products and services.   Beyond simply a sales executive, we are looking for the building blocks as the first 20 employees of an exciting startup. Essentially, we are looking for a "Hustler" that can grow with the company whilst handling the pressure of accelerated growth and responsibilities.  On a business development end, they will also aid in seeking new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.   Expect to be involved in the growth of the company in the local and new markets and in key product & market development.  We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative.  Responsibilities Responsible as a key account manager and seeing through the customer sales life cycle from onboarding, closing, after sales-support and client engagement.  Able to establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships After sales-support - Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with the marketing department.  Analyze the territory/market‚Äôs potential, track sales and status reports Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends  Requirements Graduated within 2019 to 2021 Excellent content writing and communication skills, ability to work in teams Understanding and inclination for technology products, which would be helpful for the nature of Mantheos‚Äô business.  Familiarity with BRM and CRM practices along with ability to build productive business professional relationships

Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that‚Äôs what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here‚Äôs your opportunity.  We are looking for an experienced Sales Development Representative to join our Singapore team.  What You Will Be Doing Responsible for creating pipeline of qualified business opportunities for designated APAC markets. Manage inbound lead workflow daily and efficiently qualify inbound leads based on business needs and revenue potential. Develop and implement effective outbound strategies to prospect and target new clients, by utilising a number of available sales tools. Provide an outstanding first exposure to Instructure and our products, introducing and positioning our learning software to new clients. Work very closely with your designated Regional Director and together identify business opportunities and develop impactful and effective strategies to target new prospects. Meet and exceed quarterly and annual meetings booked and revenue quotas for assigned markets. Provide regular and accurate forecasts, ensuring that there is enough pipeline coverage in order to meet assigned revenue quotas. Here's What You Will Need To Know/have A hard working, self-motivated person that is willing to achieve excellence. Creative and assertive communication skills. Open to feedback and development.A minimum of 2 + years of proven sales experience in a B2B environment selling technology solutions. Consistently meet/exceed sales quotas within specified timeframes. Experience selling software products and services is desirable. Demonstrated ability to learn complex enterprise software solutions and use of that knowledge to sell to prospects Bachelor's Degree in any related field is preferred, but not needed. Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM. Get in on all the awesome at Instructure. Excellent benefits and perks, because we want you to be happy and healthy: fully paid private medical insurance, pension, life assurance, personal travel insurance, contribution to your commuter and fitness/welfare Equity!! - Yes, everyone at Instructure gets equity, because your success is the company's success and the company's success, is your success iMacs or Macbooks Most importantly, you get to work with a tight knit team who embrace innovation and are committed to being excellent at what they do We‚Äôve always believed in hiring the most awesome people and treating them right. We know that the more diverse we are, the more diverse our ideas will be and when we openly welcome those ideas, our environment is better and our business is stronger.  All Instructure employees are required to successfully pass a background check upon being hired.

description: Optimizely is focused on unlocking digital potential and we are the recognized category leader in Digital Experience Platform (DXP) and created the category for A/B Testing and experimentation software. We have incredible customers - isn‚Äôt that one of the most important aspects of looking for your next job? Optimizely has over 9,000 brands from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit and Zillow.  Not only are we financially sound and growing but we have unicorn status: Exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and has all strategic options ahead of itself. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.  We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business culture with emphasis on teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!  If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment, apply! We‚Äôre just getting started...  What's it like to work here?  "Nowhere else in the tech industry can you find a role that puts you on the frontlines of digital transformation, speaking with the world's most exciting brands to help them build the online experiences of the future. As a bonus, we let loose with fun outings to awesome restaurants and activities." - Henry, Current Account Executive, former SDR  What You'll Do Help us bring the world‚Äôs most adopted digital experimentation platform to your assigned markets Become part of our proud front-line as the first touch-point for clients, establishing long-term relationships Collaborate with Account Executives and Marketing to further develop the territories Drive targeted customer engagements with senior marketing executives Educate businesses on the value of testing and personalization through experimentation Become a specialist in SaaS solutions sales Be part of an intercultural environment with inspiring and ambitious colleagues Great support for personal development and mentorship Qualifications Sales experience, customer service experience or another type of client-facing experience preferred Knowledge from and insights in tech/SaaS business is preferred You take ownership of everything you do You love making a direct impact You are a keen communicator and love to meet new people You are passionate about technology and online business You are a self-starter with a growth mindset You are solutions-oriented and not afraid to speak up or share an idea You are fluent in verbal and written English Even if you meet 60% of these qualifications, we encourage you to apply! We are looking to create a diverse and multifaceted team. We embody inclusion, which is reflected in our company values where we embrace diversity and equal opportunities for everyone.  Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

FlySpaces FlySpaces is SEA leading tech-enabled commercial real estate agency.  We combine technology (marketplace) and the capabilities of a real estate agency to provide an outstanding experience to users as well as spaces partners/ landlords.  Thanks to our technological and commercial strengths, we offer marketing exposure/ lead generation to operators/ landlords in order to monetise vacant or un-utilised workspaces (Traditional office ‚Äì Private office/ Desk in Coworking space & Serviced office ‚Äì Meeting room ‚Äì Event venue) while we give the opportunity to our users (Tenants) to benefit of streamlined tools to facilitate their search and lease negotiation.  This is an exciting opportunity for a Sales and Marketing Representative to be part of a regional brand, process-driven and reliable.  Your role consists in being the main point of contact between the marketplace and the property agents. You will be assisting the FlySpaces agent team with listing creation / office inventory / business development / LOI preparation / Business case, viewing organisation and other duties. Your role focus mostly on adding value/ assisting our agent team to perform better and benefit of extra marketing visibility.  Responsibilities: Sales/ Business Development: ¬∑       Be the first point of contact for leasing inquiries and operational queries from our merchants, partners & landlords ¬∑       Assist pro-actively existing/ new users (tenants) with their workspace requirement (Private office, Hybrid office, Coworking space/ serviced office, meeting room, event venues) ¬∑       Benefit from FlySpaces database, lead generation and ongoing projects for incentivised commission  ¬∑       Be actively involved in bringing new leads and business opportunities Merchant & Landlord Relationships ¬∑       Be actively involved in finding and acquiring new space partners (which include event venues, coworking spaces, serviced offices), institutional & STRATA landlords to increase inventory ¬∑       Develop and maintain the relationships, monitoring initiatives to improve merchant/ landlord engagement, applying problem-solving skills to effectuate solutions ¬∑       Be the first point of contact for all matters relating to merchants & landlords  Marketing: ¬∑       Support the marketing team by providing relevant content and market insights such as client testimonials/ market transactions, etc..  Job Requirements: ¬∑       Minimum Education: ¬∑       Diploma (Bachelors and Masters Graduates are encouraged to apply as well) ¬∑       Diploma/ Degree in Real Estate OR already having a CEA License IS A PLUS ¬∑       Availability: Immediately ¬∑       Visa: All applicants must have their own visa or sponsorship with eligibility to work in Singapore ¬∑       Experience: Worked in a start-up and / or corporate environment is ideal  ¬∑       Language: Outstanding communication skills and fluency in English ¬∑       Skills: Natural sales instincts, driven attitude and ‚Äúrainmaking‚Äù mentality best describe the ideal candidate for the role. Hands-on mentality, excellent analytical skills, proactiveness is a must  Remuneration (Base + Commission) SGD 2,500-3,500 + % on deals (Subject to profile and experience) The right candidate could generate from $80,000 to $120,000/ year or add this extra salary on top of its existing revenue.

Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Do you enjoy working as part of a team? Could you make the difference to a customer‚Äôs day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...  Here at COS we are recruiting a sales assistant to join our Singapore store. The role is full time and able to work retail hours, including weekends and public holidays.  About COS‚Ä¶  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings‚Äô original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.  About The Role‚Ä¶  Job Description  Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include: Offering our customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them to create great outfits Processing deliveries & stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the shop floor Stock replenishment Selling to customers at the cash desk, fitting room and on the shop floor About You...  Qualifications  To work as a sales assistant, previous experience is not essential. Instead we look for people with the qualities below Customer focused Self-motivated & positive Considerate Adaptable A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Additional Information  Why choose COS?  When you first join COS we will give you a full training plan. In addition to this you will also receive 25% staff discount 13 month salary Up to SGD1040 per year clothing allowance 14 days holiday Sick leave Additional holiday for long service Medical care & insurance Birthday Leave Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.  We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

jobTitle: Business Development Representative - ASEAN, Asia South
description: Business Development Representative, ASEAN & Asia South  Lookout is an integrated endpoint-to-cloud security company. Our mission is to secure and empower our digital future in a privacy-focused world where mobility and cloud are essential to all we do for work and play. We enable consumers and employees to protect their data, and to securely stay connected without violating their privacy and trust. Lookout is trusted by millions of consumers, the largest enterprises and government agencies, and partners such as AT&T, Docomo, KDDI, Telkomsel, Telstra, Verizon, Vodafone, Microsoft, Google, and Apple. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lookout has offices in Haarlem, Boston, India, Singapore, London, Sydney, Tokyo, Toronto and Washington, D.C.  Summary  The Business Development Representative is responsible for outbound prospecting into target accounts and for inbound lead qualification within an assigned territory. This role requires a motivated self-starter capable of making things happen and getting results.  You will utilize phone, email, and other channels of prospecting to contribute to building a pipeline of qualified opportunities through the creation of leads, pre-qualifying prospects, and initiating prospect meetings.  The Business Development Representative will report to the Head of Sales, APJ and be part of a team that includes field sales, channel sales and sales engineers working collectively to exceed monthly and quarterly sales performance goals.  Responsibilities Hunt for new business opportunities through a high volume of outbound activity in a metric driven sales process Identify decision makers within target accounts to initiate sales process Gain an in-depth knowledge and understanding of our value proposition and technology solutions to position to prospects Maintain awareness of market conditions and competitors' products and pricing to keep up to date on knowledge of the industry Work closely with Sales Management and sales teams to identify target customer profile lists and execute strategic prospecting plans Collaborate with Territory Account Managers to determine necessary strategic sales approaches Pre-qualify prospects and schedule discovery calls leading to qualified opportunities for Territory Account Managers and Channel Account Managers Contribute to account mapping and territory planning to maintain and expand the company‚Äôs database of prospects in Salesforce CRM Emphasize customer value over product features and benefits Overcome objections of prospective customers   Qualifications/Skills A minimum of 3+ years B2B sales or business development experience Self-starter with sales ‚Äúhunter‚Äù mentality Strong competitive nature and desire to win Highly coachable and interested in developing sales skills through ongoing coaching and training Excellent verbal and written communication skills Sense of urgency, ability to constantly prioritize, awareness of timelines and deadlines Strong organizational and time management skills Superior relationship building skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Proficiency in Microsoft and Google Office Suites, along with Salesforce CRM Fluent in English and any other local languages will be a plus   Location: Singapore  What do we offer? The chance to be a part of a great team and make an impact Competitive salary and benefits, including equity A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Antengene Antengene is a leading Asia-Pacific biopharmaceutical company focused on innovative haematology and oncology medicines. Our vision is to treat patients beyond borders and transform their lives through our industry-leading R&D capabilities and differentiated strategic approach to developing and commercializing novel haematology oncology therapies. Our values are: Build a culture that attracts and develops talented engaged people with Entrepreneurial Spirit Passionate in our commitment to make a difference for patients with blood cancers & solid tumors Committed to extending access to innovative medicines Act with Speed & Integrity to collaborate with stakeholders in pursuit of innovative drug development& commercialization Continuous pursuit of Standards of Excellence in execution and delivery of financial results To know more of Antengene, visit https://www.antengene.com/  As a Key Account Manager (KAM), you are responsible to achieve financial goals by developing and growing hospital and specialist accounts in Singapore. With strong selling, negotiation and interpersonal skills, you will work across functions to drive revenue, build partnerships with stakeholders and long-term account goals in line with business strategy and company policy. Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand ‚Äì and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 milion visitors. It will be lead by an ambitious team consisting of the Store, Commercial, Operations, IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.  In your role as Sales & Service Generalist, you will ensure end to end shopping experience and apply home furnishing knowledge to provide relevant solutions to customers.  Your assignment To know and understand the customers‚Äô shopping behaviour, retail trends & life at home and use this knowledge to provide the relevant solutions for our customers; To ensure that sales and profitability is secured through sales steering and range efficiency to maximise growth; To know the importance and actively work with replenishment proposal- securing the right parameters to ensure product availability ; To ensure that my area of responsibility is in excellent shape as new, fully stocked and that a high level of merchandising basics is always in place; To contribute towards improving the customer experience in the store and maintain a high level of service standard with a ‚ÄúFirst time right‚Äù mindset; To support a customer-friendly and efficient execution of the payments, exchange & returns and click and collect process. Qualifications  Your profile You have the ability to make things happen by championing flexibility, speed and simplicity; You have the ability to align customer needs and expectations with business needs. You have the ability to communicate with various levels of co-workers from different functions; You have the ability to work on agreed working methods independently and reliably You have the ability to find solutions for customer and operational issues. Additional Information  Please apply by 15 September 2021

Market Development Representative | Singapore  Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers, and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what‚Äôs right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you‚Äôll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements.  Our teams‚Äô partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Market Development Rep (MDR) will generate new business through outbound calls and targeted emails to potential clients. The MDR qualifies prospective customers through targeted questions about their business strategy then leveraging this information to align and sell DocuSign‚Äôs product offerings.  This position spends roughly 80% of the time on the phone prospecting new clients. Market Development Reps will receive hands on training with an emphasis on strategic selling and a focus on researching targeted accounts. This position is a great way for individuals to gain in depth experience in a rapidly growing SaaS company.  This position reports to the Manager, Market Development Representatives  Responsibilities Make outbound calls to prospects who reside in one of DocuSign‚Äôs core vertical markets, offering tailored solutions to solve/improve business process problems. Schedule appointments between prospects and our Account Executives across SMB, Mid-Market or Enterprise verticals. Strategic use of CRM to record information and identify further opportunities in your assigned territory. Work closely with marketing to create email and LinkedIn campaigns to increase company and personal brand awareness. Basic Qualifications A university degree or relevant tertiary qualification Minimum 2 years outbound sales experience Preferred Qualifications Prior experience in the SaaS industry A driven, enthusiastic and hard-working nature The ability to form strong business relationships Excellent verbal and written communication skills About Us  DocuSign¬Æ helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that‚Äôs a good thing.  DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

description: About The Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated individual to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel. The right candidate isn‚Äôt afraid of cold calling or striking up a conversation with someone they just met. They think outside the box, by iterating on a pitch deck, crafting a convincing email proposal or supporting a teammate on closing a deal. This role is ideal for someone who has just started their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.  Key Responsibilities  Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls and emails Adapting a more targeted approach to more strategic clients Research, prospect and engage new corporate partners in ClassPass markets Continue developing understanding of HR/Benefits world and how ClassPass fits in Manage opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Regularly communicate successes and roadblocks to manager to better inform the team‚Äôs goals and targets Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways to connect and build out your relationships with potential partners and share across the team Set high quality meetings for the Corporate Sales Team Achieve and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics  Skills & Experience  Recently graduated or <1 year in sales A natural problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals Strong relationship builder with the ability to collaborate Willingness to make multiple phone and email contacts per day Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM preferred Right to work in Singapore  Who we are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world‚Äôs best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world‚Äôs leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we‚Äôre just getting started.  What we believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we‚Äôre all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass‚Äô success is its people.  ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.

description: The Company You‚Äôll Join  At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid.  We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment; others live on the debt stack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they‚Äôve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners.  At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft.  To learn more, here is what one of our investors wrote about leading our Series F.  The Team You‚Äôll Work With  Carta is looking for a Business Development Associate to join our Singapore team.  Carta expanded to Singapore in 2021, and we are building a world-class team to support the startup ecosystem across Asia Pacific. The Singapore team is lean and agile, comprising of local venture industry experts and Carta veterans.  As the first Business Development Associate hire, you will be part of a highly dynamic and diverse group of people who are responsible for every aspect of Carta‚Äôs growth across Asia. You will work closely with each member of our Singapore team, with a focus on Go-to-Market and Delivery functions. You will become an expert in private markets and venture capital operations. You will work closely with our Go-to-Market and Delivery Leads and learn key skills in sales development, deal making/negotiations, and client management.  The Problems You‚Äôll Solve  Business Demand Generation Match prospect pain points to specific value propositions across varying buyer personas, roles, and functions Drive top of funnel interest by creating and managing outreach campaigns to startup founders and employees Work with Go-to-Market Leads in identifying, establishing, and cultivating relationships with key ecosystem partners Customer and Partner Delivery and Support Develop an in-depth understanding of the software platform and all of Carta‚Äôs business units to support our clients across early-stage startups, growth-stage companies, and venture capital and private equity funds Help triage and resolve new and existing user and prospect inquiries Manage early stage customer implementations from signup to go-live Data and Process Integrity & Maintenance Build and manage sizable prospect and customer datasets in order to glean unique insights and drive desirable business outcomes Ensure data integrity across critical business systems (e.g. Salesforce, Outreach, Marketo, and Carta) Manage and schedule new business engagements cross functionally The Impact You‚Äôll Have  As a Business Development Associate, you will be part of a small team managing all commercial aspects of Carta‚Äôs growth in Asia. You will drive demand, develop and iterate on critical internal operations, onboard customers, and provide ongoing customer relationship management and support.  About You Passionate about creating more equality in the world Low-ego personality capable of thriving in a high velocity environment Comfortable getting things wrong and learning from your mistakes Ability to professionally communicate to founders, CEOs, and other high level executives Ability to absorb and articulate technical software and financial concepts related to enterprise software and venture capital Nice To Have Experience managing data in a CRM system (Preferably: Salesforce) Knowledge of finance and accounting Experience working at a high-growth software company, venture capital firm, investment bank, or management consulting firm We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, connect with us via email at recruiting@carta.com . As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.
