The Role  Description  Semperis is looking for a talented and entrepreneurial individual to j oin our Business Development Representative (BDR) team . BDRs play a critical role in driving sales by generating qualified leads from both inbound and outbound sources, profiling prospective clients, and providing valuable feedback on the effectiveness of our sales and marketing campaigns. This role will be critical in our company‚Äôs development of the APAC region as a high-growth market.  Responsibilities   Develop and cold call targeted list of prospects as well as qualify inbound leads according to the established lead qualification framework Conduct lead generation activities following best practices and processes provided in the sales development playbook, and provide feedback for process improvement based on insights gathered from the field Interact with prospects via cold calls, emails, and platforms such as LinkedIn to develop an interest in Semperis‚Äôs offerings Effectively communicate Semperis‚Äôs value proposition and both functional and technical attributes of Semperis‚Äôs offerings to Technical Practitioners, Corporate Directors, and C-Level Executives. Partner with assigned Account Executives to develop a go-to-market strategy in your territory Consistently achieve assigned lead generation quotas and performance goals Update and maintain prospect information and sales activities on systems such as Outreach and Salesforce.com Provide Account Executives with detailed notes on prospect interaction and deal insights to ensure the opportunity is understood, and next steps are clearly defined during Sales Qualified Lead handover Continually seek knowledge on industry best practices, Semperis‚Äôs product offerings, competitive landscape, client use cases, and compelling events to help perform your duties Requirements  1 + years of B2B technology Sales, Business Development, or Inside Sales experience Our available role requires fluent English speaking. Additional language nice to have: Mandarin, Thai, Korean Self-starter with proven success in outbound (cold calling experience is required) and inbound lead generation in competitive and results-driven environments Excellent interpersonal skills Excellent working knowledge of inbound & outbound technologies and tools Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficient with sales technology tools including CRM (Salesforce.com experience is strongly preferred), sales engagement platforms, and Microsoft Office Ability to collaborate effectively with all levels of the organization including sales, marketing, product, and engineering Business experience with the APAC market and understanding of Asian culture preferred Cybersecurity or Tech start-up experience preferred Please add your salary expectations to your application The Semperis Story  Semperis combines world-class expertise and leading-edge technology to deliver identity-driven enterprise protection. Our customer-vetted technology is trusted around the globe. Semperis‚Äô product platform provides a fully automated Active Directory Disaster Recovery solution, as well as total visibility into directory services modifications, granular restores, and speedy remediation of Active Directory disasters.  Semperis puts people first.  From our customers and partners to our culture of engineers and experts, we understand that people are our assets. Our talented employees, contribute to the Semperis culture that champions strategic vision, innovation, intelligent and precise solutions.  Working as a team alongside our world-class technical experts is both interesting and developing, and leads to ‚ÄúForce for Good‚Äù products.  We believe our success is led by teamwork, diversity, eye-level management, personal and professional development, and reaching self-fulfillment. With teams in the USA, Canada, Israel, Europe, and APAC; you‚Äôll be working alongside top Technology & Security experts from all over the world without a preference for culture, gender, race, age, or religion; we believe in people!

description: Our sales team is made up of expert storytellers and problem-solvers and we‚Äôre obsessed with expanding cryptocurrency markets and helping customers track and prevent fraud and abuse. Our goal is to make sure both public sector agencies, cryptocurrency businesses and financial institutions see the value of implementing our solutions.  Our Inside Sales Representative for APAC can quickly establish trust within strategic customers and they are an expert at navigating complex sales cycles. We measure success by new business and account expansion revenue.  In one year you‚Äôll know you were successful if‚Ä¶ You exceeded your quota and substantially increased our foothold in the APAC market through strategic and relentless prospecting and developing your sales pipeline You‚Äôve helped us develop compelling product positioning and messaging specific to market trends, competitive drivers, region-specific sales channels, and more Your relationships with customers are built on trust and transparency resulting in network referrals that ultimately build Chainalysis‚Äô brand awareness You‚Äôve created and executed go-to-market plans that have resulted in predictable and increasing quarterly forecasts You‚Äôve built a diverse pipeline of opportunities resulting in consistent and accurate forecasting You have managed and structured our relationships with the local resellers and distributors You have relationships across departments at Chainalysis allowing you to provide expert advice to prospects related to technical concepts, product roadmaps, solutions implementations, training, and more. A Background Like This Helps B2B SaaS sales mostly focused on the private sector in APAC (Cryptocurrency Businesses) B2B SaaS sales across different verticals including Financial Institutions and Cyber security Both written and spoken fluency in English for the purposes of communicating with Chainalysis‚Äô offices around the world and with customers in APAC Additional language skills in Chinese or Thai would be a plus Experience leading the entire sales process from discovery calls to contract negotiation to closing deals Experience dealing with resellers & Distributors to extend our reach in the local market. Experience dealing with blockchain use cases At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we‚Äôre ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women‚Äôs Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant‚Äôs Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.  Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA Employees are not required to attend in-person meetings at this time. All in-person, Chainalysis attendees must be vaccinated* prior to the in-person event/meeting You must follow cleaning protocols. This includes washing your hands before and after meetings or using a disinfectant or alcohol solution with at least 70% alcohol If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, they must immediately notify the People team *A USA employee is considered fully vaccinated if they meet any of the following criteria: It has been 2 weeks since their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or It has been 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson‚Äôs Janssen vaccine, or A person has recovered from a COVID-19 infection and was treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma and are within 90 days of the treatment. Please note that once 90 days has passed after the monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma treatment, an employee will not be permitted to meet in-person or go to a customer meeting until they meet the above criteria of being fully vaccinated Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA  As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines: International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC  With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.

description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Sales Associate is responsible for generating leads and qualifying inbound sales enquiries and generating reports to track prospects service level. description: About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses ‚Äì small, medium or large ‚Äì thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow‚Äôs world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Role  This position will serve in the front-line of the sales process. This client-facing role will assist in driving revenue growth by filling the top-of-funnel sales pipeline with qualified leads. This individual will be responsible for working within a Sales Development team, sitting within the wider Inside Sales team, to achieve both personal and team sales goals for their assigned Territory or Region.  As a successful Sales Development Representative you will be expected to:  Nurture, develop, and handoff leads that result in qualified opportunities to the Sales team Own a territory and be responsible for driving qualified tours and handoffs to accelerate sales performance Own the sales process: contact identification, lead qualification, prospecting, pipeline building and opportunity identification Work with automation platforms to efficiently input and track data Execute strategy and process implemented by Inside Sales Leadership Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and effectively communicate our value proposition to prospects Provide unmatched customer service to potential prospects to ensure an excellent start to their member experience  Experience And Requirements  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree At least 6 months of professional experience in sales or related industry Experience in working and thriving in a fast paced environment Track record of sales in cold calling and emailing are helpful Comfortable using marketing automation platforms and CRM ‚Äì Salesforce experience highly desirable Demonstrated experience in prospecting, developing and handing off sales Experience in customer service and relationship building are highly desirable Experience working on a team and leading a team player mentality Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Fluent verbal and written English, and a second language of written and verbal Bahasa Indonesia is an added advantage to support Indonesia market that speak Bahasa dominantly Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skill  We will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and who do not require VISA sponsorship from WeWork.  Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you‚Äîbecause together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.

description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work.  You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what‚Äôs right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life.  Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you‚Äôll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales and Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements.  Our teams‚Äô partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) will make outbound calls to potential clients who have expressed interest in learning more about DocuSign or appear to be strong potential customers based upon our general market focus. The SDR qualifies prospective customers through targeted questions about their business strategy then leveraging this information to align and sell DocuSign‚Äôs product offerings.  This position spends roughly 80% of the time on the phone prospecting new clients. Sales Development Reps will receive hands on training with an emphasis on strategic selling and a focus on researching targeted accounts. This position is a great way for individuals to gain in depth experience in a rapidly growing SaaS company.  This position reports to the Manager of Sales Development and is designated flex.  Responsibilities Manage a pipeline of market generated leads, making outbound calls to prospects who have expressed interest in DocuSign‚Äôs brand / product offering. Communicate with the customer to understand their business process and intentions, educating on where & how DocuSign solutions could align. Discern propensity to buy and forward qualified leads to the Account Executive team to pursue Schedule appointments between prospects and Account Executives Ensure accurate recording of all necessary information on our CRM. Basic Qualifications A university degree or relevant tertiary qualification Preferred Qualifications Prior experience working in sales A driven, enthusiastic and hard-working nature The ability to form strong business relationships Excellent verbal and written communication skills About Us  DocuSign¬Æ helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that‚Äôs a good thing.  DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

Ideal candidates will have trade and marketing experiences across in-app (e.g. campaigns management) & out-of-app channels (e.g. digital marketing, out-of-home advertising) and possess strong commercial acumen. They will be proficient at strategizing, managing and executing multiple workstreams.  Job Description Align in-app and out-of-app messaging across all marketing assets: campaigns, EDMs, digital online marketing channels, affiliates etc, in line with the overall marketing campaigns calendar Ensure consistency in the Shopee Supermarket branding and USP across all marketing activities Develop CRM strategies and work with Retail and Marketing teams to execute CRM initiatives, targeting all stages of customer life cycle (e.g. non-buyers, early life, mature, churned) Define key themes and campaigns with Marketing teams, identify resources needed across various marketing channels, and then coordinate across the relevant PICs to plan and execute campaigns in a timely manner Work closely with merchandisers, brands or suppliers to optimise marketing activities and drive sales Monitor customer traffic & conversions versus available stocks and operational constraints regularly. Identify trends for continuous improvement Conduct regular research of competitor activity and incorporate the insights to seasonal plans Drive cross-functional initiatives and work closely with the teams in Merchandising, Marketing, Operations to deliver on Shopee Supermarket√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s key selling points  Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing or STEM disciplines, or advanced degrees in any field Minimum 4 years marketing or customer engagement experiences from a retail or FMCG company, or equivalent experiences from management consulting firm Deep understanding of consumer behaviour in grocery shopping and in the Singapore market Analytical skills and ability to make data-drive decisions in a commercial and marketing context Project and time management skills to prioritise and manage diverse workstreams concurrently Commercial acumen and strong problem-solving ability Ability to lead and manage cross functional internal and external relationships Strong communication, presentation, negotiation and influencing skills Attention to detail and quality control Track record of innovation and creativity

description: Scandit is currently expanding our business development organization in Tokyo, London and Boston. You will focus on our target accounts in a region and vertical. You will play a key role in generating new business opportunities by offering Scandit's disruptive computer vision, augmented reality and machine learning solutions to enterprise and mid-sized customers.  Come join Scandit where you will enjoy success, develop your professional skills and allow your career to thrive within a fast growing entrepreneurial environment. We are looking for English and Chinese Mandarin speakers to join this expanding global team.  What You Will Do  Generate pre sale opportunities through targeted outreach via phone, email, social and others. Research named accounts based on quarterly performance, organisational challenges, executive personnel changes, market conditions, and existing technology. Orchestrate discussions with senior executives around their business needs Set up meetings and demos for Account Executives Maintain lead, account, contact, and opportunity data across multiple CRM platforms. Keep detailed and accurate notes of all sales related activities Work closely with the Account Executives by country and/or vertical.  Who You Are  You have between 0-18 months of experience in SaaS sales. (8+ months preferred) You have some experience in retail, transport & logistics, manufacturing or healthcare. You have a strong desire to learn and succeed in technology/software sales You have the ability to excel in an environment with multiple competing responsibilities. You have excellent interpersonal, written, and spoken communication skills You have energy, enthusiasm, commitment to detail and results oriented. You have the ability to think on your feet and display good judgement. You have native level fluency in English and ideally Chinese Mandarin or Korean  Who We Are  Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones, and robots.  Scandit‚Äôs mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation and logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit‚Äôs technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.  Many of the world‚Äôs most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit‚Äôs enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.  ‚ÄúEverybody is welcome here‚Äù - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.  At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.  All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand ‚Äì and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  ABOUT THE JOB  Reporting to the Shopkeeper of the respective Home Furnishing Business, the Sales Associate provides excellent sales service to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction and ensures the IKEA basic merchandising standards are in place to give customers a positive shopping experience. Ensuring your department is clean and tidy, with items properly displayed, priced and fully stocked. Actively steering top selling and prioritized products to maximize sales. Qualifications You are customer-service oriented and passionate about driving business You are a problem-solver, independent worker and a strong team player You have strong communication and interpersonal skills You are physically fit to handle physical work and long hours of standing You are able to commit to working on rotating shift (20 hours per week), including weekdays, weekends and public holidays

description: Rackspace Technology is a leading end-to-end multicloud technology services company. We can design, build and operate our customers‚Äô cloud environments across all major technology platforms, irrespective of technology stack or deployment model. We partner with our customers at every stage of their cloud journey, enabling them to modernize applications, build new products and adopt innovative technologies.  The Sales Development Rep or Inside Sales Rep is responsible for proactive outbound prospecting and inbound lead follow-up to generate new business opportunities. Reporting to Marketing, the candidate will work closely with Marketing, Sales and Alliance teams to identify targeted customers and develop effective messaging for prospecting.  Key Responsibilities Build sales pipeline and source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails.Proactively prospect for new business opportunities within a specific set of named accounts. Achieve monthly and quarterly sales bookings targets. Exceed monthly targets of new sales opportunities and meetings booked. Collaborate with Field Sales and Marketing and keep up to date with the local Go-To-Market and business priorities. Navigate org charts through outbound prospecting to identify new opportunities. Secures in person or virtual meetings for Field sellers; completes hand off of information to seller. Manage relationship-building activities to keep leads ‚Äúwarm‚Äù. Build and maintain a constant/future pipeline Research markets and industries to identify potential customers and makes first contact. Maintain up-to-date knowledge on the cloud computing market and maintain a thorough understanding of Rackspace Technology solutions offerings. Maintain records accuracy (account, opportunity and activity details) in Salesforce and frequently report on results and activities progress. Prepares and analyzes leads pipeline reports and dashboards. Knowledge/Experience Leads generation expertise to include the ability to identify and develop new business prospects from multiple sources including prospect lists, discovery and individual research. Conduct a needs analysis and determine prospects pain points to determine how the Rackspace solution will speak to those needs. Identify key buying influencers within these prospects to determine budget and timeline. Uses knowledge of how the team integrates with others to accomplish the team objectives. Builds and cultivates prospect relationships by initiating interactions and conducting follow-up communications in order to move opportunities through the sales funnel. Basic knowledge of simple configurations in cloud computing preferred. Uses communication skills to regularly exchange information, escalate issues and effectively share expertise within the team. Bachelor's Degree required; Sales, Marketing, Business or a related field. At the manager‚Äôs discretion a diploma or equivalent plus an additional 3 years of relevant call center and/or sales experience may substitute for the degree requirement. A sales management degree and internship may substitute for the relevant experience. Ability to perform at the proficiency and autonomy required of the role, typically found with 1-2 years of related experience, preferably in telemarketing and/or inside sales in an IT industry. Skills Self-motivated, sense of urgency and strong customer focus. Thrives in a fast-paced and evolving environment. Excellent negotiation, influencing, presentation and problem solving skills. Strong interpersonal and networking capabilities. Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. Ability to take self-initiative, be proactive and ability to multitask, prioritize workload A good working knowledge of Salesforce.com or similar CRM as well as a marketing automation platform e.g. Marketo, Outreach, Salesforce Marketing Cloud. Team player ‚Äì position is cross-functional and requires significant teamwork. About Rackspace Technology  We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world‚Äôs leading technologies ‚Äî across applications, data and security ‚Äî to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.  More on Rackspace Technology  Though we‚Äôre all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. description: About Aspire: Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.   In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don‚Äôt take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.    About the Role: You will be reporting to the Sales Manager. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team into 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure they fully utilize their account.    What will you be doing?  Hunt startups in APAC that are raising capital and who are in need of a corporate account to receive funding Perform prospecting activities such as cold calling and networking Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps Drive referrals by your exceptional work  Identify best practices to refine the company‚Äôs lead generation playbook Keep all records in our CRM  Report to Sales Manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree OR at least 2-3 years of relevant work experience Hunting new opportunities is in your blood  Possess a track record of being a top producer in your previous companies  Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills via phone (cold calling) and email Experience with a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard/CardUp) is a big plus (Commercial Card) & knowledge of the commercial card market in Singapore (and SEA ideally)  OR Experience with a remittance company (WorldFirst/Wise/Instarem/Wallex/SingX) is a big plus (FX) Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization

description: Imply, founded by the original creators of Apache Druid, is originating and leading a new category of data analytics focused on analytics-in-motion. With analytics-in-motion, organizations can move away from analytics solutions that are static, difficult to scale, delayed and expensive, and towards analytics solutions that are interactive, highly scalable, real-time and cost effective.  According to our Series C lead investor, Bessemer Venture Partners, Imply is "upending the world of analytics, as it is now a competitive disadvantage to wait hours or days to iterate on insights, to make decisions based on stale data, or to leverage solutions that either crumble or cost a fortune at scale."  Every day, more and more established enterprises and digital natives realize the power of Analytics-in-Motion, and we are far ahead in this race to redefine analytics across the enterprise, with numerous marquee customers and demonstrated customer success worldwide.  Imply is Series C funded, with A16Z and Bessemer Venture Partners as our lead investors. Join our high-performing team!  The Role:  We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Sales Development Representative to come aboard! Our SDRs generate leads and build customer pipelines. This is a role with a dedicated growth path and the training to be a great technical sales professional. We are looking for self-starters with a passion for technology and people. Preferred location Singapore but open to Hong Kong based candidates.  Responsibilities: Research heavily into accounts to maximize the value of outreach Generate appointments by means of proactive outbound prospecting and lead activity management in an effort to qualify and market our solutions to potential customers Work directly with marketing to discover opportunities from leads, and set appointments from those leads Use of strong selling and influencing skills to set up qualified appointments Understand Imply's technology enough to provide a high level introduction Leverage taught sales techniques to maximize customer interactions Log, track, and maintain outbound activity Work closely with Sales Directors and attend customer meetings as required Attend sales meetings, vendor training, and local trade shows to keep current with technology  Requirements: Four year college degree from an accredited institution 5+ years experience with 2+ in pipeline generation activities English/Mandarin bi-lingual requirement A passion for research as well as a strong in-person, phone, and written customer communication skills Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Ability to make formal and informal presentations to staff and clients Ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based on the needs of the department or business goals Strong PC skills required; knowledge of Salesforce.com a plus Ability to manage time effectively, work independently, and be self-motivated Prior track record of achievement in positions with significant accountability Interested in pursuing a career in technology Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment Proactive, independent thinker with high energy/positive attitude Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills  Imply is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Please note, applications and candidate submissions are subject to our privacy policy and, for California residents, the CCPA terms available at https://imply.io/privacy.

description: Who We Are  Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Burger King, Delivery Hero, HBO Max, Mercari, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale ‚Äì each month, hundreds of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 3 billion active users through Braze.  Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Cross-Channel Campaign Management (Independent Platforms), Q3 2021, and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for the fourth consecutive year. The company has also been selected as one of Fortune‚Äôs Best Workplace for Millennials in 2021, and was ranked #20 on Fortune‚Äôs Best Medium Sized Workplaces in 2021. Braze is certified as a Great Place to Work in the UK and the U.S. and is recognized as one of the UK's Best Workplaces for Women.  What We're Looking For  The Business Development Representative (also known as "BDR") will generate new business opportunities ("Pipeline") by following proven processes to prospect into Enterprise accounts. You‚Äôll learn how to identify and research lists of companies and leads to target, and how to develop email and telephone campaigns to generate new business opportunities.  The BDR will conduct high-level conversations with senior executives about their business and marketing issues and operations ("Qualification"). The successful candidate will be a strongly self-motivated and driven individual who is goal-oriented, methodical and tenacious, and can effectively interact with a team.  This position has advancement potential within the Sales organization, and the compensation package includes an uncapped commission structure.  What You Can Expect Learn and execute proven processes to generate new sales opportunities Strategize with top-producing account executives Engage executives in targeted prospect accounts Orchestrate discussions with senior execs around their business needs Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects Leverage CRM tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and verticals Who You Are Coachable Confident Speak eloquently Positive "can-do" attitude, no entitlement psychology tolerated Desire to hustle and prove oneself Some experience (Summer job, internship) hustling - knocking on doors, making dials, etc. Experience using some sort of CRM system in the past (Salesforce.com ideal!) Bonus Points: Some technical experience in background (built an app, website, took coding courses, etc.) Played team sports competitively in past What We Offer Competitive compensation that includes equity Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.  If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

description: BigSpring is a mobile lifelong skilling platform with a mission to provide a direct path to employment for everyone. We empower people with the market-relevant skills they need to be gainfully employed and enjoy a high quality of life, and enable employers to measure ROI from learning to establish it as a core business driver - not a discretionary expense. BigSpring's reach extends globally across over a million learners with customers such as Uber, Google, United Technologies, Tata Steel, and others. The platform offers lifelong skilling for every worker and every job, with use cases including enhancing consumer financial literacy and driving sales channel productivity.  BigSpring was recently covered by Forbes and The Innovator and awarded as a "Technology Pioneer 2020" by the World Economic Forum for our cutting-edge technology and impact (past recipients included Google, Twitter, Spotify, Palantir Technologies, Airtable, and others).  About The Role  As a world-class Mid-Market Sales Representative, you will play a central role in scaling our Go-to-Market team by driving the full sales cycle from pipeline generation to winning new customers. You will build and close a sales pipeline by engaging in professional conversations with executives from targeted companies to drive interest, qualifying inbound demand, and demonstrating strong sales skills to drive the sales process to closure. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen and communication skills and be both persistent and resilient in striving to exceed goals.  As the first touch point with customers, you will play a key role in establishing BigSpring as a differentiated SaaS platform that focuses on creating value for each prospect & customer. You will need to partner cross-functionally with the Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to help build and execute repeatable sales plays.  For the right person that can bring passion, drive, and innovation to a fast-growing global company, this position offers the unique opportunity to have a considerable impact on the rapid growth of BigSpring. You can build your professional skills and develop an incredibly successful career at BigSpring.  In this role you'll: Engage and evaluate inbound leads with precise qualification Build and execute repeatable outbound prospecting sales plays to build pipeline with high velocity Research & track target companies to understand how BigSpring's solutions can add value to their organization Develop, test, and iterate messaging across multiple industries, use cases, and personas Codify and contribute learnings and best practices to the sales strategy Use a data driven approach to identify success criteria and accelerate sales cycles Leverage your sales acumen to identify decision makers early and progress the sales at each interaction Remotely deliver compelling product demos Track, report, and maintain prospects within CRM database to maximize productivity Consistently achieve weekly and monthly activity metrics & quota targets  What you'll bring to the team: 5+ years of work experience; Bachelor's Degree Quota carrying mid-market and/or enterprise sales experience at a technology company is a big plus You have the aptitude to quickly learn new technologies and industries Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional telephone presence Consistent track record of top performance in prior roles Thrive in high volume & high velocity environments Comfortable working with high degrees of autonomy in a global team. Self-starter with the hunger to be great Thrive in ambiguity and are able to create processes to drive productivity Singapore citizenship or Permanent Residence  Why you'll love working here: You'll be part of an innovation-driven, high-growth company on a mission to improve people's lives Competitive compensation package Flexible vacation and PTO Female Founder/CEO Supportive, highly collaborative team environment Bi-Weekly Learning Sessions  BigSpring is an Equal Opportunity Employer. BigSpring does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. You must have authorization to work in the location the position is posted.

Our Team Values:     ‚Ä¢  Fun Loving: We are very serious about work and our goals, but beneath our professional exterior, we are really a bunch of people who love to have fun.      ‚Ä¢  Resilient: We are a team of hard-working individuals that strive to get the job done in the best possible manner. Being open to changes & having the courage to step out of your comfort zone  What We Offer:     ‚Ä¢  1 to 1 coaching     ‚Ä¢  No experience required     ‚Ä¢  Fun and enjoyable work environment     ‚Ä¢  Traveling opportunities     ‚Ä¢  Fast career progression & personal development

Responsibilities:  Establish working relationships with key clients and stakeholders and become a trusted advisor who will understand their requirements and challenges Manage client's IT and business satisfaction in the delivery of IT services and ensure profit objectives are met Provide leadership to business development teams in identifying new business opportunities and manage end-to-end sales cycle, particularly in growing existing business in the account Engage with principal, partners, and suppliers in sales activities on IT products and services of the Company Ensure sales targets are achieved and maintain good customer rapport Monitor market conditions and recommend pricing and market strategy Investigate customer's complaints on quality, delivery, service etc and provide corrective measures Present, negotiate and prepare contracts, quotations, etc   Requirements:  Minimum a Diploma in IT or equivalent 1 year of working experience preferably in IT sales or business development role Possess strong initiative, people networking and creativity skills Proven sales track record Disciplined and driven to develop sales account plans and upkeep sales forecast & hygiene Established relationship with enterprise customers will be a bonus

description: The Company You‚Äôll Join  At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid.  We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment; others live on the debt stack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they‚Äôve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners.  At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft.  Learn more about our Series G fundraising round here .  The Team You‚Äôll Work With  Carta is looking for a Business Development Associate to join our Singapore team.  Carta expanded to Singapore in 2021, and we are building a world-class team to support the startup ecosystem across Asia Pacific. The Singapore team is lean and agile, comprising of local venture industry experts and tenured Cartans.  You will be part of a highly dynamic and diverse group of people who are responsible for every aspect of Carta‚Äôs growth across Asia. You will work closely with each member of our Singapore team, with a focus on business development. You will become an expert in private markets and venture capital operations. You will work closely with our Go-to-Market and Delivery Leads and learn key skills in sales development, deal making/negotiations, and client management.  The Problems You‚Äôll Solve  Business Demand Generation Outreach - Execute thoughtful, "every lead matters" cold outreach campaigns to fund managers in the venture space Prospect - Engage with fund managers who reach out to Carta with interest via our website, LinkedIn, and in-product Collaborate - Work with GTM Lead / BD Manager in identifying, establishing, and cultivating relationships with prospects, and follow deals through closing Customer and Partner Delivery and Support Develop an in-depth understanding of the software platform and Carta IS fund services offering to support our clients across venture capital and growth equity funds Address and resolve new prospects‚Äô inquiries Support nurturing relationship with our channel partners, including but not limited to law firms and tax/audit advisors Data and Process Integrity & Maintenance Build and own sizable prospect and customer datasets in order to glean unique insights and drive desirable business outcomes Ensure data integrity across critical business systems (e.g. Salesforce, Outreach, Marketo, and Carta) Manage and schedule new business engagements cross functionally The Impact You‚Äôll Have  As our first Investor Services BD Associate, you will be part of a small team managing all commercial aspects of Carta‚Äôs growth in Asia. You will drive demand, develop and iterate on critical internal and outbound operations, and provide ongoing customer relationship support. You will be part of the inaugural team in Asia, helping build the infrastructure powering venture capital, private equity, and private companies in the ecosystem.  About You Passionate about creating more equality in the world Grit - Ambitious, driven, and fearless in the face of rejection Coachability - Tremendous desire to learn about venture capital, Fintech and constantly improve in a ‚Äúno-egos‚Äù environment Comfortable getting things wrong and learning from your mistakes Ability to professionally communicate with venture capitalists, finance executives, CEOs, and other high level executives Emotional Intelligence - Ability to read emotional cues, understand a customer‚Äôs needs, and navigate a conversation Nice To Have Understands how venture fund services and operations help solve liquidity Understanding of fund operations / administration Understanding of venture capital & private equity as an asset class, and/or experience in institutional investing, and wealth management Experience managing data in a CRM system (Preferably: Salesforce) Knowledge of finance and accounting Please note that we will be prioritizing candidates that are Singapore nationals / Permanent Residents, as we are not able to provide sponsorship for this role. Carta is a Series G company and is backed by top-tier investors like EDBI, Silver Lake, Andreessen Horowitz, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Meritech Capital, and more.  We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, connect with us via email at recruiting@carta.com . As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.

description: As a Customer Experience Specialist, you will join a service and sales focused team in high energy call center environment, focused on listening to, caring for and connecting with customers. In this role, you will answer calls in an efficient, courteous and accurate manner, while assessing customer needs and offering solutions and additional products. Ideal candidates should demonstrate the desire to make our customer's travel not only superior but memorable.  This position is full-time with comprehensive health and wellness benefits, performance incentive programs, and Delta's industry-leading travel privileges.   Customer Experience Specialists connect with customers via phone and create an experience where customers know they have been heard and understood and feel valued and important, which is accomplished by:  Effectively listening Quickly identifying and owning customer issues Actively search for solutions to problems Making quality decisions Interacting with a globally diverse group of customers and colleagues  Specialists consistently sell travel related services, including car rental and credit card vendor partner products. Customer Experience Specialists demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills, a professional attitude, excellent dependability, the ability to handle stressful situations, possess strong computer skills, flexibility in a fast-paced environment, and the ability to learn and react quickly. Specialists must understand and adhere to all Delta and U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) compliance requirements.  Employees will have future opportunities to progress to specialty teams that respond to customer escalations or resolve complex international ticketing issues. As Delta continues to offer new ways for our customers to connect with us, Specialists may also have opportunities to assist customers via Twitter, Facebook or other emerging social media platforms.  WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED (MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS) Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority Possess correct legal documentation to live and work in Singapore Be fluent written and verbally in English This role requires computer skills and comfort with navigating software applications, email, instant messaging, and internet searches. Must be able to demonstrate clear, pleasant, and courteous verbal and written communication using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation Must have a flexible schedule as this position will require you to work weekends, holidays and including night shift Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. Preferred education requirement for this position is an A-Level, O-Level, or HS Diploma (equivalent accepted). Consideration will be given to candidates with an N-Level if they also have a Polytechnic Diploma (equivalent accepted), WSQ Level 7, or 6 years of work experience.  WHAT WILL GIVE YOU A COMPETITIVE EDGE (PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS) At least one year of experience working in sales At least one year of experience providing customer service   Urgently hiring! For IMMEDIATE consideration, please apply directly by using the provided link:  https://delta.avature.net/careers/JobDetail/Customer-Experience-Specialist-SIN/7814

Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Do you enjoy working as part of a team? Could you make the difference to a customer‚Äôs day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...  Here at COS we are recruiting a sales assistant to join our Singapore store. The role is part time and able to work retail hours, including weekends and public holidays.  About COS‚Ä¶  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings‚Äô original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.  About The Role‚Ä¶  Job Description  Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include: Offering our customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them to create great outfits Processing deliveries & stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the shop floor Stock replenishment Selling to customers at the cash desk, fitting room and on the shop floor About You...  Qualifications  To work as a sales assistant, previous experience is not essential. Instead we look for people with the qualities below Customer focused Self-motivated & positive Considerate Adaptable A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Additional Information  Why choose COS?  When you first join COS we will give you a full training plan and pay you an hourly rate of SGD up to $9 . In addition to this you will also receive: 25% staff discount Up to SGD 520 per year clothing allowance Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.  We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.

description: A Bit About Whispir  Whispir is a cloud software and communications platform that seeks to help organisations communicate like people. Our platform enables our customers to build powerful communications workflows and automate interactions between systems, business, devices and people - with no coding required.  The outcomes are powerful ‚Äì people everywhere can have access to the right information at the right time so that they can make informed decisions, take action, engage and communicate with each other.  Organisations can finally start to behave how they have always wanted to ‚Äì they can engage with people the way people do... in a timely, personal and contextually sensitive way with actionable, useful insights that promote richer and deeper engagement.  We know this because leading organisations use Whispir's technology locally and globally every day for this reason. Whispir becomes their competitive advantage as they streamline their operations, improve their resilience and bring innovative new services to market quickly. We also see first-hand the capacity of these innovative solutions to assist saving lives and materially improve community outcomes.  Role Description:  As an outbound Sales Development Representative, you will be a key part of our sales and growth efforts. You will work closely with our existing Sales Development Representative and our team of Account Executives. You will be reaching out to decision makers and influencers in midsize companies across a range of different industries, providing engaging content and insights that explain why Whispir can help their company/organization. You will have a suite of tools at your disposal including Outreach, Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other lead mining and research tools. You will have the support of the sales and marketing team to train and equip you with the knowledge you need to do your job. Success will come from being a great listener, highly organized with plenty of energy and enthusiasm for hitting your personal goals and being accountable for helping your team win.  Main Responsibilities: Outbound emailing (high volume, supported by specialized software tools) Outbound prospecting calls, using Outreach (40 - 50 per day, supported by software) Fast and proficient research via social media and google Salesforce lead and list management Efficient use of sales enablement software (Outreach) Lead and activity management and tracking Maintaining a high volume of activities Responsibility for your daily and weekly reporting  Key skills/Attributes required: 1-3 years sales experience Hunter mentality Great listening skills and ability to quickly become a trusted resource for decision-makers Strong communication and objection handling skills  Why we think you will love working at Whispir: Uncapped commission Leadership Training - Grow your career with Whispir and take advantage of our future leadership training program with specialised training. Engage Humanity - Take advantage of our Engage Humanity program and give back to our community with a day of leave available provided. In-House Barista and Concierge - Meet colleagues at the Whispir Social Club for a morning coffee or an evening beverage hosted by our in-house concierge. Health and Wellbeing - Expand your personal mental and health with our dedicated personal training and employee assistance program.  You are encouraged to discuss with your direct manager any systems or solutions you deem useful for performing your duties and managing your obligations with respect to the scope of this position description.  Please note that this position description is not intended to constitute a complete list of your duties. You may be required to carry out other duties consistent with the position. Further, the Company may also, from time to time and at its discretion, change your duties in any reasonable manner after consultation with you.  Diversity & Inclusion  Whispir places a high value on inclusion. Those from under represented communities are encouraged to apply. This includes, but is definitely not limited to, people with a lived-experience of mental ill health, culturally and linguistically diverse people, LGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.  We take our core values seriously and work hard to create an environment where you feel welcomed. Teams who reflect a diversity of experience, identity, perspective, and background help us to create a healthy & inclusive working culture  If this has resonated with you, we look forward to hearing from you soon!

description: The Role: With continuous field training, you will be assisting our Business Development team with campaigns to identify potential clients throughout Asia Pacific by reviewing their current market data strategy and trading solutions, and discussing how the features involved with our solutions could help improve their performance. You will also develop your domain and product knowledge with specific assignments with our Client Services team, supporting the maintenance of existing accounts.  The Impact: You will be helping in targeted campaigns planning to engage with prospects and existing clients to cover QuantHouse Solutions products and solutions. This will be done by working with marketing channels to help create targeted campaigns, both virtual and physical, and doing the follow-up.  You will also take advantage of incoming leads and be responsible for building on them and transforming them into qualified projects for the team or filing them for future efforts when you come too early in the project process. Identifying decision makers, maintaining and expanding the database of prospects and building standard quotations will also be part of your duties.  The Career Opportunity: The natural career path will be to grow into Sales, Pre-Sales and Project Management roles among others within the group.  The Skills: We want to hear from candidates who are highly articulate and able to demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills and are competent in excelling over the phone in a consultative environment. Looking for a challenging role, candidates must also be target-driven, highly motivated and excited about developing relationships over the phone and on the field. A concurrent interest and appetite to learn the technical aspects of capital markets technologies and market data systems is essential, with the capacity to handle level 2 support for our client within the first year an evidence of success.   Key Responsibilities will include but not limited to:  Prospecting and qualifying campaign related or inbound leads through calling and emailing campaigns Researching new prospective clients and carrying out proprietary email campaigns Creating and releasing targeted messaging through various media Calling ‚Äúsuspect‚Äù and prospective clients Maintaining and updating the corporate CRM Coordination of ongoing sales opportunities created by the Inside Sales Assisting in client support issues involving business analysis/market data analysis Maintaining client reports and providing a view on open activities as well as raising any potential issues for escalation in a timely manner Continuously growing technical product knowledge and understanding of global financial markets   Skills & Qualification:  Previous experience in the financial IT services industry is preferred. Previous experience in client services B2B or B2C is preferred Previous experience in trading solutions/support/operations would be advantageous. An undergraduate degree or equivalent is required; all degree subjects will be considered though Commerce, Business Administration, Marketing, Business Management or related degree will be a plus.  Highly autonomous, extremely organized and professional with superior written, verbal and non-verbal communications skills, you will ideally have previous experience with a CRM tool. This person will be focusing on the APAC market and Mandarin is required whilst Cantonese, Japanese or Korean would be a plus given our clients coverage in these areas.  About QuantHouse  QuantHouse provides end-to-end systematic trading solutions including ultra-low latency market data, algo trading development frameworks, proximity hosting and order routing to hedge funds, market makers, proprietary desks, brokers and sell-side firms. Related link: https://www.quanthouse.com  The firm is a wholly owned company of Iress. A market leading technology and software provider for financial markets and services listed on the ASX. Related link: https://www.iress.com

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world‚Äôs largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that‚Äôs anything but dull ‚Äì a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners ‚Äì all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It‚Äôs thanks to them that we have grown ‚Äì with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talent ‚Äì for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can‚Äôt sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You‚Äôll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here‚Äôs what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here‚Äôs how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there‚Äôs no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.

description: Job Description  Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!  F5 empowers creators of the new digital world  The F5 Digital Sales organization is a global sales organization with an opportunity to be a tremendous revenue growth engine for the company. The F5 solution, now combined with NGINX, Shape Security and Volterra bridges the gap between NetOps and DevOps with multi-cloud application services that span from code to customer. This role is part of an exciting new team that is at the forefront of establishing cutting-edge opportunistic sales motions leveraging AI, digital marketing, big data and analytics to drive impactful and targeted sales coverage.  The F5 Multi-Cloud Application Services Platform enables enterprises undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy, monolithic applications, as well as deliver new, microservices-based applications. Companies like Netflix, Starbucks, and McDonalds rely on F5 Networks to reduce costs, improve resiliency, and speed innovation.  F5 Networks is searching for an enthusiastic, eager-to-learn Business Development Representative (BDR) to join the growing sales team in China. If you are an early aspirant in your sales career or looking to work in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, F5 is the perfect place for you!  This position requires previous experience in an outbound role interacting with C-suite buyers. BDR candidates during the interview should not only be able to demonstrate the ability to comprehend F5 Solutions, but also the ability to pitch this effectively to new customers. They will also be expected to articulate how they would be creative and thoughtful in their approach to create market interest and solicit a response from prospects. This position is an in-office role that requires working from the office. However, due to the ongoing COVID pandemic, this role will require working from home as stipulated by the local country and company mandates.  Responsibilities Schedule highly qualified meetings from outbound campaigns within a very select group of targeted major accounts. Mapping the organization hierarchy, identifying new buying centers and engaging different personas within the account (NetOps, SecOps, DevOps, Cloud Architects, Security and Fraud leaders etc). Working closely with Account Executives to refine ideas and develop new strategies to deliver F5‚Äôs message to our buyers. Leverage prospecting tools such as Salesforce‚Äôs High Velocity Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Lusha or other local social media and outbound calling techniques to schedule meetings with identified target accounts. Effectively turn prospects into opportunities and revenue pipeline by qualifying through the PANT criteria (Pain, Authority, Need and Timeline). Collaborate with marketing, field sales, and product teams to facilitate new programs, messaging, campaigns, and offerings. Communicate and engage through video conferencing and navigate phone systems, voicemail systems, front desk operators and administrative assistants to reach intended business contacts. Ensure opportunity handoffs to sales are successful and exceed the customer's satisfaction. Ensure reporting and communications are frequent and bi-directional. Exhibit qualities of overachievement, self-motivation, good teamwork, and positive attitude. Meet and exceed minimum activity metrics: 50 Dials, 10 conversations, and 50 emails per day. Qualifications BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3 years of sales prospecting experience through social media, cold callings, emails and writing qualification notes. Core sales skills related to initiating conversations, uncovering basic needs, connecting needs to high level F5 solution and driving interest in continued discussion with sales team members. Skill in using Salesforce CRM tool for leads management, prospecting, emailing, and calling is a must. Previous experience with technology companies selling SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS is a plus. Fluency in English. F5s culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We‚Äôre a growing company with a startup feel and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If our team has one thing in common, it‚Äôs our passion for a multi-cloud application services and dedication to a global suite of products that‚Äôs loved by a loyal base of F5 fans for over 20 years.  Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, not exceeding 10% of the time spent traveling. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it‚Äôs like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let‚Äôs create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Responsibilities A focused strategic selling role, identifying and driving qualified opportunities from pre-sales to close of business contracts whether it is a master agreement or a single mobile line & equipment contract Close businesses (whether new, win-back or renewal) that will add and maintain overall business and account top line revenue growth while managing and up-selling customers to avert revenue erosion Identify, lead and drive sales focused activities in scoping (prioritizing) and communicating the account opportunities, objectives, strategy and resource requirements (whether new, win-back or renewal businesses) with colleagues like Account managers and marketing managers to achieve a healthy revenue stream for Singtel from the business won or maintained Work with Account managers to identify and qualify to develop an account To lead and conduct regular account discussions with the account managers and account directors to ensure alignment in customer experience To lead and drive the sales process from meeting the customer to scope, prepare sales proposals, conduct presentations, negotiate up to the closing of business with qualified customers Proactively monitor market changes and competition and feedback on important activities (e.g. technical developments, industry trends, new features and services etc.) to Sales and Marketing teams Requirements A diploma or degree is preferred At least 5 years of enterprise sales experience in telco/IT industries, with experience in opportunity and account leadership and a track record of successful sales in complex environments and solutions
