description: Swapcard digitalizes events while preserving the magic of real-life interaction. Behind this dream, stands a passionate, curious, and down-to-earth team. We believe an environment of trust, autonomy, and support is integral to our success. As a result of putting people first, career evolution and rapid growth have become regular commodities. We've even managed to revolutionize our industry through true teamwork, sharing our ideas and listening to each other!  With 39 nationalities amongst a team of more than 168, we enjoy an open-minded environment where opinions and ideas are encouraged and exchanged freely in order to create a product and company we can all be proud of. We‚Äôve also learned that the more moments we share, the more comfortable, communicative, and confident we are when working together. That‚Äôs when the real magic occurs. We‚Äôve made some incredible memories around the globe together so far & it's only the beginning!  We've opened offices in Paris, Montreal, Dubai, Seattle, London, and New Delhi. Where's next for us? Singapore!  Prior to the pandemic, our team supported remote-work. This has helped us transition smoothly to a full-remote company this year. We'll be keeping our HQ in Paris as home base while staying flexible to see what the future holds for our growing team. Currently, we're spread out throughout the world. We're looking for ambitious and curious teammates to take part in this adventure of growing from a start-up to a scale-up.Your focus in this role Outbound sales efforts to targeted accounts Working with Country Manager/Account Executive to identify key targets and build engagement and outreach plans Leverage multi-channel engagement strategies to approach and engage target accounts. Develop sales opportunities with territory to pass to Country Manager/Account Executive Manage inbound lead flow, qualifying in and out opportunities for Swapcard to pursue a sale. Your Profile 1+ year experience in outbound sales, or equivalent experience with a strong desire to pursue a career in sales. Fluent in English and Mandarin ‚Äì additional languages are a plus! Availability to work in Singapore timezone Exceptional comfort while speaking on the phone and video conference Exceptional communication, listening, and presentation skills Organized, persistent, optimistic & charismatic! Experience in CRM technology or proven software usage capabilities Desire to learn and grow professionally within a sales environment Sales administration and pipeline management are critical for effectiveness in this role Experience in SaaS and the event technology industry preferred Reasons to join us International Team with 39 nationalities (more on the way!) üåç Paris HQ with offices in USA, UAE, CA, UK, & IN üá´üá∑ üá∫üá∏ üá¶üá™ üá®üá¶ üá¨üáß üáÆüá≥ üá∏üá¨ Fast-growing startup with many opportunities for growth üå± Open-minded culture that appreciates differences üëΩ Feedback driven, supportive & curious team with DIY mindset ü§î üõ† Family Leave & remote work to ensure you have time for what matters most ‚ù§Ô∏è üè° Team that seizes every opportunity to celebrate success üçæ üï∫üèºüíÉ Learning support & sponsorship üìö WFH Budget to help you feel comfortable üòä Generous Paid Time Off program to ensure your happiness üéÅ Team Vacations to celebrate our achievements ‚úàÔ∏è

description: The Role: We are looking for a junior candidate to join CreditSights as a Sales Development Representative. The Sales Development Representative (SDR) will assist with the initial prospecting duties of the sales cycle. In this role the SDR would be responsible for qualifying leads at the initial stages in the sales funnel. This position is an excellent opportunity to join a growing team and have immediate impact.  SDR candidates must have strong interpersonal and communication skills across a variety of channels (email, social media, phone, etc.).  Responsibilities: Identify key players, researching and obtaining business requirements and presenting solutions to begin the sales cycle Conduct high volume out-bound calls, reaching sales prospects in order to offer demos and schedule appointments with Sales Account Managers Hold intelligent and engaging conversations over the phone and email Schedule pre-qualified appointments and product demonstrations   Qualifications:  Recent graduate, or 0-1 year experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree required Extremely self-motivated with a diligent work ethic Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent listening skills and a positive and energetic phone presence Strong influencing and well-developed interpersonal skills including demonstrable evidence of the ability to credibly interact with, and influence, senior level executives Fearlessness ‚Äì willing to call new prospects every single day and explain CreditSights‚Äô value proposition Familiarity with Salesforce highly valuable Excellent English verbal / written communication skills   We are an equal opportunity employer and offer a salary commensurate with experience and a competitive benefits program.  We are not accepting CVs from recruiters for this role. All direct applications are accepted only through the URL.

Miraco Nutripharm is an industry-leading pharmaceutical and healthcare company operating in Southeast Asia with a strong portfolio of evidence-based drugs and health supplements. Our regional headquarters is located in Singapore and we have extended our network and influence regionally to countries like Hong Kong, Malaysia and Myanmar.  We are looking for dynamic Medical Sales Representatives to join our fast-growing team!  Job Highlights Exciting career opportunity in the growing healthcare industry Solid corporate reputation in hospitals, polyclinics, medical centres & GP clinics Planned progression opportunities for good performers  Job Responsibilities: Grow market share of our pharmaceutical and healthcare products by approaching healthcare professionals both in person and digitally Build and maintain relationships with healthcare professionals as well as different stakeholders Maintain and expand company's existing client base to achieve sales and business goals Propose and implement strategic sales and marketing initiatives to increase revenue and brand following given the current pandemic regulations and limitations Collaborate with different stakeholders to organise webinars, conduct scientific research, collect testimonials and create educational materials Develop content for brand assets including product microsite as well as social media pages  Key requirements: Background or prior experience in Pharmacy/Pharmaceutical Science or Sales & Marketing will be an advantage Keen interest in both ethical drugs and health supplements with an ability to pick up medical product knowledge quickly and accurately Strong interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills Good command of written and spoken English Positive, results driven with a can-do attitude

description: Are you looking for a job that encourages growth and progression based on your efforts? We are looking for you!  What we want: - Flair for Corporate Sales - Good command in duo language  - Proactive work ethics - Keen learning attitude  What you will be doing: - Business to Business Marketing - Generating Quality Leads - Booking and attending appointments with clients to close deals  What you will be getting: - High Commission Tier - Performance Driven, Target driven environment - Coaching & 1-on-1 guidance  - Supportive and fun team members  Only Shortlisted candidates will be notified. About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain‚Äîin real-time, across devices‚Äîto improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The Role  Mixpanel is in a stage of high-growth and partnerships is a key piece of the puzzle to our growth across the Asia-Pacific (‚ÄòAPAC‚Äô) region. We are looking for a highly motivated leader and team player to join our Partnerships team to support the growth of Reseller partnerships in APAC.  In this role, you‚Äôll identify, recruit and operationalize new reseller partnerships to help expand Mixpanel‚Äôs indirect sales reach across Asia-Pacific. You will build a regional partner business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner sourced revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements.  This role manages existing reseller partners in Asia, as well as being responsible for acquiring and nurturing new reseller relationships across all of APAC. You will drive the strategy for your partners, be responsible for managing your partner relationships, executing GTM activities with your partners, accountable for exceeding quarterly quota, generating pipeline and forecasting revenue, and helping your partner reps resell Mixpanel to generate revenue. You have experience working with Channel Resellers, Distributors, System Integrators (SIs), and Digital Agencies to understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region.  Responsibilities Own and drive relationships with Solution Provider Reseller partners in Asia to generate significant resell revenue in region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Identify, recruit, enable and manage long-term relationships with new reseller partners (Regional Service Integrators (SIs), Digital agencies, Product Development agencies, etc.) to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Develop a deep understanding of partner business models, needs, and challenges including an understanding of our mutual customers‚Äô needs. Develop GTM plans with partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong Mixpanel-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. We're Looking For Someone Who Has  Aside from having channel / indirect sales experience, you exhibit the two core characteristics of the Mixpanel Partnerships Team: low-ego and self-motivation. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel sales role and make a significant impact in the region.  Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Sales role or equivalent quota-carrying role Execution focused but able to see larger picture Self-starter with great time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary (and when possible), typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Multi-lingual preferred. Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers‚Äô success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can‚Äôt win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: A Sales Manager analyses local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business.  What will I be doing?  Responsibilities  Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards  As Sales Manager, you will analyse local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business. Analysis local market trends and competitor activity to identify business leads Develop customer accounts and travel within the local area to drive business into the specific hotel/cluster and to increase market/customer share in all revenue streams Negotiate room rates/packages with corporate clients Prepare company contracts for the hotel in accordance with current business and pricing conditions Work within current business strategies and recognising potential opportunities Cooperate with other departments in the hotel to create an exceptional Guest experience and build strong, comprehensive sales programs Attend Sales events, as required Produce accurate and timely reports that meet the needs of the Sales Director and senior management to include the reporting of appointments, calls made and business leads Answer customer queries in a prompt and professional manner What are we looking for?  Skills  To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow  A Sales Manager serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. Positive attitude and good communication skills Commitment to delivering a high level of customer service Excellent grooming standards Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations Ability to work under pressure and under own initiative Experience in a sales role with a proven track record to close a sale It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Knowledge of local market Knowledge of hospitality Passion for sales and for achieving targets and objectives Degree-level qualification in a relevant field What will it be like to work for Hilton?  Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision ‚Äúto fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality‚Äù unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!  Work Locations  Hilton Garden Inn Serangoon - Singapore  Schedule  Full-time  Brand  Hilton Garden Inn  Shift  Day Job  Job Level  Manager  Job  Sales

jobTitle: Business Development Representative - South East Asia
description: It‚Äôs an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine‚Äôs Best Workplaces for 2020, we are leading the way to next-level DDI with our Secure Cloud-Managed Network Services, bringing next-level security, reliability, and automation to cloud and hybrid systems‚Äîall managed through a single pane of glass. Our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies‚Äîand having fun along the way. We are looking for a Business Development Representative ‚Äì South East Asia to join our APJ team in Singapore, reporting to the Manager, Business Development. In this role, you will be generating and qualifying sales opportunities for follow-up by the direct sales teams. This role will provide an opportunity to work for an industry leader in cybersecurity and to gain fantastic experience within a sales environment. You‚Äôre the ideal candidate if you are passionate about technology, results-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. What you‚Äôll do: Understand the business needs of our potential customers, be able to think on your feet, and possess the drive to become product experts Engage in heavy calling, use of e-mail, and other methods to target and qualify potential prospects. Carry out presales activities to develop a high-quality lead funnel and maximize these efforts to meet or exceed quotas for calls and qualified meetings Acquire and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of Infoblox technology to be a reliable customer resource Set meetings with prospective clients Partner closely with the sales team to develop and implement appropriate prospect strategies and plans; this includes ensuring that representatives have the essential budget, key party, and project information before handing over the opportunity Support multiple states within an assigned territory What you‚Äôll bring: 0 to 3 years of experience in calling on IT executives within all size organizations Highly energetic and motivated; strong attention to detail A strong desire to grow your career in sales Strong organizational and customer service skills required Ability to organize and prioritize work independently with minimal supervision Excellent telephone selling skills are a must Must be able to converse in a business level English Diploma, Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent What success looks like: After six months, you will‚Ä¶ Gain Infoblox products knowledge and security offerings Effectively using BANT to qualify new prospects Partner with the sales team on customer meeting and developing a high-quality lead funnel Hit or overachieve your monthly targets After about a year, you will‚Ä¶ Build a strong pipeline and close lead opportunities Gain more experience in expansion of customer and/or vertical coverage Become a subject matter expert in qualifying and pitching Infoblox unique selling proposition Meet or exceed your annual targets We‚Äôve got you covered: Our holistic benefits package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness‚Äîas well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including a Provident Fund with company match and paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our values every day‚Äîwe believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers. Why Infoblox? We‚Äôve created a culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you‚Äôre a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out what it‚Äôs like to be a Bloxer. We think you‚Äôll be excited to join our team.

description: POSITION SUMMARY: This individual will be responsible for the sales, marketing, and business development of avionics products in the region. knowledge of marketing principals, theories and concepts and technical principals of avionics systems Must possess a demonstrated commitment and passion for achieving customer satisfaction Must be an articulate and fluent written and verbal communicator, and at ease with public speaking Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to work proactively and effectively with minimal supervision description: Corporate Profile: The Radarr platform uses AI to convert billions of online conversations into actionable insights for brands, in real time.   Formerly known as Circus Social, Radarr is a social media intelligence and insights company that has developed a next-generation intelligence platform, 20/Twenty (www.radarr.com) to cater to the growing demand for better digital & social data analytics for marketers.  Our focus is helping clients track and achieve digital ROI, optimize campaigns and understand consumers through better digital data analytics, monitoring, and insights generation through our services.  Top brands like Coca Cola, P&G, Toyota are customers and agencies like Ogilvy, H&K, Zeno and TBWA are partners.   Who are you? We are looking for a Sales Superhero.  Being proactive, hardworking, fun and friendly are must- haves! Being comfortable with and having, Social Media, Agency and Marketing Industry knowledge would be a huge plus. Being outspoken, self-driven and enthusiastic would definitely make you stand out.   Job Description Your main responsibilities would be:  As a key salesperson on the team, you will be responsible for prospecting, cold-calling, creating opportunities and closing deals. As our main representative in the market, you will build relationships with our key customers and prospects You will also get to work closely with the tech team to grow and scale the product.  Senior Sales Manager Job Duties: ¬∑      Helps build a sales strategy by setting annual sales quotas for various products and regions; projecting expected sales volume for existing and new products. ¬∑      Market research to look for prospects and reaching out to them ¬∑      Building a pipeline of opportunities across products and region. ¬∑      Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships ¬∑      Use solution selling to engage with customers to understand their business needs and objectives ¬∑      Effectively communicate the value proposition of Circus Social & 20/Twenty through proposals and presentations ¬∑      Achieve 100% of quota which will be agreed through consensus based on market opportunity ¬∑      Reporting on forces that shift tactical budgets and strategic direction of accounts ¬∑      Keep up to date with social media trends, social media monitoring, digital industry changes and more ¬∑      Contribute in achieving client satisfaction at all touchpoints ¬∑      Ensure Client Success is met and achieve monthly KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) ¬∑      Work closely and collaborate with other team members to ensure best-in class end-to-end service execution ¬∑      Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.  Requirements: ¬∑      Proven sales experience, meeting or exceeding targets ¬∑      5+ years of experience as a BDM or Sales ¬∑      Marketing or social media agency experience ¬∑      Ability to communicate, present and influence all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level ¬∑      Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close ¬∑      Proven ability to articulate the distinct aspects of products and services ¬∑      Proven ability to position products against competitors ¬∑      Demonstrable experience in sales and marketing, developing client-focused, differentiated and achievable solutions ¬∑      Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills ¬∑      Excellent verbal and written communications skills ¬∑      Experience in the media, SaaS, martech and advertising industry is preferred  What we offer: ¬∑      A fun, fast-paced environment ¬∑      Flexible working ¬∑      Training & health allowance  Who are you?  ¬∑      Entrepreneurial. ¬∑      Super creative. ¬∑      Very Ambitious. ¬∑      Collaborative and Inspirational ¬∑      Outgoing. ¬∑      Hungry ‚Äì you want to succeed and help others along the way too. ¬∑      Fearless. ¬∑      Up for a challenge anytime.  We'd love someone who's proactive, curious, digitally-savvy, and insightful!

Do you plan to achieve greater heights in your profession?  Are you a fun and outgoing individual who is confident in interacting with people of all walks of life?  If yes, keep reading!  Personal development and business advancements within a vibrant environment is our main focus in Royal Organisation.  We strive to groom elites like yourself to represent our clients from various industries in extending their brand awareness and market shares through our expertise and core values.  Who are we looking for? - Self-motivated candidates with highly driven sales mentality - Strong team player with persistence and perseverance - Possess a keen and humble learning attitude with strong interpersonal skills - Exceptional in verbal communication  What will you be doing? - Convey the values of our client's products or services to potential customers through different communication techniques. - Engage large scale of customers with great customer service. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to develop their sales and leadership skills within a dynamic environment. - Learn how to build and lead your sales team.  The people: As we said, we focus on our People! We have family people, enthusiastic people, dance-anywhere people, people with a unique sense of humour, and every other variety of people. You will find a friend here!  Perks: - Mentorship - Potential business advancements - Vibrant and closely-knitted team culture - Strive in a fully performance-based industry - Personal development workshops and skillsets to takeaway - Travelling opportunities

A Bit About Whispir  Whispir is a cloud software and communications platform that seeks to help organisations communicate like people. Our platform enables our customers to build powerful communications workflows and automate interactions between systems, business, devices and people - with no coding required.  The outcomes are powerful ‚Äì people everywhere can have access to the right information at the right time so that they can make informed decisions, take action, engage and communicate with each other.  Organisations can finally start to behave how they have always wanted to ‚Äì they can engage with people the way people do... in a timely, personal and contextually sensitive way with actionable, useful insights that promote richer and deeper engagement.  We know this because leading organisations use Whispir's technology locally and globally every day for this reason. Whispir becomes their competitive advantage as they streamline their operations, improve their resilience and bring innovative new services to market quickly. We also see first-hand the capacity of these innovative solutions to assist saving lives and materially improve community outcomes.  Role Description:  As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be a key part of our sales and growth efforts. You will work closely with our existing Inside Sales Representative and our team of Account Executives. You will be reaching out to decision makers and influencers in midsize companies across a range of different industries, providing engaging content and insights that explain why Whispir can help their company/organization. You will have a suite of tools at your disposal including Outreach, Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other lead mining and research tools. You will have the support of the sales and marketing team to train and equip you with the knowledge you need to do your job. Success will come from being a great listener, highly organized with plenty of energy and enthusiasm for hitting your personal goals and being accountable for helping your team win.  Main Responsibilities: Drive and build pipeline within the commercial segment The role will include using SFDC and outbound software lead generating tools Drive outbound prospecting to generate new logo business opportunities in the commercial segment through Linked in, digital campaigns and cold calls The role will include giving demos using a live platform  Key skills/Attributes required: Minimum of 1 year of experience working in an Inside sales role or relevant Able to communicate with decision makers Procuring new sales opportunities through inbound and outbound sales Experience using CRM software (Salesforce.com / other related software) Being a trusted advisor of the company Hunter mentality  Why we think you will love working at Whispir: Uncapped commission Leadership Training - Grow your career with Whispir and take advantage of our future leadership training program with specialised training. Engage Humanity - Take advantage of our Engage Humanity program and give back to our community with a day of leave available provided. In-House Barista and Concierge - Meet colleagues at the Whispir Social Club for a morning coffee or an evening beverage hosted by our in-house concierge. Health and Wellbeing - Expand your personal mental and health with our dedicated personal training and employee assistance program.  Diversity & Inclusion  Whispir places a high value on inclusion. Those from under represented communities are encouraged to apply. This includes, but is definitely not limited to, people with a lived-experience of mental ill health, culturally and linguistically diverse people, LGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.  We take our core values seriously and work hard to create an environment where you feel welcomed. Teams who reflect a diversity of experience, identity, perspective, and background help us to create a healthy & inclusive working culture  If this has resonated with you, we look forward to hearing from you soon!

description: Company Description  Shopify is a platform built for independent business owners of all shapes and sizes to start, sell, market and manage their businesses online, in-store, and everywhere between. With a comprehensive set of industry-leading tools, Shopify has helped over 1,000,000 people in 175 countries take control of where they take their businesses. Headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, Shopify has worked with brands like Unilever, Gymshark, Allbirds and countless others that started with nothing but an idea, a passion, or a purpose.  Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.g towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.  Job Description  We are currently hiring Customer Service Specialists to start in late 2021. Please note that this position is currently only open to Singaporeans.  Being a Customer Service Specialist (Support Advisor) at Shopify is a rewarding and challenging opportunity to make an impact while supporting our Merchants.Your responsibility will be to provide high-quality customer service over phone calls, chats and emails. Within a supportive environment you will work to listen, support, problem-solve and explore growth opportunities with Shopify Merchants.  Responsibilities Adhere to a daily schedule that includes a mix of: Phones, three (3) simultaneous chats, and emails. Ensure quick response time and answer tickets within the same day. Act as a business coach and think about the merchant‚Äôs business holistically when offering solutions. Complete essential follow-up documentation after each interaction. Engage in human conversations with merchants to identify and resolve issues through coaching. Ensure privacy and security practices are followed at all times for both merchants and Shopify. Offer needs-based solutions, not pushy sales. Advocate for merchants and the Shopify platform by communicating with stakeholders. Own your own development through reviewing past interactions and preparing to discuss growth opportunities with your lead in regular 1:1 meetings. Qualifications Available to work full-time (40 hours per week) on a rotating schedule with varying 8-hour shifts starting anytime between 7:00 am - 11:00 am in your local timezone. This means some days your shifts could be as early as 7:00am-3:00pm, and as late as 11:00am-7:00pm. This includes working weekends and holidays on a rotating basis. Be permanently residing in Singapore and be Singaporean. 2+ years experience as a customer service representative in a contact centre, retail or service environment. Proven record of working in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment. Have appropriate remote work set-up - such as a quiet space and stable internet connection. Have access to a wired internet speed of at least 25 Mbps download speed and 10 Mbps upload. You can check your speed here. Ability to be resourceful and find solutions even when there is no clear path. Proficiency with technology paired with excellent typing skills. Willingness to learn all about entrepreneurship and enjoy human conversations. Possess high level of patience and empathy to navigate difficult conversations. Are committed to continuous growth and learning. Additional Information  At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our 2019 Sustainability Report to learn more about Shopify's commitments.  Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is thisclose to what we‚Äôre looking for, consider applying. We know that diversity of thought makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.

description: This role is responsible for working with management (country and regional) to lead, shape and build Sales Force Effectiveness capabilities and standards across APAC. Develop Salesforce Consultation toolkits, selling processes and standards, enabled by Sales Force Platform, focused on transforming sell-in to sell-out customer propositions. Develop and implement customer segmentation based selling framework, sales force deployment, salesforce performance and incentives in line with customer and channel strategy. Lead and develop coaching capabilities and processes of sales leaders to raise standards in business consultation and competitive selling skills. Shape and implement Sales Force Effectiveness and Coaching data capture and performance goals through a newly designed launch and expansion of Sales Force platform. Partners with the Commercial and country sales leads in the development and preparation of Sales Force Effectiveness and Sales Force Training plans, ensuring the consistency of those plans with the broader business requirements. Ensures the timely integration of defined objectives and expectations. Prepares specific business plans for new products and/or service lines. Participates in the planning, evaluation and execution of key business alliances. Develops and implements a system of monitoring and reporting progress on established strategic and tactical objectives; evaluates and reports on alternatives when course corrections are needed. Implements new business technology opportunities to meet evolving business and market requirements. Monitors expenses from and the implementation of an annual operating budget and capital budgets. Sales Force Effectiveness (SFE), APAC (excluding Japan) - Co-create strategic SFE vision, strategies, and initiatives, in close collaboration with markets, and in support of the customer and channel strategies for the business, to create a world class sales force - Shape the deployment of Salesforce software platform for CRM. - Lead, shape, and build SFE capabilities, standards, and processes, deployed in accordance with local nuance - Lead, and develop selling framework (including selling toolkits & customer selling proposition), rooted into customer segmentation framework, to disproportionately grow the priority customers - Lead and shape SFE & coaching enablers/metrics through a newly designed launch & expansion of Sales Force Platform - Drive continuous improvement through management of data, leveraging of technology, and the redesign of business processes, creating business sustainability across the organization. Implement SFE performance dashboards for ongoing monitoring and course correction, as needed - Annual budget plan and monitoring of the expenses/ capital  Sales Training, APAC (excluding Japan) - Leads development and implementation of a sales training program, rooted in the competency framework and in support of the commercial strategy - Co-create, in partnership with markets, a sales training curriculum to dial up the critical skills (i.e. data literacy) to aid in successful implementation of the commercial strategy to win with customers - Leverage technology for ongoing monitoring of training effectiveness and ROI - Annual budget plan and monitoring of the expenses/ capital

description: Job Description  Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!  F5 empowers creators of the new digital world  The F5 Digital Sales organization is a global sales organization with an opportunity to be a tremendous revenue growth engine for the company. The F5 solution, now combined with NGINX, Shape Security and Volterra bridges the gap between NetOps and DevOps with multi-cloud application services that span from code to customer. This role is part of an exciting new team that is at the forefront of establishing cutting-edge opportunistic sales motions leveraging AI, digital marketing, big data and analytics to drive impactful and targeted sales coverage.  The F5 Multi-Cloud Application Services Platform enables enterprises undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy, monolithic applications, as well as deliver new, microservices-based applications. Companies like Netflix, Starbucks, and McDonalds rely on F5 Networks to reduce costs, improve resiliency, and speed innovation.  F5 Networks is searching for an enthusiastic, eager-to-learn Business Development Representative (BDR) to join the growing sales team in China. If you are an early aspirant in your sales career or looking to work in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, F5 is the perfect place for you!  This position requires previous experience in an outbound role interacting with C-suite buyers. BDR candidates during the interview should not only be able to demonstrate the ability to comprehend F5 Solutions, but also the ability to pitch this effectively to new customers. They will also be expected to articulate how they would be creative and thoughtful in their approach to create market interest and solicit a response from prospects. This position is an in-office role that requires working from the office. However, due to the ongoing COVID pandemic, this role will require working from home as stipulated by the local country and company mandates.  Responsibilities Schedule highly qualified meetings from outbound campaigns within a very select group of targeted major accounts. Mapping the organization hierarchy, identifying new buying centers and engaging different personas within the account (NetOps, SecOps, DevOps, Cloud Architects, Security and Fraud leaders etc). Working closely with Account Executives to refine ideas and develop new strategies to deliver F5‚Äôs message to our buyers. Leverage prospecting tools such as Salesforce‚Äôs High Velocity Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Lusha or other local social media and outbound calling techniques to schedule meetings with identified target accounts. Effectively turn prospects into opportunities and revenue pipeline by qualifying through the PANT criteria (Pain, Authority, Need and Timeline). Collaborate with marketing, field sales, and product teams to facilitate new programs, messaging, campaigns, and offerings. Communicate and engage through video conferencing and navigate phone systems, voicemail systems, front desk operators and administrative assistants to reach intended business contacts. Ensure opportunity handoffs to sales are successful and exceed the customer's satisfaction. Ensure reporting and communications are frequent and bi-directional. Exhibit qualities of overachievement, self-motivation, good teamwork, and positive attitude. Meet and exceed minimum activity metrics: 50 Dials, 10 conversations, and 50 emails per day. Qualifications BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3 years of sales prospecting experience through social media, cold callings, emails and writing qualification notes. Core sales skills related to initiating conversations, uncovering basic needs, connecting needs to high level F5 solution and driving interest in continued discussion with sales team members. Skill in using Salesforce CRM tool for leads management, prospecting, emailing, and calling is a must. Previous experience with technology companies selling SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS is a plus. Fluency in English. F5s culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We‚Äôre a growing company with a startup feel and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If our team has one thing in common, it‚Äôs our passion for a multi-cloud application services and dedication to a global suite of products that‚Äôs loved by a loyal base of F5 fans for over 20 years.  Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, not exceeding 10% of the time spent traveling. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

description: The Role: As a Business Development Representative, you‚Äôll act as part of the sales team interfacing closely with marketing to develop new sales opportunities across India. The ideal candidate should be eager to advance in our organization and have keen business acumen, strong technical aptitude, and natural sales instincts. You should have the confidence, discipline, and drive to hunt for new customers. You‚Äôll be directly involved in powering our sales to the next level! This is a role for someone who is hungry, willing to learn and grow into a world class technology sales executive. If you have the work ethic and commitment to be a top sales executive, we will give you the tools and training to become one.  What you'll do as a Business Development Representative: Surface and develop qualified sales opportunities across India Work with inbound marketing to cultivate customer/prospect relationship Execute on outbound prospecting techniques and qualifying leads at a pace and quality to consistently hit and exceed monthly goals Log activity consistently and reliably in Salesforce.com Work collaboratively with Account Executive team to develop territory and strengthen pipeline  What you'll bring to the Business Development Representative role: Ability to take direction, be coached, mentored and working autonomously Desire to pursue sales as a career Experience with Business Development into India Demonstrated success interacting with people by phone, leading and persuading and overcoming obstacles associated with prospecting Strong presence and interpersonal skills Experience with or ability to learn web applications such as Salesforce.com and LinkedIn Fluent English language skills  Why should you join Recorded Future? With over 600 employees, $140M ARR, 1,000 clients, and 50% year-over-year growth, Recorded Future is the world‚Äôs largest privately-held security intelligence company! Recorded Future employees (or ‚ÄúFuturists‚Äù), represent over 35 nationalities and embody our core values of being passionate, practicing inclusion, and acting ethically. We are committed to maintaining an environment that attracts and retains talent from a diverse range of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. By ensuring all feel included and respected for being unique and bringing their whole selves to work, Recorded Future is made a better place every day.  If you need any accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our recruiting team at careers@recordedfuture.com  Recorded Future is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Recorded Future does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Recorded Future will not discharge, discipline or in any other manner discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because such employee or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the employee or applicant or another employee or applicant.

description: As a Business Executive, this is an exciting job that stabilises the position holder with $60k per annum.  We want you if you: 1) Possess a valid driving license (Vehicle will be provided for those without a car OR transport allowance will be given for those who have their own automobile). 2) Presentable & Pleasant  EVORICH¬ÆÔ∏è based in Singapore is the headquarter of EVORICH¬ÆÔ∏è Flooring Group with diversified related businesses across Asia countries. You deserve the most rewarding sales job in town because you have the ability.  Attractive remuneration ($4500-$7000) including basic salary, transport allowance, commission and performance bonus. Job Description, Low-code Style  As the #1 low-code application development platform, OutSystems provides customers with everything they need to build apps incredibly fast. So, let‚Äôs cut to the chase: we are looking for an Sales Development Representative based in Singaporeto join our fastest growing region. In this role, you need to k now how to identify and research lists of companies to target, and how to develop email and telephone campaigns to generate new business opportunities. The SDR will conduct high-level conversations with C-Levels about their business, their IT Problems issues and their operations. The successful candidate will be a strongly self-motivated and driven individual who is goal-oriented, methodical and tenacious, and can effectively interact with a team. This position has advancement potential within the sales organization, and the compensation package includes an uncapped commission structure.  The Longer Story  One of the fastest growing B2B software companies in the world, OutSystems is on a mission to enable every organization to innovate through the power of software. We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in empowering companies to build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that makes a difference to their business. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help our customers address some of the most strategic challenges in business today, from modernizing their business processes to transforming the customer experience.  OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 435,000 developer community members, 1,500 employees, 350 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 87 countries and across 22 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems is co-headquartered in Boston and Portugal, with offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.  Are you a Sales Development guru that finds your current employer is moving too slow for your taste?  Key Responsibilities  An OutSystems Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for: Executing outbound calling campaigns to targeted prospects to generate ‚Äúsales ready‚Äù qualified leads and set appointments for the OutSystems sales team to close new business; Responding to inbound inquiries from prospective customers (phone, email, and web), attaining key data to qualify the prospect, generate ‚Äúsales ready‚Äù leads, and set appointments for the OutSystems sales team to close new business; Learn and execute proven processes to generate new sales opportunities; Strategize with top-producing sales managers; Map prospective accounts around organizational structure, people and existing technology; Engage executives in targeted prospect accounts; Orchestrate discussions with senior execs around their business needs; Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects; Leverage CRM tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and sectors. Key Requirements English fluent - mandatory; Min 2 year‚Äôs sales or related market/business experience; Understanding of the IT industry with a background of prospecting to IT decision makers; Strong cold calling skills with ability to maintain high volume of outbound calls per day/week/month; Software/SaaS experience, sales experience or other related business experience; Outstanding communicator via phone and email to both technical and non-technical audiences; Ability to promptly respond to a high volume of inbound leads via phone and email while maintaining outbound call volumes; Self-critical and eager to improve and optimize the sales processes and tools; Proactive in seeking new business opportunities; Ability to work in situations that can be unstructured and potentially stressful; Ability to change priorities quickly, and capacity to handle multiple tasks; Ability to do initial research on accounts prior to contact; Proficiency with Microsoft Office, WebEx or similar web conferencing product, and CRM or sales management tools (salesforce.com preferred); Demonstrate strong desire to keep up-to-date on technology trends, changes, & best practices; Singapore based Behavioral Requirements A desire to do and achieve brilliant things! Authentically curious, who love learning and improving yourself; Integrity is fundamentally important to you! You are naturally entrepreneurial; You are street smart. Working at OutSystems  We do not have many rules, but we have a lot of common sense. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture has landed us in the top six Forbes Best Cloud Computing Companies and CEOs To Work for three years running. Our culture is based on transparency, teamwork and excellence as promised in our Small Book of the Few Big Rules . We live it every day. We grow, change, and innovate, and give our teams the space to be proactive and creative. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is obvious, and we also encourage lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering new skills. Global colleagues who are as smart, hardworking, and driven as you. Our DNA is disrupting the status quo. It is why our company exists. We ‚ÄúAsk Why‚Äù a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and often uncovers a better, more agile way. https://www.outsystems.com/company/careers/

description: How do you verify real people in the digital world? Onfido helps companies see real identity ‚Äì the humans behind the screens ‚Äì using world-leading AI and identity experts. Our solutions enable customers to prove their identities, wherever they are, with just an ID and their face. So companies have everything they need to grow their businesses securely.  Our AI-based technology assesses whether a user‚Äôs government-issued ID is genuine or fraudulent, and then compares it against their facial biometrics. That‚Äôs how we give companies like Revolut, Bunq and Remitly the assurance they need to onboard customers remotely and securely.  The Opportunity  The Sales Development Representative at Onfido isn't your typical "SDR" role. The team we‚Äôve built is not only responsible for qualifying leads, setting meetings and building pipeline, but also much more than that...By joining a collaborative fast-paced culture that relies and thrives on individuals who will go above and beyond, you will build and define not only your future with Onfido but the growth and expansion of the company at large!  Most importantly, you will be tasked to work closely with Account Executives and marketing teams to generate new business and add to our world-class winning inside sales culture.  As an integral part of our sales team, experienced Account Executives guide and mentor you to help ensure your success as a contributing member of the organization. This position is designed to prepare you with a number of career paths and opportunities at a hyper-growth startup that is re-defining Identity Verification.  As a Sales Development Representative At Onfido You Will Initiate sales opportunities with a balanced inbound/outbound approach by navigating accounts and hunting for qualified prospects and setting qualified meetings. Work closely with a highly experienced field sales team to define and execute on Territory/Target account plans. Qualify all Onfido marketing-generated leads. Collaborate with the sales team to move prospects through the sales funnel to closure. Participate in corporate & industry-wide conferences We're Looking For Sales Development Representatives Who Have B2B sales development experience prospecting into the APAC market. Comfortable at initiating phone conversations with executives, navigating questions, and overcoming objections. Proficiency using enterprise-grade sales CRM, such as Salesforce.com . Knowledgeable using social networking tools to help canvas an account (LinkedIn, ZoomInfo, etc.). Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Self starter, confident with owning responsibilities and experienced in seeing projects through from end to end Team player with a collaborative attitude. Onfido Culture  Onfidoer‚Äôs share a set of core values and want to hear from you if you believe in:  > Succeeding together; you work collaboratively and put the team first  > Taking pride; you care about quality, producing great work and customer / user outcomes  > Creating customer buzz; you demonstrate a strong user / customer focus  > Learning things & sharing them; you have a natural curiosity and default to sharing knowledge with others  > Finding a better way; you‚Äôre adept at finding solutions, experimentation and innovating to make things better  Along with our multi-national team in our London HQ we have offices in EMEA, America and APAC, making Onfido an exciting and culturally enriching place to work.  Onfido Balance  Personal hyper-growth requires a fast-moving environment, a clear career development plan and‚Äîcrucially‚Äîlooking after ourselves.  Onfido Balance is the toolkit we‚Äôve developed to succinctly communicate our benefits offering:  > Our Body benefits prioritise health, wellbeing, exercise and recovery.  > Our Head benefits are focussed heavily on learning whatever your learning style, mental wellness and flexible working.  > Our Heart benefits are framed around sharing our success with our peers, our local communities and our future selves in the form of equity, corporate social responsibility and better togetherness.  Check out Life at Onfido via our LinkedIn Careers Page !  Please note: Onfidoers are all working from home for the time being. We also have switched to a virtual recruitment process and all our Newfidos will be onboarding remotely. Stay Safe!  Onfido is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. We're always on the lookout for talented, passionate people and encourage applications from all backgrounds regardless of age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, parental status, race or religion. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses ‚Äì small, medium or large ‚Äì thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow‚Äôs world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Role  This position will serve in the front-line of the sales process. This client-facing role will assist in driving revenue growth by filling the top-of-funnel sales pipeline with qualified leads. This individual will be responsible for working within a Sales Development team, sitting within the wider Inside Sales team, to achieve both personal and team sales goals for their assigned Territory or Region.  As a successful Sales Development Representative you will be expected to: Nurture, develop, and handoff leads that result in qualified opportunities to the Sales team Own a territory and be responsible for driving qualified tours and handoffs to accelerate sales performance Own the sales process: contact identification, lead qualification, prospecting, pipeline building and opportunity identification Work with automation platforms to efficiently input and track data Execute strategy and process implemented by Inside Sales Leadership Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and effectively communicate our value proposition to prospects Provide unmatched customer service to potential prospects to ensure an excellent start to their member experience Experience And Requirements Bachelor‚Äôs Degree At least 6 months of professional experience in sales or related industry Experience in working and thriving in a fast paced environment Track record of sales in cold calling and emailing are helpful Comfortable using marketing automation platforms and CRM ‚Äì Salesforce experience highly desirable Demonstrated experience in prospecting, developing and handing off sales Experience in customer service and relationship building are highly desirable Experience working on a team and leading a team player mentality Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Fluent verbal and written English, and a second language of written and verbal Bahasa Indonesia is an added advantage to support Indonesia market that speak Bahasa dominantly Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skill Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you‚Äîbecause together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.

description: Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Do you enjoy working as part of a team? Could you make the difference to a customer‚Äôs day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...  Here at COS we are recruiting a sales assistant to join our Singapore store. The role is full time and able to work retail hours, including weekends and public holidays.  About COS‚Ä¶  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings‚Äô original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space. Qualifications  To work as a sales assistant, previous experience is not essential. When you first join COS we will give you a full training plan. We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. description: About the role: Expand In Asia is looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to help drive a range of B2B outbound campaigns in close collaboration with our clients‚Äô Sales reps, Sales enablement, Sales Operations teams to fuel engagement and drive pipeline. The ideal candidate has a start-up mindset or is an entrepreneur at heart with a can-do attitude. He/she will have the chance to make an impact on the growth of tech and innovative companies evolving in various industries such as Media, Ad Tech, Health Tech, Cloud services (IT infrastructure). You will gain exposure to some of the world's best B2B customer acquisition practices, and will be responsible for managing the outbound campaigns for one of our international customers. What you will do: Craft, execute, supervise and improve a variety of Sales outbound campaigns and activities through email, LinkedIn, Video, etc. for various clients located in North America and in Asia. Identify key customer segments & customized approaches for each country. Help defining the go to market strategy and territory planning. Optimize email cadences by improving the Open Rate & Click to rate Work with the contact research teams to build contacts pipelines. Data mining from various sources of information on the web. Write up campaigns content and creatives. Plan thematic campaigns and launch campaigns tailored to different regions, vertical and targeted products, confirm delivery details. Project managing all relevant client‚Äôs stakeholders (reps, sales managers, sales ops) to make sure they are aligned and planned activities are fully executed on-time. Propose solutions to optimize the market research processes. Track campaigns performance and optimize them to ensure the campaign KPIs are met. Iterate and optimize content to improve the funnel including some AB testing. Create post-campaign presentations to impress clients. Your experience: You are aspiring for a career in sales automation, or consulting and are highly motivated to constantly learn new ways of generating results for your client‚Äôs successes. 2 to 3 years experience for a lead generation role or Sales development representative experience Experience managing B2B outbound email campaigns Market research and analysis Experience with inbound marketing campaigns, or copywriting is a plus Experience with the Media, Health Tech or cloud (infrastructure) industries is a plus Your profile and soft skills: Passion for learning/understanding various business models and business organizations from different industries (Media, Health Tech, IT infrastructure) Strong interpersonal, and communication skills (written and verbal), you love interacting with clients. Adaptable and quick to learn new processes and tools, demonstrating strong technical/operational capabilities Self-directed, goal-oriented and flexible to change methods when needed. Driven by results and by hitting KPIs. Ambitious with an entrepreneurial attitude. A go-getter with a can-do attitude. Perfect written English to write up clear and engaging messages. Additional languages are a big plus. A candidate highly organized, independent with a healthy attention to details and sense of quality. Leadership and capacity to get others to act, you are a natural project manager. Sense of curiosity to find solutions, new methods or new tools to continuously improve our processes. About Us: Expand In Asia is a dynamic digital lead growth and B2B sales consulting and execution firm based in SIngapore. Our mission is to help tech companies expand their sales pipeline globally leveraging digital technologies. We do that by offering state of the art B2B outbound lead generation multilingual services and by focussing on the early stages of a sales cycle to significantly increase our clients‚Äô top of the funnel. Typically our clients outsource to us the sales development representative services allowing their sales reps to focus on accelerating their sales cycle and closing deals rather than prospecting. As a team we are driven by our 3 core company values which are : passion to create value for our customers, resilience to deliver results, lead with compassion in everything that we do, with our clients and within ourselves.

description: With over 80 years as an industrial technology leader, Kennametal Inc. delivers productivity to customers through materials science, tooling and wear-resistant solutions. description: Johnson & Johnson Vision, a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is currently seeking an Asia Pacific Professional & Customer development Lead ‚Äì Myopia located in Singapore with possible flexible options. Johnson & Johnson Vision is committed to improving and restoring sight for patients worldwide. Since debuting the world‚Äôs first disposable soft contact lens in 1987, it has been helping patients see better through their world-leading ACUVUE¬Æ Brand Contact Lenses. In 2017, J&J expanded into laser cataract surgery, phacoemulsification systems, intra-ocular lenses, laser refractive surgery, dry eye diagnostic / treatment technology, and consumer eye health and now serves more than 60 million patients a day across 103 countries with its eye health portfolio. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The Asia Pacific Professional & Customer development Lead will have overall responsibility for: - Building and developing the Myopia APAC professional education strategy in line with Myopia global approach, and driving the integrated APAC-focused programming required to effectively enable category development and growth - Implementing the core Myopia content via integrated professional programs directly for APAC to ensure customers have a willingness to demonstrate and advocate for Myopia awareness, science and products - Work with local Prof Ed at country level to execute Professional strategies and deliver ongoing support for programs directed to ECPs linked to the J&J Myopia strategy to enable joint value creation and growth in APAC - Drive regional & local partnership with industry stakeholders i.e. Professional Associations, KOLs, Academia. Compliant contracting and KOL management of KOL Eye Care Professional (ECP) advocates from APAC across ECPs to ensure the effective delivery of strategy / programs to achieve differentiation and brand advocacy - Support AP commercial lead in developing & localizing commercial value proposition & commercial activation plan in line with Myopia global approach including category story, channel, customer segmentation & priority, pricing structure & commercial terms & package. - Implement MCC Salesforce Effectiveness: Design & review sales incentive scheme to most effectively motivate and reward MCC sales force to perform to expectation and beyond. Administer, communicate targets and payout on a quarterly basis to sales force and sales management. Lead local sales training for category specific program, rooted in the competency framework and in line with the commercial strategy Partner with SFE regional / local to drive synergy in approach and development program for MCC sales team  Essential functions / responsibilities - Foster a high-performance environment and culture of collaboration and innovation. - Enable strong collaboration with cross-functional teams. Develop regional capabilities to maximize universal assets to differentiate and enable delivery. - Deliver commercial & professional strategy and education in lead markets. - Leadership responsibility for assuring necessary tools, policies and procedures are developed and integrated to support and comply with all legal, regulatory and HCC policies.

description: About Experian  Company Description  Experian is the world‚Äôs leading global information services company. Collaborates and communicates effectively in team environment to ensure achievement of common goals and results, significantly influencing team‚Äôs direction and results Strong consultative sales and negotiation skills Excellent written and oral communication skills; articulate and persuasive presence and speaking experience required Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Acts responsively and flexibly to meet challenges Develops and maintains effective working relationships with internal human resources and external contacts even if they have competing priorities and viewpoints Desirable With supervisory experience will be added advantage Good English communication skills ‚Äì written and conversational Additional Information  Adhere to Experian policies and procedures Work under the Experian behaviours and values Facilitate and drive performance management processes Champion a culture where the fair treatment of customers is at the heart of the Experian business Ensure that by leading by example, you adhere to all regulatory requirements and apply appropriate controls in the interests of customers. Through the adoption of a top down approach, demonstrate a culture where all our people understand their regulatory obligations, including what the fair treatment of customer‚Äôs means to them and our organization

description: About Meltwater  Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. Our employees embody the ‚Äòwork hard, play hard‚Äô spirit, and we are lucky to have some of the best and most talented people out there. We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.  With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world‚Äôs most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making.  Role: Sales Development Representative (Social)  The Sales Development Representative is the first step in your journey towards becoming a successful Senior Sales Executive in the Meltwater Social division. It is designed to help the candidate learn about the digital marketing industry and the varied use cases of Meltwater Social‚Äôs solutions. The role will allow you to develop consultative sales techniques, while advocating for more organizations to adopt digital media solutions.  Your role as a Sales Development Representative will have a strong focus on working with the Senior Sales Executives to qualify prospects and build a strong sales pipeline. Success in this position requires a strong curiosity for Digital Marketing / Social Media / Martech, excellent communication and presentation skills, and sharp business acumen to consult with C-Suite Executives.  What You‚Äôll Do Business development and sales support role in our Meltwater Social division, working very closely with the Sales Director of Meltwater Social to accelerate sales & revenue growth Focus on driving the top of the sales funnel ‚Äì such as sales pipeline generation, lead qualification of new & existing clients for the purpose of driving sales & revenue Qualify inbound leads, and reach out to outbound prospects effectively, ensuring a growing and steady stream of opportunities to be converted to successful deals Initiate early conversations with clients to understand their pain points, grow their excitement towards Meltwater, and start building value by sharing our differentiating factors Book a steady flow of demos and meetings for interested clients, where you will also introduce the Sales Director who continues with the sales process Some element of presales work, such as putting together business proposals, presentations, pitch decks, proof of concepts, and collecting use cases Become an expert user of our SaaS platforms Specialize in knowledge in the Social Media, Communications & Digital Marketing industry Contribute to the Meltwater Social division‚Äôs sales performance Who You Are Currently residing in Singapore Attained Bachelor‚Äôs degree (in any specialization) Entry level / have up to 1 - 2 years of work experience Curious about and understand the value of digital marketing / social media / MarTech / MarCom Interest in tech & SaaS / media intelligence, and a regular consumer of the news / media High level of drive & stamina to succeed in sales Prior experience cold calling, booking and conducting software demos, or exposure to sales processes from prospecting to closing of deals Good to have track record of successes and highlights in sales achievements Exceptional interpersonal, communication and stakeholder management skills Self-motivated, proactive, and organized with the ability to work under tight deadlines and in a high-pressure environment What We Offer Competitive remuneration package, with uncapped bonuses! Fast career progression & empowerment in your role Flat hierarchy with diverse, high-performance & collaborative teams Global presence & a uniquely Meltwater culture like no other Both flexible work arrangements & vibrant offices with well-stocked pantries Generous vacation leave & work-life balance Meltwater Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/  ()
