description: At Delta Air Lines, we are focused on building an organization operated by people with an unwavering commitment to superior customer experience to further position Delta as the world's most trusted airline in the eyes of our employees and customers.  As a Customer Experience Specialist, you will join a service and sales focused team in high energy call center environment, focused on listening to, caring for and connecting with customers. In this position, you will answer calls in an efficient, courteous and accurate manner, while assessing customer needs and offering solutions and additional products. Ideal candidates should demonstrate the desire to make our customer's travel not only superior but memorable.  This position is full-time with comprehensive health and wellness benefits, performance incentive programs, and Delta's industry-leading travel privileges. Successful candidates will form a hiring class scheduled as early as August 2021 in our Singapore Engagement Center.  Life At Our Singapore Customer Engagement Center Centrally located at the Singapore Post Center 2 minutes away from Paya Lebar MRT station, surrounded by 3 shopping malls, entertainment, and 24-hour food center 5-7 minutes away Modern break room offering snacks and beverage options and free Wi-Fi Local community engagement activities within Singapore as well as participation with Relay for Life and Day of Hope, Breast Cancer Research Foundation (BCRF), and Family Fun Day Delta employees, spouse/children can take advantage of interline agreements that provide space available travel at a reduced rate on many other airlines from around the world. Discounts available to global attractions, hotels and cruises through Delta Perks! Job Summary  Customer Experience Specialists connect with customers via phone and create an experience where customers know they have been heard and understood and feel valued and important, which is accomplished by: Effective listening Quickly identifying and owning customer issues Actively search for solutions to problems Making quality decisions Interacting with a globally diverse group of customers and colleagues Specialists sell travel related services, including car rental and credit card vendor partner products. Customer Experience Specialists demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills, a professional attitude, excellent dependability, the ability to handle stressful situations, possess strong computer skills, flexibility in a fast-paced environment, and the ability to learn and react quickly. Specialists must understand and adhere to all Delta and U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) compliance requirements.  Employees will have future opportunities to progress to specialty teams that respond to customer escalations or resolve complex international ticketing issues. As Delta continues to offer new ways for our customers to connect with us, Specialists may also have opportunities to assist customers via Twitter, Facebook or other emerging social media platforms.  Compensation And Training  The starting pay for this position is SGD$1,983.00 per month, with an increase to SGD$2,045.00 after 6 months, and to SGD$2,138.00 after one year. The position is also eligible for performance-based incentive after 6 months‚Äô probation, shift premium for PM shifts, monthly shared rewards if company meets KPIs and annual pay increases.  Successful candidates will participate in a comprehensive classroom and on-the-job training. Classroom training includes instruction, observation, exams and performance measures.  After training, we will assign new employees to a shift that may be significantly different than your training shift and will include two consecutive days off likely midweek. New employees will remain on that shift until the employee is eligible to bid on a shift they select. New hires are eligible to bid on a new shift during the first shift bid following completion of new hire training. Employees bid on preferred shifts every 3-4 months. New hires are often awarded PM shifts with midweek days off until they are able to hold different shifts based on seniority. Delta is a 24/7 operation, and we will always have customers that need us.  Your health and safety  Our values-based culture puts people at the heart of every decision. Since the beginning of the pandemic, protecting Delta people, their families, our customers, candidates and making your health and safety our first priority has been the driving force behind every decision we have made. We adhere to the latest Local Ministry of Health (MOH) Guidelines. Temperature checks/screenings are performed at every Delta facility before entry. In addition, Delta requires wearing a mask while in the office, staying 1 meter apart and practicing good hygiene. Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority Possess correct legal documentation to live and work in Singapore Be fluent written and verbally in English This role requires computer skills and comfort with navigating software applications, email, instant messaging, and internet searches. Must be able to demonstrate clear, pleasant, and courteous verbal and written communication using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation Must have a flexible schedule as this position will require you to work weekends, holidays and including night shift Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. Preferred education requirement for this position is an A-Level, O-Level, or HS Diploma (equivalent accepted). Consideration will be given to candidates with an N-Level if they also have a Polytechnic Diploma (equivalent accepted), WSQ Level 7, or 6 years of work experience. At least one year of experience working in sales At least one year of experience providing customer service
industries: Airlines/Aviation and Consumer Services

Job Title: Graduate Hire - Sales Development Program Job type: 1-year Traineeship  Reports to: Sales Manager Role Purpose:We‚Äôre looking for super-star and highly driven fresh graduates to join our sales traineeship program at Cove. We are a fast growing and highly dynamic start-up backed by Keppel Land, disrupting the real estate and rental market in Singapore for young professionals from all over the world. Strong initiative, optimism, and the courage to dream big and work for an eventual start-up unicorn are essential. In your role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to hit the ground running and take ownership from day one. We will always welcome your inputs and ideas and actively encourage your development. The team is fast paced, hard- working and expects results but we also highly value our employee engagement and are committed to a human and empathetic environment with plenty of fun thrown in. description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand ‚Äì and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.  About The Job Reporting to the Sales Manager, you lead your team in developing the IKEA business and your respective HFB (Home Furnishing Business). You come up with business and action plans for your responsible areas, and manage resource effectively. You optimize sales and profitability, by taking ownership of the range and actively promoting the IKEA commercial priorities and volume commitments. You act quickly on commercial opportunities and customer feedback, keeping an active eye on competition and take appropriate action when necessary and communicate with your matrix partner in the Service Office. You secure and develop our customer base through effective range presentation and sales steering, thereby ensuring an inspiring and enjoyable shopping experience for all IKEA visitors. As a leader, you are also to lead and develop your team by providing coaching and regular engagement. Qualifications You have at least 5 years of experience in a fast-paced retail industry and in a commercial environment. You have an interest in home furnishing and people‚Äôs everyday life at home You are self-motivated, analytical, and good at implementing commercial strategies, and guiding your team towards sales maximization. You have a proven ability to work as part of a team and actively selling through understanding your customers and their needs. You are a problem solver and decision maker, good at prioritizing and organizing your work and the work of others efficiently in a fast-paced retail environment. You are a strong and effective communicator; multi-tasking is second nature to you in the course of working with co-workers of all levels, both within and outside IKEA. You have strong leadership capabilities and able to guide, coach and lead a team of co-workers to excel as Sales Associates.
industries: Retail, Furniture, and Consumer Goods

description: About Us  SDAX (Digiassets Exchange (Singapore) Pte. Ltd.) is a blockchain-based institutional grade digital assets exchange for the listing and trading of asset-backed digital securities. The firm has obtained an approval-in-principle from the MAS to operate as a recognised market operator, and will serve accredited and institutional investors. The firm aims to provide access to an increasingly wide variety of innovative tokenized assets working with sophisticated corporate and financial institutions across the region, leveraging technology to facilitate fast, efficient, and secure listing and trading operations.  The Role ‚Äì Exchange Listing Associate‚Äì Digital Asset Exchange  SDAX is seeking a Product Listing Associate to liaise with Licensed Originators and Issuers, as well as the investor community, on identifying and developing new products for listing on the SDAX digital exchange.  Key Responsibilities  ‚Ä¢  Work with originators and issuers to onboard new product listings. ‚Ä¢  Support a product sales strategy, generating new leads and distribution channels. ‚Ä¢  Develop product specific content and materials to help educate SDAX participants on the various product types and listings. ‚Ä¢  Document and maintain issuance process flows ‚Ä¢  Maintain information completeness and integrity of application ‚Ä¢  Explain and educate about products and structuring ‚Ä¢  Maintain market risk, product risk documentation ‚Ä¢  To create and disseminate risk analysis reports and progress reports to different stakeholders, including the Risk Committee, employees, and C-suite executives.  Your profile  ‚Ä¢       3-5 years of relevant experience in financial products, para-legal, or structuring ‚Ä¢       Meticulous and able to maintain risk and process documentation, and product introductory materials ‚Ä¢       Working knowledge of financial markets and instruments ‚Äì including bonds, equities,  ‚Ä¢       Good written and verbal communication  ‚Ä¢       Relationship management skills  ‚Ä¢       Strong level of initiative and motivation. ‚Ä¢       Team player, with a demonstrated ability to form good working relationships across different functional areas.  We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package commensurate with the candidate‚Äôs skills and experience.

Sales Development Representative ‚Äì JLL Technologies  We are currently searching for a Sales Development Representative to join our dynamic team.  The Sales Development Representative will be the first line of direct contact for potential new clients to JLLT‚Äôs industry leading platforms. This Job is supported by SGUP.  Sanford C. Bernstein wishes to recruit an Institutional Equity salesperson to  work closely with its existing sales team in Singapore, and to focus on both Long Only and Hedge Fund clients. He/she will participate in continuing to build a regional presence in Asia for Bernstein.  As An Institutional Sales Associate, You Will Acquire expertise in multiple equity products and industries while working with our leading global research product, senior sales people, and best-in-class trade execution teams. Interact directly with key investment decision makers at institutional clients including mutual funds, hedge funds, and advisors managing pensions and endowments. Have a high level of responsibility and be empowered to make an important contribution to a sales group organized around geography and investment mandate. While our culture is intellectually rigorous, it is also very collegial and fun. Associates participate in a range of activities including philanthropy, social events, mentoring and annual on- and off-sites.  Qualification  Our Sales Associates Typically Possess Graduated on or before 2019 Track records of outstanding academic performance Breadth of interests and a cosmopolitan outlook Excellent analytical skills Intellectual curiosity Extracurricular activities and leadership Strong interpersonal skills Strong communicators Comfortable in a quantitative environment with a high level of attention to detail Committed to client service We want consummate team players who seek a highly rigorous and challenging environment for their career development. Some Institutional Sales Associates will advance to more senior, producing positions, while others may go on to graduate school.  Sanford C. Bernstein is widely recognized as Wall Street's premier sell-side research and brokerage firm, with a global equity trading platform that spans the U.S., Europe, and Asia. Our firm was founded in the U.S. in 1967 and in the U.K. in 1999. Our research and trading capabilities are sought out by leading investment managers around the world, and we are annually ranked at the top of our industry by acknowledged arbiters. In independent surveys of major institutional clients, Bernstein's research is ranked #1 for overall quality, industry knowledge, most trusted, best detailed financial analysis, major company studies, most useful valuation frameworks and best original research. In Institutional Investor‚Äôs latest annual client survey, the leading survey by which research analysts in our industry are evaluated, over 90% of our U.S. analysts and the majority of our European Analysts were recognized as among the best in their respective fields ‚Äì more than any other firm in our industry. We began operations in Hong Kong in 2010, and now cover a range of sectors across Asia. Our European research team is also home to Extel's #1-ranked analyst across Europe. We are a wholly-owned subsidiary of our buy-side parent, AllianceBernstein.  Singapore

If you need any accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our recruiting team at careers@recordedfuture.com  Recorded Future is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Recorded Future does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Recorded Future will not discharge, discipline or in any other manner discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because such employee or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the employee or applicant or another employee or applicant.

description: Are you ready to rock?  Here at Rapid7, we're bridging the gap between security and innovation. It's an ambitious mission, and to achieve it we need bright minds housed in some truly fearless rock stars‚Äîthose who can (proverbially) look Black Hat hackers in the eyes and not back down from the challenge. In the past three years Rapid7 have made sensational headlines of our own. We've gone public on the Nasdaq, tripled our workforce, and won countless awards for our products, services, and outstanding workplace environment.  Instrumental to such ferocious growth has been the Business Development team; where the only things growing faster than our sales pipeline are our team members! In four years, fourteen rock stars have graduated from the EMEA Business Development programme into high-impact roles in Sales, Marketing, or Customer Success - based here or abroad. There is no better place to begin, or continue, your lucrative career in High-Tech Sales.  What do we offer? An opportunity to join a hypergrowth security vendor Hypergrowth without diluting our unique culture The ability to sell award winning solutions which help to make the world a safer place A defined career development path, with regular promotions at agreed milestones A diverse and inclusive team with a leader who genuinely cares about you and your career Regular activities for you to socialise with your new bandmates Continuous learning - this is one of our core values A higher level of autonomy than most entry-level roles Opportunities to travel, network, and learn with colleagues, partners, and industry peers A steady stream of qualified inbound leads from our website, free trials, and industry events (which you can attend also!) A competitive salary and benefits - with a realistic, simple commission plan   It's yours, if you can... Communicate with passion Dedicate yourself to continuous learning Demonstrate initiative by leaving your comfort zone and taking disciplined risks Geek out about topics you are curious about Employ teamwork to help your fellow bandmates succeed Get fired up by friendly competition Are you ready to stage-dive into a career in one of the world's fastest growing industries?  Whether you're a Beethoven, Prince, Beyonce, or Bj√∂rk, we've got a place for you...

description: Overview  Develop, manage, execute and grow a profitable market position for TDW Products and Services in EH, East.  Responsibilities  Sales development (60%) Develops and executes sales and customer engagement action plans that deliver profitable growth in the assigned territories for TDW Products & Services, according to the accepted business strategies, with emphasis on achieving the greatest possible sales volume and margins, Develops and maintains a strong technical knowledge (following appropriate and ongoing training) about TDW products and services to a level necessary to have technical focused discussions with clients in the territory to provide solutions to their pipeline problems. Selects target Partners and negotiates Partners agreements in close collaboration with the Legal department, and according to the Channel Partner Policy Is accountable for the performance of Channel Partners in the assigned geographic area, in terms of sales, bookings, customer engagement activities, and achievement of the Joint Business Plan. Organizes and coordinates onboarding program for new and existing Channel partner Facilitates the development of Joint Business Plan with each Channel Partner and monitor its implementation, execution and achievement, Implements measuring and monitoring tools that track daily, weekly, monthly, and annual activities for Channel Partners, coaches them on how to effectively grow account base and recruit new Sales resources, Upon reviewing each markets forecasts and sales activity reports, provides timely feedback to the Channel Partners, ensuring that each market‚Äôs monthly sales goals are achieved, Works with each market‚Äôs Channel Partners to gain a thorough understanding of market trends, best practices, competitions and customers needs, Organises training, enablement and certification programs tailored to local markets, Defines and assists in the development of required support materials for the program, Market knowledge development and sharing (10%) Establishes and maintains credible knowledge and data of oil and gas pipeline market in the assigned territory Establishes and maintains credible knowledge and data of competitor product/service offerings, pricing, delivery, technology, and actions, ensures the competitive information is communicated throughout the organization, and recommends changes to maintain a competitive position. Operations/Execution (10%) Liaise with the Operations and Commercial Operations Teams for successful delivery and execution of products and services within the territory, measured by customer‚Äôs satisfaction / feedback. Be a part of the Channel Partner Managers and Marketing Manager Community of Practice to ensure alignment of program, progress and development of Channel Partners in the Eastern Hemisphere. Qualifications Engineering degree, with min. 7 years‚Äô experience in engineering and at least 7 years exposure in a sales/business development role, Experience with solution-oriented selling. Excellent presentation skills with the ability to communicate commercial, marketing & technical information to all levels. Willing to travel as required. Fluent in English. Any other language is an asset. Education Requirement  Relationships with others Reports to the Regional Sales Director Works closely with the Operations, Legal and Finance in preparing quote, tenders and conducting project risk reviews. Liaises with TDW entities to keep updated on TDW products & services capabilities and development and to get the support required to develop solutions to customers pipeline problems. Maintains strong partnership with all customers in the territory and more specifically with the TDW identified key accounts. Customer Orientation Maintains regular contact with customers to remain updated on all issues and challenges, to ensure their needs and proactively identify any additional business opportunities. Develop good relationships with and manage Sales Channels in assigned territory. Apply solution selling to meet customers‚Äô needs. Ensures that all customers‚Äô requests are treated in a timely and efficient manner and within required deadlines. Ensures that appropriate information is given to the relevant TDW internal departments. EEO  Follows the HSE policy by applying the instructions and procedures of the HSE manual, by participating actively in the Hazards and (Near-miss) Incident Identification and by behaving safety.

About Aspire  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.  In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don‚Äôt take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  About The Role  As the Sales Manager, you will be reporting to the Head of Sales. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team in 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure clients fully utilize their account.  What will you be doing? Negotiate and close all VIP clients looking to open a business account with Aspire Handle VIP clients relationship from the day of the first demo call until the day the client made their first deposit. Use consultative sales strategies to effectively overcome client objections and maximize sales activity within assigned territory Follow up with clients regularly to ensure needs are being met and identify new opportunities Drive referrals by your exceptional work Work closely with BD team to ensure high quality leads generation Keep all records in our CRM We would love to get to know you if you have the following: 5 to 8 years of experience in banking/fintech/SaaS sales You are a top dog and never take no to an answer Strong negotiation & sales skills Top producer in your previous companies Sale is in your blood Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. Ideally have been managing a small team Experience in a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard) is a plus Apply now at: https://boards.greenhouse.io/aspire/jobs/4132680004

description: Falcon employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We‚Äôd love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way‚Äîall so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.  Falcon.io provides a unified SaaS platform for social media listening, engaging, publishing and managing customer data. We enable our clients to explore the full potential of digital marketing by managing multiple customer touch points from one platform. Our platform has already achieved great international traction in the market, with its technology endorsed by partnerships with Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Founded as Falcon Social in Copenhagen in 2010, we now also have offices in New York City, Berlin, Budapest, Sofia, Chennai, Melbourne, and growing. We‚Äôre a highly diverse team, and we‚Äôre always looking for passionate and curious people who want to be part of a fast-paced, high-energy environment.  Falcon.io has an ethos of encouraging autonomy, ambition, boldness and experimentation. We value open people who take initiative and aren‚Äôt afraid to fail, learn from mistakes, adjust, and try to get better at what they do every day.  Sales Development Representatives (SDR) play a key role in the Falcon.io sales process. In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to impact the growth of our business and support our sales team by engaging new clients. You will reach out to potential clients to learn their current needs with social media and sell our top-rated social media management solution‚Äî Falcon.io . This is the perfect role for someone who is a great communicator, competitive, driven, hard-working, and a team player!  What You'll Do Research new markets, build a pipeline of potential leads, and nurture relationships with potential customers using Salesloft, Salesforce, LinkedIn, and other platforms Identify points of contact within target companies and reach out to prospective clients via outbound calls, emails and social media Scheduling platform demos for your Account Executive team Qualify new leads and follow up on warm leads, own your pipeline Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly targets Be the face of Falcon.io , you are the first point of contact to engage our potential customers Become an expert on our brand, business, and SaaS product Stay current on industry news and understand the social media landscape What You Have Positivity and determination Ability to turn a "no" into a "yes" through consultative questioning and coping with rejection Ability to thrive in a quota driven environment with short sales cycles Excellent English skills and another language Cold calling experience an advantage Experience in a new business generation/real estate/recruitment role is an advantage Team player attitude, eager to be part of an ambitious team Exceptional ability to organize work and tasks What You‚Äôll Get Growth potential, SDRs have a clear growth plan with potential to become Account Executives A competitive salary package with a solid base and a commission model that is designed to ignite you A thorough on-boarding programme and in-house sales training giving you the skills you need to succeed MacBook and iPhone with a subscription plan An open, informal and multinational working environment defined by high levels of personal responsibility If you would like to continue your sales career with us at Falcon, send us your CV right now!  *Our recruitment process in entirely remote for your safety!*  Falcon is part of Cision Ltd‚Äîa leading global provider of innovative earned media software and services to public relations and marketing communications professionals  Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Falcon's commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to  Project Management The key responsibility of this role is to ensure the co-ordination, smooth running, and project management as it relates to wealth initiatives across the region Co-ordinating due diligence meetings with investment teams based in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific Preparing pre-briefing reports for investment teams ahead of investment team meetings. The individual will leverage the expertise of the global project management teams, investor relations, operations, legal and compliance teams to manage product launches Be the key Asia Pacific regional lead in campaign projects to ensure successful product launch and implementation Assist in the maintenance of the APAC regional product and opportunity pipeline & reporting to the global function. Client Service To be actively involved in client service across the Asia Pacific region from existing and new investors To collaborate and co-ordinate with internal stakeholders across client service, project management teams and investment teams in responding to investor queries in a timely manner To work closely with and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders in the Asia Pacific region To provide ongoing support to Asia Pacific Wealth Management Solutions sales team in interacting with prospective and existing clients across the region About You  To be successful in this role, you will ideally possess Appropriate degree in accounting/ finance Post graduate studies in finance CA/CPA qualified would be highly regarded 3-5 years‚Äô experience in project management and client service roles with knowledge and relevant experience in asset management/ private wealth management (preferred) Project management experience: excellent organizational and time management skills - ability to manage multiple projects. Superior presentation, communication and interpersonal skills. Fluent in English, Chinese/ Mandarin (preferred) Disclaimer: Brookfield Asset Management does not accept any unsolicited resumes from Recruitment Agencies and the company shall not be liable for any fees incurred from any unsolicited resumes received from third parties. JLL Technologies (JLLT) is a division of JLL, a world leader in real estate services, that helps organizations transform the way they acquire, operate, manage, and experience space. JLLT is a first-of-its-kind team combining builders of high-growth tech companies and commercial real estate experts. Communicate information about calls accurately and effectively to the Sales Team Daily time management and the ability to work independently or under supervision. Desire to learn and engage in Account Based Marketing using the best practices. Job Requirements Excellent written and verbal communications skills. General knowledge of the IT industry and leading products strongly preferred. The ability to learn quickly and retain knowledge is required. Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of integrity. Applicants must be self-motivated and have a strong work ethic. Bachelor‚Äôs degree. Sales and/or marketing experience preferred. description: Overview  The Market Sales Representative ‚Äì Industrial (IND) is responsible for lead execution of the IND Market Sales strategy in ROAPAC, with the key objective to deliver on defined sales targets (Quarterly) and to drive growth in the IND Market. They are accountable for defining a Business/Sales Plan to successfully grow BBIO business in stated markets, and achieve the business goals defined as per the BBIO strategic Business Plan (5Y).  The Market Sales Representative - IND will work in close collaboration with the Global Sales Manager ‚Äì Market Sales IND, as well as with the Regional Sales group, to define and execute customized Go to Market approaches and to support Key Account sales strategy in the IND Market, thus enabling BBIO to leverage its full existing Solution Portfolio across customers value chains.  The Market Sales Representative - IND will deliver the annual and quarterly growth in NOBs and revenue, in a profitable way, and in accordance with BBIO‚Äôs annual and quarterly financial objective for the IND Market in the defined territory.  He/She is responsible for the sales of BBIO total solutions in the IND market, and potentially specific selected Key Accounts (either in a Global KA sales role or in a regional support capacity). This role will generate sustainable growth by broadening value, with existing and novel solutions (for the customer end-to-end value chain), while strengthening the business and partnerships with established customers.  He/She has advanced specialized knowledge and understanding of the IND market in ROAPAC and should become a trusted partner for our customers in that segment. He/She will also develop our business by pro-actively targeting new customers in full alignment within the Commercial Organization.  Responsibilities Grow BBIO‚Äòs sales through New Order Booking and Revenue Recognition in stated territory (IND Markets) by leveraging the full BBIO portfolio relevant to Industrial customers. Through building sustainable business partnerships with major corporations in all IND Subsegments including Forensics community, position BBIO as an End-to-End partner for the complete value chain in the segment and an endorsed supplier in the IND market place. Sell BBIO‚Äôs complete solution portfolio, ranging from Industrial Screeners, software and services,to Benchtop based Application solutions in all subsegments of the IND market. Establish BBIO as the preferred NMR partner in the Forensic community (e.g. but not limited to: customs, border control, scientific police). Leverage international adoption for expansion in stated region . Identify a balanced mix of target customers, qualify & maximize BBIO‚Äôs business potential for ‚ÄúDesigned-In‚Äù solutions, and establish sustainable business co-operations with their Decision & Buyer Center in order to deliver business performance (NOB, Revenue, GM) according to the annual and quarterly plan. Act as Key Account Sales Representative for specific IND Accounts in stated territory that have been assigned. Drive all necessary communication, demo activity, legal requirements, quoting and follow up activities required to close sale in designated opportunities. Focus on penetration strategies for assigned qualified Key Accounts with the goal to achieve ‚ÄúDesign-In‚Äù projects when possible. For assigned qualified Key Accounts, maintain strong account knowledge and management, ensure that all required resources are utilized in an effective and timely manner to meet the defined customer issue resolution needs (SLS, Back Office) where required. Protect and enhance BBIO‚Äôs customer facing reputation. Lead regular interdisciplinary key account task force meetings to resolve pending topics quickly and efficiently. Work in accordance with Miller Heiman Strategic and Key Account Selling Methodologies. Accountable for business results, including annual and quarterly NOB and revenue/market share targets in the IND Market in stated territories. Own, measure and report sales progress and accurate forecasting within a timely manner through a set of relevant KPI‚Äôs within CRM (Salesforce.com). Responsible for implementing the BBIO sales expansion strategies for IND markets in stated region. Closely work with Head of BU IND and BBIO Marcom to create and execute impactful market lead generation and awareness campaigns in stated region, with the aim of maximising sales growth. Attend specialized events to promote BBIO‚Äôs solutions, and assist with the proactive follow up of leads generated Closely work with local Field Application Experts to minimize Sales cycle and time to money for opportunities (time to convert Lead2NOB). Keep abreast of key priorities and changes in IND Market trends, including changes in regulatory requirements which may pertain to the business, and providing feedback to Global Sales Manager - Market Sales ‚Äì IND and Market Management, as well as R&D team on a regular basis Required Qualifications  Qualifications Bachelor Degree or 5+ years‚Äô commensurate experience with active progress toward industry-related education. MS and or PhD desirable. Experience with US Stock-Listed standard, compliance training (code of conduct / FCPA‚Ä¶) High Standard Sales methodology training (I.e. Miller Heiman strategic selling‚Ä¶) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Current valid driving licence No visa disqualification from the USA or EU or China. Required Softskills Very good knowledge of the ROAPAC market in the industrial market segment and is familiar with the most important analytical measurement methods, Specialist knowledge of NMR and EPR is an advantage Can interact with the many different cultures in ROAPAC through his appearance and knowledge of the different regions and can successfully implement BBIO's solutions at the customer's site in the region High level of autonomy, Self-disciplined and reliable, strong time management skills Strong sales oriented attitude combined with Performance culture. High productivity, high quality work. Strong drive and enthusiasm combined with can-do attitude Excellent interpersonal skills and teamwork spirit Ability to adapt to change rapidly if needed Strong analytical and organizational skills Problem-solving positive attitude. Accessible and open personality Excellent communication (both written and oral) skills Impeccable personal presentation A proven team player with a strong work ethic who will enhance the performance of the BBIO Market Sales team and will complement the capabilities already in place. Must have the ability to react quickly to market requirements with excellent account evaluation and qualification skills. Success in working in a global, multi‚Äìcultural organization. Is comfortable with ambiguity

Description Decathlon is one of the biggest sporting goods designer, manufacturer, and retailer headquartered in France! With an international network of 90,000 employees working in over 1400 stores in 42 countries, we are ready to open our sixth experience store in Singapore, Punggol! And we need you on our team!  Your Role: As a Sport Leader your responsibility will be to make your sport accessible within your community by sharing the benefits of your sport with others in alignment with ‚ÄúWe Connect Sports Lovers‚Äù project in Singapore. Once you have mastered the in store basics, you will have the freedom to think outside the box, make commercial decisions on how and what to sell, building your business from the ground up. An entrepreneur and a sport lover on the job.  Your Responsibilities: Team Player ‚ÄìThe business and the customer always comes first, together with your colleagues you will ensure that your in-store business is commercial and efficient day to day.  Digital ‚Äì As the retail continues to evolve, you will have the freedom to discover new ways to build your brand through social media and other digital channels.  Partnerships ‚Äì Once your business is thriving in store and online, you can reach out into your community and work with your local sport clubs/schools/businesses to develop partnerships. Here is where you will apply your networking skills in order to strengthen your brand and to make your sport accessible within your community.  Customer Service ‚Äì Your customers will always be your number one priority, you will have the means to listen to their feedback in order to make improvements to your business. description: Princeton Digital Group (PDG) is a leading investor, developer and operator of Internet infrastructure. Headquartered in Singapore with presence and operations in China, Singapore, India, Indonesia, and Japan. Our portfolio of data centers power the expansion of hyperscalers and enterprises in the fastest-growing digital economies across Asia.  PDG continues to build its footprint in existing markets and has a clear strategy to enter other customer-priority markets in the APAC Region. The company is backed by Warburg Pincus, a leading global private equity firm with a proven track record of building best-in-class platforms in TMT and real estate, and Ontario Teachers‚Äô Pension Plan, Canada‚Äôs largest single-profession pension plan with a diverse global portfolio of assets. Data centers have been one of the best performing asset classes over the last decade in the US public capital markets and PDG is well positioned to capture these secular trends and become one of the world‚Äôs leading data center companies.  We are looking for a highly motivated Account Executive who will be building and maintaining long lasting relationships with our clients in Singapore. This successful candidate will focus on account management, understanding clients‚Äô current needs and future growth to turn leads into commercials.  Roles and Responsibilities:  First Point of Contact for existing Singapore clients Build and maintain long lasting relationships with existing clients and new accounts Establish regular meetings and touch points to build client intimacy Understand clients‚Äô growth plans and manage upselling, contract renewal and new service Assist in contract negotiation and maintain proper documentation Respond to clients‚Äô queries, feedback and complaints with the mindset to resolve issues and enhance customer experience Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure adequate resources are channeled to support clients‚Äô needs Provide support and coordinate internal resources to build compelling proposals to RFIs/RFPs Respond promptly to potential clients‚Äô product/service queries and support the building of presentations to prospective clients Track and prepare metrics and reports Compile and analyse date to identify market trends  Requirements  Undergraduate Degree or equivalent 2 to 4 years of relevant experience and keen interest in account management, Sales and/or Business Development Strong Proficiency in networking, communications, presentations, and negotiations Strong team player, detail-oriented and meticulous

Insider is a B2B SaaS company with a unique approach to multichannel experience orchestration. Recently, Insider announced its $32 Million Series C funding round by Sequoia. Insider was named the #1 leader on G2‚Äôs Mobile Marketing Software and Personalization Grids, with a 4.6/5 rating based 100% on user reviews, 19 quarters in a row. Insider was also named as the #1 Leader in the Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management (CCCM) with the highest overall score among all vendors, with a 5/5 rating in numerous criteria. CrunchBase recently ranked Insider‚Äôs co-founder and CEO Hande Cilingir as one of the top women CEOs outside the US.  Many of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies and top brands in retail, automotive, and travel use Insider to deliver AI-backed personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations. Insider is trusted by over 800 global businesses, including UNIQLO, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Toyota, New Balance, IKEA, Samsung, Newsweek, MediaMarkt, Nissan, AVIS, Marks & Spencer, Allianz, BBVA, Dominos, Avon, and CNN.  First things first: What is this role about?  You‚Äôre probably expecting an eye-catching, mesmerizing job description that will sweep you off your feet, flavored with the coolest startup jargon's. After all, we‚Äôre a Sequoia-backed company, with an awarded woman CEO and a team across the globe that takes the word ‚Äúdiversity‚Äù very seriously. But that‚Äôs exactly why we think that nothing says more than the real experience. We‚Äôre underdogs who believe in the power of actions more than anything. Our sales pros are conversation starters, network builders, and noise makers. Being a part of our sales team requires a great sets of skills, such as relationship building, consulting, strategic thinking, and creating a robust sales pipeline. So we asked our team of sales pros to tell us what their day-to-day is really like and, in a nutshell, this is what they told us.  Job Description Handling overall responsibility for managing the sales, achieving growth and hitting/exceeding annual sales targets; Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status; Develop and implement new sales initiatives, strategies and programs to capture key demographics; Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations; Provide on-the-ground support for sales associates as they generate leads; Providing feedback to team on market trends, unmet needs, and opportunities to deliver greater value to customers by extending company offerings; Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team; Accurate forecasting and maintaining an up to date pipeline at all times.  What We Expect From You A university degree in Business, Marketing, or related fields. Previous experience with travel, eCommerce and retail industries are a big plus! Minimum 5 years of sales management experience. Knowledge of Digital Marketing is a plus! Show us that ‚Äúyou‚Äôve got what it takes‚Äù to collaborate and build strong relationships with customers, especially at the executive level Extensive portfolio of Digital, SEO and SEM agencies Proven oral and written communication abilities, with positive and energetic phone skills and exquisite listening skills. Alas, we‚Äôve got clients all over the world! Be a self-motivated and savvy tech bug, always in search for savvy solutions and ideas to improve our relationship with our clients Cherish one of our core ethos: care. You‚Äôll need to care for our clients and make sure they feel at home with our products and our around the clock support Superior project and time management skills. And a keen eye for detail! Passion for testing, measuring and improving outreach and follow up effectiveness The ability and flexibility to work in a fast-paced startup environment as well as high emotional intelligence Hold on! Life‚Äôs a two-way road! Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll enjoy while spending time with us (perks, anyone?) We offer many hard and soft skills training's to help you improve and challenge yourself. You‚Äôll have access to Udemy‚Äôs business plan, where you can choose over 10,000 courses to satisfy your hunger for knowledge You‚Äôll have space to share your skills and even deliver training's and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring! We‚Äôll provide you with a paid Spotify account subscription, so you can cozy up in your headsets cocoon whenever you want You‚Äôll have a chance to work in an international, diverse and inclusive environment You‚Äôll be part of an industry that‚Äôs shaping the future of customer experiences Don't believe us? Just ask Google. Occasional TGIF happy hours! We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.  Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, Stack Overflow, and Medium!
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Retail

description: Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Do you enjoy working as part of a team? Could you make the difference to a customer‚Äôs day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...  Here at COS we are recruiting a sales assistant to join our Singapore store. The role is part time and able to work retail hours, including weekends and public holidays.  About COS‚Ä¶  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings‚Äô original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.  About The Role‚Ä¶  Job Description  Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include: Offering our customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them to create great outfits Processing deliveries & stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the shop floor Stock replenishment Selling to customers at the cash desk, fitting room and on the shop floor About You...  Qualifications  To work as a sales assistant, previous experience is not essential. Instead we look for people with the qualities below Customer focused Self-motivated & positive Considerate Adaptable A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Additional Information  Why choose COS?  In Addition To This You Will Also Receive  When you first join COS we will give you a full training plan and pay you an hourly rate of SGD up to $9 . 25% staff discount Up to SGD 520 per year clothing allowance Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.  We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.

description: About Nintex  The world of process automation is blowing up right now. What does that mean? It means that Nintex is driving the future of work all around the world. Our products help many of your favorite brand names and most admired companies work better, faster, more efficiently. It is an exciting place to be and an exciting time to join our sales organization as a manager and to ensure we are helping as many companies as possible find their way to Nintex.  About The Role  We‚Äôre on the lookout to onboard a Business Development Representative to join our global team! As a BDR with Nintex you will play a critical role in growing our business. You will be responsible for teaming with our Senior Sales teams to uncover opportunities from inbound enquiries whilst managing a mini quota to close deals within a defined territory. In this role, you will learn how to master the fundamentals and work across our entire sales cycle. You will be responsible for identifying qualified prospects, generating appointments, and delivering our value proposition.  Qualifications 0-2 years' sales experience fluent in Mandarin is a must for this role Prior experience with Salesforce CRM (desirable) Marketing or Software as a Service (SaaS) sales experience (desirable) Ability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, results-oriented culture where team members work together collaboratively Your Contribution Will Be Performing outbound sales calls. You will spend your day connecting with prospects using phone, social, and email to engage in a qualification/discovery process. You will be the 1stpoint of call for live chat sales enquiries. Coordinate closely with internal sales resources to align solution design with customers‚Äô business requirements. Lead qualification. You will qualify high quality opportunities and arrange follow up meetings with the senior sales team. To manage this process you will utilize document progress, notes, etc. in Nintex CRM (SalesForce.com). You will learn and master Salesforce lead management, email management, and lead documentation, follow-up procedure. You will participate in providing feedback on how prospects are contacting Nintex and how they are reacting to current marketing efforts. Evangelize the Nintex portfolio. You will gain and maintain up to date knowledge of Saleforce.com, SharePoint, O365, business process planning and Nintex products. Before we let you loose on the phones, you will learn to effectively communicate how all Nintex products are licensed and how they will benefit our customers. Proactively scope technical solutions using Nintex products required to address customer requirements, assesses customers met and unmet needs, and recommend solutions that optimize value for both the customer, solution delivery partner and Nintex. Fill the top of the funnel. In order for us to get leads to the buying phase, we first have to get people into the qualified leads funnel. You will provide assistance to existing and prospective customers during product trial periods and enable them so they get the most out of the trial period. You will opportunistically pursue additional business development opportunities in the field. Collaborates with other Customer Success resources and Partner Managers to ensure these opportunities are advanced. What's In It For You  In addition to a competitive salary and benefits package, you'll work alongside supportive colleagues and a leadership team that genuinely cares. We support a safe, inclusive, respectful culture that provides you a sense of belonging. We are supportive of each other‚Äôs career journeys to continue learning and growing. We provide benefits such as paid parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers, training for career growth, employee assistance programs, and a hybrid work model.  Our commitment to you is to give you opportunities to help you take your career to the next level.  How We Operate  Everyone who works at Nintex follow three core tenets to ensure we operate a highly successful and collaborative business: We deliver on our commitments.‚ÄØWe focus on a few key priorities and ensure we deliver with quality on time‚Ä¶every time. We don‚Äôt wait.‚ÄØIf we see an issue, we fix it. If we see an opportunity to accelerate our success, we take it. We operate with respect and consideration.‚ÄØWe will move fast and deliver‚Ä¶and, we will do it the right way. At Nintex, we thrive on helping our customers and partners succeed as they leverage the industry‚Äôs best process management and automation capabilities to digitally transform a wide range of business processes. Every employee that joins Nintex is presented with a massive market opportunity to help improve the way people worldwide work as every organization needs what we provide. We have a highly collaborative culture where we focus on success through team efforts.  Apply today to be part of our Sales team.

description: Job Discipline Description  Builds and maintains effective long-term relationships and a high level of satisfaction with key senior-level decision makers and influencers at an assigned group of customer accounts that may include major strategic customers within a geographic or industry focus | Identifies, develops and typically closes new sales opportunities | Creates demand for the organization's products and services by raising their profile with customers | Achieves revenue targets by increasing revenue spend per account | May conduct regular status and strategy meetings with the customer's senior management to understand their needs and link them to the organization's product/service strategies | Responsibilities are within the Account/Relationship Management Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines  General Profile Works with territory/account, product/services or sales process with limited complexity Has limited direct contact with clients and no authority/opportunity to set and negotiate product/service terms Typically requires a college or university degree or the equivalent work experience and has general awareness of business, financials, products/services and the market  Recommended Skills Functional Knowledge: Develops basic skills in selling and account management and deepens knowledge of products and solutions Business Expertise: Develops understanding of key business drivers; Responsibilities : ¬∑      Actively solicit and close sales through sourcing and developing new leads, cold calls and face-to-face meetings ¬∑      Explore clients‚Äô marketing needs and provide value-led, customer-focused solutions to meet their business goals ¬∑      Manage sales pipeline and provide accurate, timely reports to Head of Sales when necessary ¬∑      Maintaining and growing your knowledge of your markets, clients and developments in the market sector ¬∑      Increase sales to both new and existing customers of our expanding digital platforms and opportunities

description: Vonage Mission  We strive to innovate and enhance our customers' ability to communicate within today's digital, cloud and real-time business environment. Our sales team is composed of highly-motivated, energetic and customer-focused Team Members that expand existing accounts/channels and find new clients for company products and services.  Why this role matters  Vonage is seeking a results-oriented Sales Development Representative (SDR) to perform account-based development supporting our Sales team in South Korea. As part of the Sales team, the SDR will leverage the latest tools and techniques to develop target accounts. Success will be measured in Appointments scheduled and discovery of new sales opportunities.  Our ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player with high social intelligence and a natural inclination for selling, who understands the value of research and the importance of personalizing value propositions and messaging to target contacts. He or she is highly driven and values the benefits of being part of an agile growing team.  You will be the very first point of contact for potential customers for Vonage and play a vital role not only in generating a sales pipeline, but helping us refine sales and marketing strategy based on your interactions and successes with prospects.  IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU, CONTINUE READING BELOW...  There are four core elements of the Vonage SDR role: Research and develop insights on target accounts Setup ICP persona-based account plans, including personalized digital/online assets Orchestrate account strategy plays; email, phone calls, and direct mail to target contacts Measure results and refine outreach accordingly What you'll bring  Daily Adventures Include Performing outbound & inbound sales activities, contacting potential clients through phone, emails, LinkedIn and other channels; Discovering new leads through creative internet research and social media monitoring/messaging, Inbound Lead flow in Salesforce.com, using LinkedIn Navigator, etc Qualifying & disqualifying potential customers based on a thorough knowledge of Vonage API platform products Keep meticulous and detailed notes updated in Salesforce.com Schedule meetings for assigned Regional Account Executives Collaborating with Marketing counterparts, assigned Regional Account Executives and sales leadership to optimize performance Develop and maintain territory plans with assigned Regional Account Executives for their assigned territories Skills & Experience  What's Required For Application Well-developed interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills; 2-5 years of relevant experience in a B2B technology/software environment preferred 4-year degree mandatory; a specialization in Technology Communications, or Business a plus Experience with Salesforce, Outreach.io, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, G Suite Highly focused with a goal-oriented mindset Creative and communicative about new ideas to help the team be successful Autonomy and ability to make things happen without supervision or tight control Interest in growing your career in tech Core Competencies Sound writing abilities, in particular crafting relevant communications that engage senior executives Strong research, organizational and time management skills Track-record of success in previous jobs What's In It For You  In addition to providing exciting work, career advancement opportunities, and a collaborative work environment, Vonage provides competitive pay and benefits including unlimited discretionary time off and tuition reimbursement.  Note: The purpose of this profile is to provide a general summary of essential responsibilities for the position and is not meant as an exhaustive list. Assignments may differ for individuals within the same role based on business conditions, departmental need or geographic location.

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world‚Äôs largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that‚Äôs anything but dull ‚Äì a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners ‚Äì all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It‚Äôs thanks to them that we have grown ‚Äì with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talent ‚Äì for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can‚Äôt sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You‚Äôll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here‚Äôs what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here‚Äôs how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there‚Äôs no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.

About Meltwater  Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. Our employees embody the ‚Äòwork hard, play hard‚Äô spirit, and we are lucky to have some of the best and most talented people out there. We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.  With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world‚Äôs most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making.  Role: Enterprise Business Development Representative (APAC)  The Enterprise Business Development Representative is the first step in your journey towards becoming a successful Sales Executive in the Meltwater APAC Enterprise Sales division. This is a regional role spanning APAC, designed to help the candidate learn about the digital media industry and the various use cases of Meltwater‚Äôs full suite of solutions. The role will allow you to develop consultative sales techniques and participate in meetings with C-Suite Executives, while advocating for more organizations to adopt digital media solutions.  You will be working with the strongest sales performers in Meltwater, to help build their sales pipeline and work hand in hand to establish the APAC Enterprise Solutions business. Success in this position requires a passion for sales, excellent communication and presentation skills, and sharp business acumen.  What You‚Äôll Do Business development and sales support role in our APAC Enterprise Sales division, working very closely with the Enterprise Sales Directors to accelerate sales & revenue growth in APAC Focus on driving the top of the sales funnel ‚Äì such as sales pipeline generation, lead qualification of new & existing clients for the purpose of driving sales & revenue Qualify inbound leads, and reach out to outbound prospects effectively, ensuring a growing and steady stream of opportunities to be converted to successful deals Initiate early conversations with clients to understand their pain points, grow their excitement towards Meltwater, and start building value by sharing our differentiating factors Book a steady flow of demos and meetings for interested clients, where you will also introduce the Sales Director who continues with the sales process Some element of presales work, such as putting together business proposals, presentations, pitch decks, proof of concepts, and collecting use cases Become an expert user of our SaaS platforms Contribute to Meltwater APAC Enterprise Sales division‚Äôs sales performance Who You Are Attained Bachelor‚Äôs degree (in any specialization) Entry level / have up to 2 - 3 years of relevant sales experience Curious about and understand the value of digital marketing / social media / MarTech / MarCom Interest in tech & SaaS / media intelligence, and a regular consumer of the news / media High level of drive & stamina to succeed in sales Prior experience cold calling, booking and conducting software demos, or exposure to sales processes from prospecting to closing of deals Good to have track record of successes and highlights in sales achievements Exceptional interpersonal, communication and stakeholder management skills Self-motivated, proactive, and organized with the ability to work under tight deadlines and in a high-pressure environment What We Offer Competitive salary & bonuses, with commissions and bonuses! Fast career progression and empowerment in your role Flat hierarchy with diverse, high-performance & collaborative teams Global presence and a uniquely Meltwater culture like no other Both flexible work arrangement & vibrant office spaces with well-stocked pantries Generous vacation leave & work-life balance Meltwater Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/  ()

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world‚Äôs largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that‚Äôs anything but dull ‚Äì a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners ‚Äì all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It‚Äôs thanks to them that we have grown ‚Äì with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talent ‚Äì for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can‚Äôt sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You‚Äôll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here‚Äôs what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here‚Äôs how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there‚Äôs no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job ‚Äì it‚Äôs the beginning of a career full of opportunities!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: About Bytedance  Responsibilities  Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.  Join the Fast Growing Enterprise Team  As part of the Enterprise Partnership and Solution Team, you help enterprise customers build what's next for their business. Leveraging Bytedance's cutting-edge intelligent technologies, we are devoted to developing innovative products and solutions to shape the future. It is the best time to join us and pave the new era together!  The Role  The Sales Development Representative /Inside Sales Specialist will work closely with Marketing, Solution and User growth teams to collect and organize sales leads that fit well with our Tech2B products. You will be responsible for detecting market opportunities and developing leads across all channels, including marketing events, industry reports, blogs, social media, among others. You will ensure that our sales leads are of the highest quality, with the goal of targeting potential customers. Meanwhile, you are in charge of grading all the leads and distributing them to the hands of sales representatives in a timely manner.  SDR are responsible for developing and qualifying new prospect opportunities within their assigned territory. They work closely with ByteDance Marketing, AEs and Alliances teams in developing targeted strategies and messaging to drive new opportunities. In partnership with these groups, we educate prospects, build relationships, qualify opportunities and generate healthy sales pipeline. Generating new business opportunities to fuel the Sales Pipeline Conducting high level conversations with business owners in prospect accounts Achieving monthly & quarterly quotas of Meetings Generated and Qualified Opportunities Develop your sales skills, market understanding, solutions knowledge and customer approach to generate valuable business opportunities. Attend training and coaching regularly and adopt proven selling methodology. Qualifications  Who You Are 2 - 7 years of technology related business development or proven experience in SDR/Inside Sales function or leads generation related Knowledge or previous experience in using (any) tools like: Outreach - SalesLoft - Salesforce - HubSpot - LinkedIn Sales Navigator - ZoomInfo - etc. Passionate about technology/SaaS/PaaS/IaaS and sales Experience in a business-to-business (B2B) environment, high-tech products/services preferred Willingness to learn and ambition to grow professionally Confident communicator with excellent verbal and written skills

A career that makes a difference  Get a head start with our salaried Sales Management Associate (SMA) programme. It is a unique, accelerated and structured pathway for you to be a successful Sales Leader or Specialist within Income‚Äôs distribution channels.  A programme unlike any other.  Accelerate your knowledge and skills to become an effective sales professional. Learn more about the business processes of insurance and recruitment through job appreciation opportunities. Get direct access and exclusive mentorship from the management team. Earn as you learn. Get started on the SMA programme while you study for licencing exams.   Develop a fulfilling career with us.  The SMA programme exposes you to many opportunities within Income's sales channels. Depending on your interest, aptitude and strengths, you can further develop your career along a specialist or management track. Choose one that best suits your talents and aspirations.  Minimum Qualification:  'A' Level with (3H2 & 2H1 Pass) Local Diploma Degree  Attractive and Competitive Remuneration ‚Ä¢Earn as you learn with a basic salary $2,900 + incentive ‚Ä¢Attractive staff benefits + leave entitlement of 18 days Comprehensive group medical coverage iFlex dollars which starts from $1,040 per year Transport reimbursement of up to $200 per month for your sales appointment
