description: As the world moves even more online due to the coronavirus pandemic, customers are connected and empowered like never before. Customers want an immediate, personalized and consistent experience, no matter which channel they choose to engage with a brand. Sprinklr helps brands meet the demands of today‚Äôs customers by providing them with the insights they need to make every interaction matter. Sprinklr is a Customer Experience Management (CXM) platform for modern enterprises with 3000+ employees helping the world‚Äôs most valuable enterprises make their customers happier. Learn more about our culture and how we make our employees happier through The Sprinklr Way .  We currently have a great opportunity for a Sales Development Representative to join our motivated and creative Inside Sales team! As an SDR, you'll be responsible for creating interest and developing conversations with contacts at enterprise corporations. Team members are passionate about the ongoing transformation of inside sales to something that is personal, value-filled, and representative of social disruption.  What You'll Do  You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking and sending personal, strategic, value-add emails, out bound calls and social messages (no copying and pasting). You will be able to quickly research a company, see opportunities, and strategise an approach to build interest. You will profile potential prospects based on predetermined criteria. You will secure meetings for your Account Executives.  Who You Are And What Makes You Qualified Desire to be in a software sales (full cycle) position as a career progression Have a verifiable track record of success and goal attainment in a sales-oriented role Have a passion for technology and disruptive technology Have a deep understanding of the role social media plays in business Have 1-2 years in an SDR/BDR role (Enterprise experience preferred) You have a run-through-a-brick-wall level of drive, passion, and desire for results Why you'll love Sprinklr: We‚Äôre committed to creating the kind of culture where you feel like you belong, are happier today than yesterday, and your contributions matter. At Sprinklr, our goal is to treat everyone like family and passionately, genuinely care. For full-time employees, we offer flexible paid time off and paid parental leave, medical plans, dental and vision plans, life insurance, 401(k) savings plans, employee stock options, gym and wellness discounts, Plum benefits, Lifemart discounts, and paid time off to invest in learning and career development.  We focus on our mission: We founded Sprinklr with one mission: to enable every organization on the planet to make their customers happier. Our vision is to be the world‚Äôs most loved enterprise software company, ever.  We believe in our product: Sprinklr was built from the ground up to enable a brand‚Äôs digital transformation. Its platform provides every customer-facing team with the ability to reach, engage and listen to customers around the world. At Sprinklr, we have many of the world's largest brands as our clients, and our employees have the opportunity to work closely alongside them.  We invest in our people: At Sprinklr, we believe every human has the potential to be amazing. We empower each Sprinklrite in the journey toward achieving their personal and professional best. For wellbeing, this includes daily meditation breaks, virtual fitness, and access to Headspace. We have continuous learning opportunities available with LinkedIn Learning and more.  EEO - Our philosophy: Our goal is to ensure every employee feels like they belong and are operating in a judgement-free zone regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, age, and lifestyle preference, among others. We value and celebrate diversity and fervently believe every employee matters and should be respected and heard. We believe we are stronger when we belong because collectively, we‚Äôre more innovative, creative, and successful.  Sprinklr is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. See also Sprinklr‚Äôs EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by filling out this form , and we will reach out to you. If you have additional questions, please contact accomodations@sprinklr.com.

description: Job Summary  We are looking for a Customer Support Specialist to be the company‚Äôs first line of customer care. This person will be highly responsive to the customers‚Äô support issues by being sufficiently technical to address routine questions and problems in a timely manner and managing the interface to the rest of the company on all other issues.  Customer Support Specialist responsibilities include resolving customer queries, recommending solutions and guiding product users through features and functionalities. To be successful in this role, you should be an excellent communicator who‚Äôs able to earn our clients‚Äô trust.  Ultimately, you will help establish our reputation as a company that offers excellent customer support during all sales and after-sales procedures.  About Us  Founded in 2010, Votiro is the pioneer in next-generation Content Disarm and Reconstruction technology, also known as Positive Selection Technology ‚Ñ¢. Votiro is a company in rapid growth with a strong presence in APAC and the US.  To learn more about Votiro please visit: www.votiro.com  What we offer  Votiro offers excellent benefits such as work-life benefits, self-enrichment, parental leave, child & family care leaves per local legislation. Unique working environment with plenty of development opportunities for you to further progress your career.  Responsibilities  Manage and handle all customer tickets and urgent requests which meeting our SLAs. Be the focal point for our customers and identify customer needs and help them achieve their goals. Work with our customers\POC during implementation and production of their Votiro‚Äôs Server-based applications. Reproduce customer cases for detailed troubleshooting and analysis. Update our internal databases with information about technical issues and useful discussions with customers. Share feature requests, effective workarounds, knowledge base entries with team members. Inform customers about new features and functionalities. Follow up with customers to ensure their technical issues are resolved. Gather customer feedback and share with our Product, Sales and Marketing teams  Requirements and skills  3-5 years as a Tier 3 Technical Support Engineer (Software security industry preferred) or similar CS role. Hands-on experience with OS (Linux\Windows). Understanding with O365 and SMTP mail gateway Understanding of K8S infra and understanding of Docker Containers. Hands-on experience with virtual and/or Cloud-based Environments (such as VMWare and AWS) Familiarity and understanding with network communication, protocols\technologies (TCP/IP, HTTP, Proxies and Load Balancers). Excellent troubleshooting skills and hands-on experience solving problems with a strong sense of customer commitment. Experience with script writing (bash\PowerShell) ‚Äì an advantage. Team player with a positive attitude, empathy, with high energy. Naturally curious and excited to learn new technologies. Meets relevant clearances requirements for Singapore.  Location  This is a Singapore-based work from home office position, travels to customer sites are to be expected. The Customer Support Specialist will report to the Customer Service organization Tel Aviv, with some day-to-day direction coming from the Singapore Sales/Tech lead.  Customers  Most customers will be in Singapore, the Asia Pacific and Japan countries coverage to be expected. Customers outside Singapore will be assigned as needed. On a time-permitting basis, this Customer Support Specialist will assist the APAC Sales Engineer.  Votiro does not accept unsolicited head-hunter & agency resumes, we will not pay fees to any third-party agencies who are not registered with Votiro.

description: About Perx: Perx Technologies is a category-creating Lifestyle Marketing SaaS Platform helping large enterprises and digital native businesses transform from transient and transactional brands to delivering continuous and meaningful customer engagements in the digital economy. Powering large regional and global brands, the platform enables organizations of all sizes to monetize customer engagements by creating personalized, interactive revenue-generating digital experiences for millions of end consumers.  Quick Snapshot: We are looking for a partner account executive who will work with the team to expand our ISV partner ecosystem, strategize GTM & manage key channels. We are rapidly growing in a dynamic and high energy environment and are looking for a self-driven, results-oriented person who can take ownership of our channels & partners. You must be an innovative team player who is able to manage a fast-paced workload dealing with a demanding and ever-changing marketplace. ¬≠¬≠ What will you get to do every day?  Develop effective & efficient channel sales strategies for revenue generation. Be responsible for key channel partner engagement. Lead joint/co-GTM strategy with partners. Aligning channel strategy to complement Perx‚Äôs direct sales activities. Identify, qualify, develop & drive new partnerships with system integrators, distributors, consultants, industry influencers & other channel partners  What are we looking for?  Hustler & Closer: He/she will help us expand the ISV flywheel in the areas we need where long term OEMing does not qualify. A little background in account management would be helpful. People person who knows how to manage relationships with at least middle managers at partner‚Äôs organization. He/she has to have a deal maker mindset, understand businesses, value propositions & knowing how to consult partners to put the bits & pieces of a deal together. He/she will need to learn what our existing partners do - industry/value prop/keep up to date. Experience with marketing technology platforms, SaaS, and/or loyalty marketing products and services. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact with cross-functional teams at all levels.  What‚Äôs on offer?  Collaborative environment and the opportunity to work with one of Asia‚Äôs leading players in the Martech and Fintech space. Opportunity to work with > 1Bn B2C global conglomerates in the banking, large retail, insurance and telecom sectors. Work with a globally hand-picked talent of 50+ employees who power some of the largest brands in the region who leverage the SaaS platform to engage with 50Mn+ consumers each day. Great career development opportunities across marketing, pre-sales and customer engagement teams offered with cross developmental training.  We understand that product innovation comes from people innovation and that is why we invest in high potentials and cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you are passionate about creating and contributing to a top-notch culture - join us. This is your opportunity to be part of an incredible story that is only getting bigger and more exciting by the day. We are passionately disrupting the traditional loyalty space and redefining what it means for brands to have meaningful relationships with their customers in the mobile first economy.  To find out more about who we are and why we exist go to: www.perxtech.com

Education And Experience  At least Diploma in International Business, Marketing or related field required; Candidate without experience may apply as training will be provided Kindly send resume to hr@fasttrack.com.sg or WhatsApp "Sales Job" to +6596603934.

description: We are representing our client, a Swedish consultancy organization  to look for a strategy/ business consultant, it is to be part of their growing footprint and presence in Southeast Asia. Their organization in Southeast Asia is today consisting of six markets with a mission to assist Swedish companies to develop and grow their business in the region. Singapore is the Market Area Hub for the region.   It is a varied job in which you will encounter many types of client and service. Work ranges from complex strategic deals to smaller operational projects and clients vary from multinationals to small family-owned businesses. Sector focus are technology,‚ÄØsmart cities, digital, life science and Healthcare, FMCG.   Main Responsibilities: You will be working in a challenging environment to provide support to our clients in their international business development. Work independently as well as in teams, in different consulting assignments. Tasks include strategic and market analyses, recommendations on strategic issues, as well as more specific such as arranging business meetings with local clients and/or partners, developing knowledge and network in priority sectors, amongst others.  Identifying new business opportunities, as well as prospecting, contacting new potential clients, setting up and participating in sales meetings both in Sweden and in the region Hands-on different kinds of execution and implementation projects Support in trade promotional activities and of course participating in developing a suggested solution and closing the deal.    Requirements  Academic degree, probably a Master of Science in Business, Administration or/and Engineering  At least 2 years of working experience as management consultant/ analyst in managing projects, research or work streams You have experience in market analysis and research, in participating in lead generation and involvement in client dialogues  A high level of proficiency in both written and spoken English You are results-oriented, highly analytical and adaptable  Candidate from Big 4 consulting firm are welcome  Social and team-working skills are highly valued as well as an ability to handle new challenges   EA License no.: 16S8195 Registration no.: R1331805

description: About the company: At Svested, our vision is to supercharge growth, create wealth, and fulfill dreams through ownership. Our mission is to empower ownership through a flexible and simplified solution to maximise gain for every stakeholder in the company. We recognised the challenges and pain points that companies faced with regards to ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan). As such, Svested makes ESOP management easy for founders through advisory and an all-in-one platform for ESOP administration.  About the role: We are looking for an ambitious, business-oriented, customer-centric, driven, and energetic person to join us as a Business Development Executive. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing, qualifying, acquiring, and onboarding new customers. You will report to the Chief Commercial Officer.  What You Will Be Doing Develop & execute the go-to-market strategy and growth plan for Singapore and Southeast Asia Identify and acquire potential clients Establish, develop, and maintain positive relationships with partners, such as startups, VC and PE firms, accelerators, professional services firms, etc Collaborate with cross-functional teams and assist in the product development process by surfacing relevant feedback from partners Guide clients during the onboarding process and address feedback from clients Represent Svested at various platforms, such as events/tradeshows/webinars Analyse targets and outcomes, and review gaps and opportunities Identify trends and market opportunities in the ESOP space Prepare presentation deck to engage potential clients What you will gain and learn: Make a difference in the startup ecosystem by helping founders and employees understand the value of ESOP Join an ambitious and fast-growing team as an early team member Build your communication, business development, and partnership skills Connect and work with startups founders What We Look For You are a Singaporean or Singapore PR You are a recent graduate (less than two years of working experience) with a degree in business, economics, marketing, or related field You have a positive attitude and are a team-player You possess an entrepreneurial spirit, take initiative, and adopt an innovative approach to problem solving You can work well in a fast-paced environment You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, enjoy interacting and forming relationships with partners You are organised, analytical, and comfortable with data You have experience in building partnerships / sales / business development You have a keen interest and a good network within the startup ecosystem in Southeast Asia In the Cover Letter section, please include a short paragraph (3-5 sentences) answering the following three questions. 1) Why you are interested in this role? 2) What skills/experiences do you have that will be helpful for this role? 3) List three startups (Series A and below) you will reach out to that will benefit from our service and offering A generic cover letter will be ignored.
industries: Financial Services

description: About the Company Decathlon, Europe's leading sports retailer, is recruiting passionate sports people for its expansion in Singapore and the SEA region. We believe that humans are at the heart of our business, innovation is endless and that the freedom to decide and act is vital in building a strong workforce. Join our purpose and let's make sports accessible to the many! Game changers and sport lovers, our doors are wide open for you!  Your Role To satisfy sport users and ensure profitable, sustainable growth in Southeast Asia, the Offer & Supply Sport leader will have to make available the best offer on DECATHLON products for their portfolio. Your time will be split evenly between Category Management, Merchandising and Supply Chain.  Your Responsibilities  Category Management and Merchandising Function To create the yearly business plan for the region with global product development team Drive the entire product life cycle across various platforms from ideation, requirements gathering, research, product selection to launch and iterations To develop pricing strategies for the assortment range (new and End-of-Line products) and the prices per SKU To liaise with stores in the SEA region to manage new product launching and entire product life cycles with stores  Supply Chain Function To oversee the end-to-end vertical supply chain from Order Fulfilment, Shipping, Warehousing and Inventory Management to ensure good availability of products for sport users Interact with global and regional stakeholders to execute capital and operational purchases to deliver cost savings and reduce lead times To conduct demand planning and control the replenishment needs of products based on sales and capacity of factory supply production Develop stock optimization policies based on demand and stock flow parameters for good stock rotation Align with Global and Regional Strategies to perform effectively all purchasing activities Make data-driven decisions quantitatively and qualitatively  What you will need to be successful in the role Have a passion for sports Preferably a Bachelor's degree in any discipline Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and strong analytical skills Knowledge in SAP will be an advantage Have good business acumen and user/ customer-centric Strong communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills that will enable you to earn trust at all levels Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment  Benefits Salary will commensurate with experience and capabilities Monthly bonus based on sales performance - up to 20%. Opportunities to meet like-minded people and practice sports at work Generous staff discount across all brands Medical and insurance benefits Local and Global opportunities for career/ zig-zag progression and/or specialization (You decide your own career path!)   Think you're a good fit for the role? Apply Now!

description: Description  The successful candidate will be part of our Singapore Media Academy (SMA), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Mediacorp. SMA is an appointed Media Continuing Education and Training (CET) centre for the Creative Industries. Aspiring talents and working professionals can now look forward to upgrading themselves through the nationally recognised Creative Industries (CI) Workforce Skills Qualifications (WSQ) training programmes at SMA.  Responsibilities Recruitment: Students Optimise all recruitment efforts through direct sales techniques, cold calling etc. Ensure effective and efficient management of leads and successful conversion into enrolment Manage the admissions process for students to the point of contract-signing Ensure potential students are compliant to funding, academic and admissions requirements Timely management of approval processes prior to confirmation of classes Identify opportunities and/or sources to acquire new customers/clients. Where required lead and/or manage assigned projects. Recruitment: B2G ‚Äì Local Plan and engage B2G clients to promote relevant training offerings and/or customized curriculum Ensure effective and efficient management of leads and successful conversion into enrolment Account service clients from point of first meeting to the confirmation of training and post training follow-ups Write training proposals in accordance to the training requirements and obtain the relevant approvals for customized training Engage clients for follow-up training, identify and follow-up on cross-selling opportunities Ensure timely billing of completed training Maintain an up-to-date database of clients Recruitment of Industry Professionals - Local Engage and recruit local media professionals and related companies/ organisations to promote relevant upskilling training programmes Ensure effective management of leads from engagement to conversion into enrolment Account service clients to gain understanding of training needs and propose training needs to Academic Affairs Department Manage the application of funding and admissions process for enrollees Follow-up on post training evaluations Maintain an up-to-date database of clients Other Areas Monitor actual sales performance vs projection. Where needed, follow up with appropriate remedial strategies to close or minimize variance. Maintain an up-to-date database of students and corporate clients. Maintain an up-to-date detailed sales pipelines, clients and students‚Äô recruitment/ enrolment tracking forms. Support Sales activities and where required manage assigned projects. Conduct comparative analysis and prepare reports as necessary. Take ownership of relevant regulatory and funding processes and ensure full compliance. Provide support for audit matters, when required. Participate and contribute actively towards any review exercise and/or new initiatives. Identify and carry out ad-hoc quality improvements initiatives. Undertake any other roles and duties as assigned by the Management. Requirements Minimum Diploma in Business/Marketing/Media or related field with at least 2 years of relevant work experience. Some track record in Sales Sales contribution to meet/exceed sales targets preferred Familiar with state funded programmes and Edutrust Process and requirements Proficient in writing of proposals Strong interpersonal and communication/presentation skills. Must be able to work independently yet strong team player. Detailed, able to plan and execute Proficient in Microsoft applications. Mediacorp is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where talent thrives. Our hiring decisions are made based on merit and fit-to-role. If you have a disability or special need which requires accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. We will be happy to support as necessary.  Thank you for your interest and application to this role. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.  Thank you for your interest and application to this role. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

description: Building a Safer Cyberspace  At Horangi, we‚Äôre passionate about building safer cyberspace and creating software and services that solve challenging cybersecurity problems. Horangi focuses on building partnerships with our customers, developing an understanding of their business goals and building a security strategy that helps achieve their objectives. Horangi‚Äôs personnel have extensive engineering experience and a strong background in penetration testing, incident response and strategic consulting including both large multinational networks and small organisations with focused missions. We enjoy solving tough security problems and we are eager to find new challenges and build new relationships.  The Job  As a world-class Inside Sales Representative, you will play a central role in scaling our Go-to-Market team by driving the full sales cycle from pipeline generation to winning new customers. You will build and close a sales pipeline by engaging in professional conversations with executives from targeted companies to drive interest, qualifying inbound demand, and demonstrating strong sales skills to drive the sales process to closure. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen and communication skills and be both persistent and resilient in striving to exceed goals.  As the first touchpoint with customers, you will play a key role in establishing Horangi as a differentiated Cybersecurity SaaS platform that focuses on creating value for each prospect & customer. You will need to partner cross-functionally with the Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to help build and execute repeatable sales plays.  For the right person that can bring passion, drive, and innovation to a fast-growing global company, this position offers the unique opportunity to have a considerable impact on the rapid growth of Horangi. You can build your professional skills and develop an incredibly successful career at Horangi.  What You Will Do Engage and evaluate leads with precise qualification Build and execute repeatable outbound prospecting sales plays to build pipeline with high velocity Collaborate with Marketing and Strategic Sales to build a penetrate target accounts Identify key contacts for strategic target accounts, and firmly build the foundations for Strategic Sales Engagement Research & track target companies to understand how Horangi's solutions can add value to their organization Use a data-driven approach to identify success criteria and accelerate sales cycles Leverage your sales acumen to identify decision-makers early and progress the sales at each interaction Remotely deliver compelling product demos Track, report, and maintain prospects within the CRM database to maximize productivity Consistently achieve weekly and monthly activity metrics & quota targets Who You Are A Degree in Business, Marketing or relevant working experience preferred 3 -5 years of work experience preferred You have the discipline to work with autonomy in a remote fast-paced environment You've accomplished something you're really proud of Have a high level of integrity Love prospecting & hunting What You Bring 2- 5 years of quota carrying inside sales experience at a technology company You have the aptitude to quickly learn new technologies and industries Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional telephone presence Consistent track record of top performance in prior roles Thrive in high volume & high-velocity environments Comfortable working with high degrees of autonomy in a global team Self-starter with the hunger to be great Thrive in ambiguity and are able to create processes to drive productivity Join us at Horangi, and do the best work of your life!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

description: About us:  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.  In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn's Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don't take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  As the Sales Marketing Coordinator, you will be the bridge between Aspire's marketing and sales teams and be responsible for deeply understanding the needs of our high value clients, and translating that into marketing material and campaigns to drive growth. This is an opportunity for a growth-minded, B2B communication marketer to drive growth in one of the fastest growing B2B fintechs in the region.  What you will be doing: Developing, driving and implementing an outstanding B2B marketing strategy focused on high-value clients Talking to our sales teams to understand the needs of our high-value client segment, and using those insights to craft marketing initiatives with the goal of acquiring these startups Working closely with cross functional teams (brand & campaign marketing, sales, and operation teams)  We would love to get to know you if you have the following: A minimum of 3 years of experience in marketing or communications Experience in fintech or B2B startup would be an advantage Self-starter, ability to work and thrive within a fast-paced, culturally diverse and evolving environment Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English A Bachelor's or Master's degree preferably in Business, Marketing, or Communications related
industries: Financial Services

description: Location: Singapore Type: Full-time  ROLE DESCRIPTION Homage is a leading technology startup in the healthcare sector operating across Asia Pacific that is transforming the way personalised healthcare is delivered and accessed. We are looking for a telesales associate that is looking to play a key function in Homage‚Äôs inside sales team and make a key impact to Homage‚Äôs growth journey.  As part of the telesales team, you will play a consultative role and be the first touch point for our customers through our different inbound sales channels. In your role, you will enable care recipients, families and care organizations to get access to caregiving services across Singapore, while also achieving team sales goals.  RESPONSIBILITIES Develop, nurture & close leads through sales processes Qualify and gain a deep understanding of client needs and communicate the most appropriate Homage care plan and service offering Conduct consultative sales and execute Homage‚Äôs sales process via our inbound phone and email channels  Help improve the sales playbook and processes and contribute best practices  Build a great client experience by assisting clients with usage of our technology platform, service solution set and care planning  Navigate a high volume of sales leads; and follow-up on inbound leads to proactively convert leads and articulate the Homage proposition to prospective clients Develop an understanding of the long-term caregiving landscape and unique requirements to strategically upsell or cross-sell Homage‚Äôs offerings Work closely with Care Operations and Marketing teams to drive process and client activation efficiencies within the team  SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Excellent written and verbal communication skills A Customer-first mentality  A growth mindset Initiative to find the relevant resources needed to be successful in this role An ability to work collaboratively to solve problems Receptive to constructive criticism and open to coaching Highly communicative, energetic, loves building relationships and rapport with others and in general a people-person Organised and attentive to details Experience in hospitality, startups or healthcare-related companies is a plus Inbound sales or customer support experience is a plus  Do you want to join a fulfilling, impactful, high performing and scaling team at Homage?  ABOUT HOMAGE Homage is a leading technology startup in the healthcare and wellness industry. We are redefining caregiving and medical services across APAC through our technology platform. Homagers will directly impact the lives of people receiving care, people delivering care, and the families that are normally left in the dark about the entire caring process. We're looking for strong and versatile team players who can work with a very diverse team. We‚Äôre proudly backed by a group of top local investors, including East Ventures Growth, Golden Gate Ventures, 500 Startups and SeedPlus.  Homage has established partnerships with government, health, and financial organisations to distribute and deliver home-based and community caregiving services, most notably in supporting Singapore‚Äôs COVID-19 frontline efforts in 2020.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: Job Title Account Manager  Location Singapore  Start Date As per notice  Salary Market Competitive  My client, a well established Telco company is seeking out an Account Manager.  As an Account Manager, you nurture the relationships we have built with clients, supporting them to unlock their business and technology challenges. You thrive of growing these relationships and identifying new ways to address their strategic needs.  Your ability to listen to and deeply understand our customers, combined with your understanding of products and services, sees you deliver exceptional sales moments with clients. In doing so you contribute to high-value, high-profit sales solutions that directly contribute to growth.  Key Responsibilities Meet or exceed monthly sales targets agreed upon, including only sales opportunities developed through Third Party Agents or White Labelling Methodology. Aggressively drive Third Party Agents to maximize sales and total partnership potential through best sales practices, training and support. Identify and initiate sales opportunities and work with Third Party Agents to conclude sales. Assist Third Party Agents in developing and managing lead generation activities, including online and direct initiatives through coordination with Internal Marketing Department. Track the progress on all Third Party Agents sales opportunities and record the opportunities into internal management system. Track and report Third Party Agent sales and/or assigned direct customers' issues and work with internal resources to resolve issues. Support Third Party Agent marketing activities with pre-sales resources, references, case studies, gross profit calculation with assistance from the pricing team. Maintain and foster relationship with Third Party Agents to ensure that Telstra services are being positively promoted and recommended to the end-customers. Identify and assign sales goals for the identified Third Party Agents If this role is of interest to you, please get in touch and send your CV to iahmed@leap29.com  If you know anyone for this role please send their details across, all referrals are appreciated and welcome.  All the best!  To help Leap29 find you that perfect job, we need to store and process your personal information.  That means that your details will be entered into Leap29's database and our consultants may contact you from time to time with relevant job opportunities.  By applying you're confirming you're happy for us to do that!  Sector Technology

description: Digital Sales Leader - APAC  Would you enjoy working in a dynamic role responsible for sales growth?  Are you a leader looking for a new opportunity?  Join our Waygate Technologies Sales team  As the world leader in non-destructive testing (NDT), Waygate Technologies offers the broadest portfolio of industrial inspection solutions. Our solutions include radiography and computed tomography (CT), remote visual inspection, ultrasound and eddy current technologies. We ensure safety, quality and productivity for our customers across major industries around the world.  Take ownership for business growth  The APAC Digital Sales Leader is the principle commercial driver for all Digital Solutions products in region. Working across multiple functions to ensure products are correctly defined to meet customer needs and commercialization plans.  As Digital Sales Leader - APAC, you will be responsible for:  Delivering the target order number whilst identifying lucrative related business opportunities within new verticals and spaces Working with cross functional teams to understand customer voice and optimize offering whilst developing go-to-market plans Working to grow, develop and incentivize sales staff on the customer success team to be the consultant to our customers Assisting in annual Waygate Technologies Forum as well as other events to inspire dialogue, innovation and adoption of new ideas. Working to establish Waygate Technologies as the thought leader in our target markets.  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Have extensive sales experience in the field of NDT, quality management, process control or similar Be able to demonstrate a successful track record of working cross functionally at a senior management level Have the ability to access and maintain customer relationships at a senior level Possess deep domain knowledge of manufacturing industry digital solutions Have an analytical and strategic mind-set, ability to quickly move from details to the holistic view Have a knowledge of product marketing tools and techniques as well as general financial knowledge Possess a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering or equivalent  Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:  Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive  Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.  Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:  Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits  About Us  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we‚Äôre committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we‚Äôre always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let‚Äôs come together and take energy forward.  Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. description: As a Customer Support Specialist you will provide a helping hand to our Customers who are growing their business with HubSpot.  Our Support team quickly adapts to customer needs to deliver a human and consultative support experience through creative problem-solving and a thorough knowledge of how HubSpot works.  Check out the Video below to learn more about the role from our Customer Support Specialists at HubSpot APAC. Video Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T4GfqGt2ufk In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To Develop deep knowledge of the HubSpot software Partner with our customers to effectively resolve issues/ troubleshoot through chat, email and chat. Answer how-to questions and help customers navigate a variety of tools within HubSpot Provide support & guidance to marketers, salespeople, and service professionals across our customer base that use the HubSpot software Communicate thoughtful, customized solutions that help customers move forward and grow their business Collaborate with internal teams such as account managers or sales teams, and identify opportunities for existing customers to use more of our platform or services Show composure, resilience, and flexibility as customer needs evolve and case volume changes. We Are Looking For People Who Find creative problem solving fulfilling & challenging Are self-motivated & eager to learn Thrive in a dynamic environment and are comfortable with ambiguity Adapt quickly to changing priorities and customer needs Passionate about working with customers and finding solutions that make their goals possible Outstanding communicator, articulate, fluid conversationalist We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply ‚Äî we‚Äôd love to hear from you.  About HubSpot  HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers‚Äô needs at any stage of growth. We‚Äôre also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you‚Äôd like to be part of, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.  Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.  By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot‚Äôs use of your personal information.

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world‚Äôs largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that‚Äôs anything but dull ‚Äì a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners ‚Äì all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It‚Äôs thanks to them that we have grown ‚Äì with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talent ‚Äì for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can‚Äôt sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You‚Äôll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here‚Äôs what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here‚Äôs how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there‚Äôs no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job ‚Äì it‚Äôs the beginning of a career full of opportunities!

description: Falcon employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We‚Äôd love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way‚Äîall so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.  Falcon.io provides a unified SaaS platform for social media listening, engaging, publishing and managing customer data. We enable our clients to explore the full potential of digital marketing by managing multiple customer touch points from one platform. Our platform has already achieved great international traction in the market, with its technology endorsed by partnerships with Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Founded as Falcon Social in Copenhagen in 2010, we now also have offices in New York City, Berlin, Budapest, Sofia, Chennai, Melbourne, and growing. We‚Äôre a highly diverse team, and we‚Äôre always looking for passionate and curious people who want to be part of a fast-paced, high-energy environment.  Falcon.io has an ethos of encouraging autonomy, ambition, boldness and experimentation. We value open people who take initiative and aren‚Äôt afraid to fail, learn from mistakes, adjust, and try to get better at what they do every day.  Sales Development Representatives (SDR) play a key role in the Falcon.io sales process. In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to impact the growth of our business and support our sales team by engaging new clients. description: About THG THG is one of the world‚Äôs fastest growing and largest online retailers. We have over a decade of experience building and growing brands in the Beauty and Wellness sectors, in over 160 markets. We create brilliant digital brand experiences and our in-house team design, develop and build a bespoke proprietary technology platform that is used by hundreds of millions of people worldwide. With a world-class business, a proprietary technology platform, and disruptive business model, our ambition is to be the global digital leader. Our culture is fast-paced and ambitious ‚Äì we like to move twice as fast others believe to be possible. This belief is a fundamental part of the DNA that has supported our incredible growth. Our people are our strength and we have over 4,000 diverse, smart thinkers across the globe who are encouraged to think creatively and empowered to turn their ideas into actions. To support our ambitious growth, we are looking for commercially astute, ambitious individuals that can bring fresh and innovative thinking to THG and play a part in driving the Group forward on its truly exciting journey.  About Beauty Our Beauty division is Europe‚Äôs No1 Online Destination for Premium Beauty. Our mission is to empower people globally to look and feel fantastic every day. To enable us to do this we have offices across the UK, Europe, America and Australia filled with passionate beauty fanatics who are committed to delivering rapid growth in this exciting industry. We work with over 800 of the world‚Äôs greatest beauty brands such as MAC, Kerastase, GHD, Tom Ford and YSL to bring our customers the widest offering of beauty products from around the globe. Passion, innovation and commitment are key characteristics in this ever expanding team as we strive to become the Worlds No1 Online  About Loofantastic and Your Role Lookfantastic is Europe‚Äôs No1 Online Destination for Premium Beauty. Our mission is to empower people globally to look and feel fantastic every day. To enable us to do this we have offices across the UK, Europe, America, Australia & Singapore filled with passionate beauty fanatics who are committed to delivering rapid growth in this exciting industry. We work with over 800 of the world‚Äôs greatest beauty brands to bring our customers the widest offering of beauty products from around the globe. Passion, innovation and commitment are key characteristics in this ever expanding team as we strive to become the Worlds No1 Online. We have an exciting role for an experienced Trading Executive / E-Commerce Specialist to join our growing Beauty division. As part of a team of Trading Executives and reporting to the Country Manager, the Trading Executive is responsible for site optimization, growth strategy and brand identity, working cross functionally across the business to deliver continued growth in sales and profit.  Responsibilities: Working with the Marketing Team to plan, build and execute the campaign calendar. Driving continuous site improvements to maximise conversion and AOV and reduce bounce rate on site and reduce barriers to buying online. Ensuring all key trading moments are well planned and executed, clearly phased targets by day, site, and channel that have been collaboratively produced with central functions and a clear awareness of any activity from last year has been considered. Collaborating with brand teams to plan and ensure execution of brand strategies. Proactively planning ahead to ensure brand promotions and activations are given appropriate visibility across site and marketing channels. Close working relationship with ECRM team to ensure that site campaigns and key promotions are displayed appropriately in line with site merchandising. Work cross functionally across channels to understand which brands and discount levels are being pushed across all channels. Regular reporting of site‚Äôs overall performance in terms of KPIs: Revenue, GP, Conversion and Average Order Value. Monitor KPI performance across the site. Using analytics and our in-house reporting platform to gain a strong understanding of the customer journey to optimise sales, measure performance & define strategy. Share insights on customer behaviour and trends across beauty functions to drive best practice behaviour and learning.  Requirement People management: Inspire and motivate a team to deliver a shared goal Time management: Prioritise, structure work & effectively manage time Analytical ability ‚Äì ability to budget and review performance Excellent communicator ‚Äì able to give clarity and set direction Awareness of the beauty industry Strong knowledge of your brand partners Ability to form good working relationships with internal teams Critical thinker and problem-solving skills Project management skills Negotiation skills

description: Who We Are                Provenir is a global fintech company with offices across North America, the UK, and Singapore. Provenir helps fintechs, financial institutions, and payment providers make smarter decisions, faster. We are passionate about technology and empowering businesses to become industry leaders. As a leading provider of decisioning and analytics products for financial services and other industries, we empower businesses to create digital-first decisioning solutions that drive business growth. If you‚Äôd like to work at an innovative fintech with a global footprint that is redefining the industry, then we want you!  What You‚Äôll Do Our Business Development Representative role is an entry point into a career in Sales at Provenir. Responsible for researching target companies, identifying relevant individuals at those businesses, acquiring contact details, and contacting them with personalized messaging to generate and qualify new business leads. Once a lead is established, they will handle transitioning the lead to our sales network.  Develop and nurture prospect organizations and introduce them to the Provenir sales team Conduct a needs analysis and determine a prospect‚Äôs pain points and drive towards generating a lead and ultimately, an opportunity Build relationships with key decision makers hand off "warm" or qualified leads to Sales team Research all available resources (e.g., LinkedIn, web, google alerts etc.) to improve and increase our database Manage data for new and prospective clients in Salesforce.com, ensuring all communications are logged and information is accurate Collaborate with Marketing on campaigns and re-using content in lead nurturing process Revisit prior campaigns to contact previous leads and initiate new conversations Participate in weekly sales team meeting and brief Sales team before calls to ensure engagement and transparency  What's Required  Experience: BS in Business Management, Marketing, Computer Science, or any related field preferred. Ideally you will have up to 2 years of working experience/background in Fintech and or/financial services sales environment, but most importantly you will have a ‚Äòhunter‚Äô mentality, and like taking a hungry, self-starting, and proactive approach to generating new business leads.  Qualifications, Strengths and Skills  Efficient, process driven business acumen Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a keen eye for detail Ideally can demonstrate a record of selling and closing technical solutions Strong interest in selling software SaaS technology Self-directed, highly organized working style Demonstrated success in exceeding set goals and expectations (whether at University or work) Comfortable speaking clearly and concisely in real-time presentation environments# Willingness to learn negotiating skills and closing techniques. Ability to execute, meet deadlines and manage multiple priorities concurrently An active LinkedIn account and strong social selling skills Some knowledge of maintaining and expanding a Salesforce CRM database is advantageous The ability to understand complex technology and convey messaging to a range of prospects across target segments  Our employees are our top priority, we offer comprehensive health and wellness plans. You will enjoy paid time off and company holidays, flexible and remote-friendly opportunities, and maternity/paternity leave along with retirement benefits to plan for your future.  At Provenir, we recognize that diversity and inclusion make our teams stronger. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and welcome everyone regardless of race, ancestry, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, citizenship, veteran status or medical condition. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world‚Äôs largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that‚Äôs anything but dull ‚Äì a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners ‚Äì all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It‚Äôs thanks to them that we have grown ‚Äì with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talent ‚Äì for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can‚Äôt sit still? description: We‚Äôre looking for an Account Manager to join our fast growing Wise for Banks team in Singapore.  Your job will be to actively manage a portfolio of partners, define strategies to grow the accounts, execute on these opportunities to help more bank customers save with Wise. This will help us reach millions of new customers, transform the international payments experience for bank customers and have impact on Wise's mission  This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To Be Wise's representative to our bank partners in APAC. This means managing the relationships, understanding their business model, their problems and how Wise can solve these best Own and manage the relationship with partners day to day. This means being their first point of contact, handling escalations internally and externally, owning the invoice process, project managing ad-hoc queries as well as managing any crisis that might come up, chairing quarterly business reviews and regular business meetings Define and execute on growth opportunities. Using a data-driven approach, you will research, define and pitch growth strategies to partners as well as contribute to the overall strategy and growth of Wise for Banks in APAC. You will also work with individual partners on driving these initiatives further. Product & tech ‚Äì Work closely with banks on projects that enhance their API integrations for a better experience to end customers. Our API documents are public ‚Äì check these out to start understanding the product. Manage marketing campaigns. You‚Äôll create and drive joint partner marketing campaigns in order to help more customers save on international transfers by using Wise Onboard new banks. You will work closely with our sales & implementation teams to ensure smooth transition from implementation to active account management for new bank partners Manage contract renewals and renegotiations. You will have a high level understanding of different business streams, knowing when to bring in specialists (e.g legal, compliance, product, operations etc) About You You‚Äôll have experience working with big clients, be comfortable navigating the company‚Äôs organisational structure and identifying those that can influence decisions You‚Äôll possess exceptional partner relationship management skills and have a track record in successfully influencing and supporting partners You‚Äôll have experience managing a variety of tasks for multiple partners at the same time You‚Äôll be highly motivated and determined with a desire to contribute significantly to overarching commercial objectives You are self-driven and can work independently as well as in a team environment You‚Äôre comfortable with data, can draw meaningful conclusions from your analysis and are confident in presenting your findings We‚Äôre people without borders ‚Äî without judgement or prejudice, too. We want to work with the best people, no matter their background. So if you‚Äôre passionate about learning new things and keen to join our mission, you‚Äôll fit right in.  Also, qualifications aren‚Äôt that important to us. If you‚Äôve got great experience, and you‚Äôre great at articulating your thinking, we‚Äôd like to hear from you.

description: About Meltwater  Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. Our employees embody the ‚Äòwork hard, play hard‚Äô spirit, and we are lucky to have some of the best and most talented people out there. We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.  With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world‚Äôs most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making.  Role: Sales Consultant, Client Acquisition  As a Sales Consultant in our Client Acquisition team, you will be speaking to a wide range of companies across all industries, and get a chance to work with some of the most exciting companies throughout Southeast Asia. The right candidate will be responsible for the entire sales process as they liaise with C-Level Executives and directly pitch Meltwater's software solutions to them.  Our clients are typically in the Public Relations, Communications, or Marketing departments, and because Meltwater is a service that can value-add to businesses across all industries, you will get exposure to organizations of all shapes and sizes, helping you improve your business acumen with every step of the way.  For this role, we are looking for driven and ambitious professionals to join our team - someone who is passionate about sales, hardworking, intelligent, and well-rounded.  What You'll Do B2B sales role where you are responsible for driving Meltwater‚Äôs revenue growth through consultative sales and acquisition of new clients Drive the entire sales process from start to finish from prospecting & opportunity identification, cold calling, pitching, setting up client meetings, doing product demonstrations, till negotiations and closing of the sale Manage a pipeline of inbound and self-sourced leads to identify, engage, and develop relationships with potential prospects Educate and guide prospects through the buyer‚Äôs journey to help them understand how Meltwater can help drive their business goals and objectives Meet and exceed monthly sales targets Diligently keep informed of product developments, competitor movements and industry trends to stay ahead of the curve Collaborate and work closely with key internal stakeholders such as Client Success, Operations and Legal, etc. Who You Are Currently residing in Singapore Attained Bachelor‚Äôs degree (in any specialization) Entry level / have up to 1 - 2 years of work experience Curious about and understand the value of digital marketing / social media / MarTech / MarCom Interest in tech & SaaS / media intelligence, and a regular consumer of the news / media High level of drive & stamina to succeed in sales Prior experience cold calling, booking and conducting software demos, or exposure to sales processes from prospecting to closing of deals Good to have track record of successes and highlights in sales achievements Exceptional interpersonal, communication and stakeholder management skills Self-motivated, proactive, and organized with the ability to work under tight deadlines and in a high-pressure environment International experience (academic, personal, or professional) and held leadership roles in university What We Offer Competitive remuneration package, with uncapped monthly commissions and quarterly bonuses! Fast career progression & empowerment in your role Flat hierarchy with diverse, high-performance & collaborative teams Global presence & a uniquely Meltwater culture like no other Both flexible work arrangements & vibrant offices with well-stocked pantries Generous vacation leave & work-life balance Meltwater Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/  ()

description: Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a pioneering technology leader that is helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep the factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn from others. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation  For our Marketing, Sales and Product Management team, understanding the full potential of our technology and the trends in our markets is highly rewarding. In addition, helping customers all over the world improve efficiency, save resources and reduce emissions gives our work a powerful sense of purpose. You will lead all on-site activities of a project to assure cost-effective execution of project deliverables in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards, schedule, and safety requirements during the start-up, construction and/or erection, commissioning, maintenance phases. You will also sell solutions and service to customer with high volume at high profitability with excellent interpersonal skills to actively seek out prospects. This role is based in Singapore and will report to the Sales Manager.  Your Responsibilities Driving sales volume and margin across the Grid Integration portfolio. Establishing and maintaining strong customer relationships through excellent service and your knowledge of customer needs and solutions. Preparing sales plans and bids, with marketing and other departments, ensuring technical and financial accuracy. Contributing to the identification and development of new market opportunities in collaboration with the wider Sales team. Monitoring customer and market trends to develop effective marketing activities in collaboration with the Marketing team. Vendor management and exploration ‚Äì finding and maintaining partners for execution of new and innovative solutions. Living core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.  Your background Degree or Diploma in Engineering Minimum 2-5 years sales and engineering experience in electrical equipment with proven track record Highly desirable someone with experience in EV charging, eMobility Excellent negotiation and communication skills Able to work in team and good interpersonal skills Proven leadership skills, with a collaborative, solutions-oriented approach.  More About Us  Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a global technology leader with a combined heritage of almost 250 years, employing around 36,000 people in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, the business serves utility, industry and infrastructure customers across the value chain, and emerging areas like sustainable mobility, smart cities, energy storage and data centres. With a proven track record, global footprint and unparalleled installed base, Hitachi ABB Power Grids balances social, environmental and economic values, and is committed to powering good for a sustainable energy future, with pioneering and digital technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. www.hitachiabb-powergrids.com  Grid Integration

description: We extend a special welcome to applicants 40 years and higher, particularly those who are unemployed. We will train you as long as you are willing to learn and work with our head of sales.  What You Will Do As a TECHNICAL SALES MANAGER  We will provide you with a list of contacts and customers. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. description: JOB DESCRIPTION:  Enquiry Management:  - Ensure the PLO team captures all new enquiries (calls, email, online leads, walk-in‚Äôs etc.) in the CRM system from the date of receipt. - Ensure the PLO team records all appropriate information where appropriate into the CRM system. If this can‚Äôt be completed at first point of content, then should be captured after parents visiting the school. This information consists of: contact mode, how they heard about us, family information, year of interest etc. - Ensure the PLO team contact all new enquiries are followed up by phone within 24 hours. Email should only be used if no telephone is provided or overseas. - Ensure the PLO team email the prospect parent the school tour confirmation details - Ensure the PLO team contact the prospect parent 1 days before to re-confirm their appointment (email where necessary) Post school tour; ensure the PLO team sends a post tour email within 24 hours after the school tour. - Ensure the PLO team track and note all comments within the CRM in a timely manner and update their status. - Ensure the PLO team follow-up with all post tour parents by calling them 3 days post tour to check their status, or any other questions. - Ensure the PLO team arrange any follow-up meetings i.e. principals, trial, assessments within 1 week post tour. - Review the status of all enquiries from the CRM reporting (pre/post tour) ensure that the PLE‚Äôs are following up with their prospect parents. - Compile sales script/key bullets/stories for PLO team to improve the school tour. - Ensure that you receive all class newsletters to keep the PLO abreast of what‚Äôs happening in the school to aid the school tour, especially upper primary & secondary. - Review and shadow the PLE‚Äôs around school tours to ensure they are promoting the school in the right light i.e. curriculum, stories, facts etc. - Continuous review the school tour process with the PLE‚Äôs from start to end, i.e. explaining about EtonHouse, Curriculum, application documents etc. Ensure a 5-star customer service to parents.  Open House/Weekly School Tours:  - Managing the prospect leads to ensure all parents are recorded and confirmations are sent. Ensure the PLO team confirm attendance 2-3 days before the Open House - Allocate school tour groups for each school coordinator - Brief school coordinators as to the set-up for the open house - Ensure the school is clean/set-up ready for open house. - Work with the kitchen to ensure food etc. is provided and setup  Marketing:  - Submit to photos & videos from all school events (internal & external) and relevant class based projects i.e. toy fair, science week, book week etc. - Support in liaising with the academic team in getting marketing articles - Ensure all principal newsletters are submitted to IT to load on the website - Ensure the Zopim chat is always manned during the school hours Mon-Fri 8am-5pm - Any other related job duties as assigned  WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR:  - Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a recognised University with at least 5 to 6 years of related work experience in a sales management / business development role in the education services or a service-oriented industry. - Sales management experience is desirable - Experience working in an international school environment would be an added advantage. - Possess a collaborative attitude and work well in a team oriented work environment - Excellent written and verbal communication skills - Result oriented and a hands-on marketer

description: Inside sales Account Manager  Are you an energetic go-getter? Are you truly customer focused and result driven? Do you have a proven ability to turn leads into deals? Can you start and develop long term relationships?  The Department: Within Leaseweb, the Sales organization takes responsibility for the full sales cycle. From engaging prospects (business development) to seeking new opportunities to increase the services to existing customers (account management). The organization is quickly growing and engaging new international markets. We are now searching for an Inside Sales Account Manager to introduce Leaseweb solutions and grow our market share in different markets.  What is the role about? As an Inside Sales Account Manager you are responsible for inbound (and possibly also outbound) sales activities. All leads are generated by Marketing, chat, email, customer service, sales support or put though by 1st line inquiries. You give follow up to these leads, such as IP/HDD/Bandwidth upgrades. Pre-qualification is necessary. Part of the job is to also develop price offers for specified categories of leads using standardized pricing tools, and books orders. A big part is also building relationships with our customers. Facilitating service delivery resource allocation by entering sales contracts into databases. It's your responsibility that all customer/prospect information and data enrichments is stored correctly in the tools. Supporting Sales campaigns, which are being developed by Business Development and Marketing.  Responsibilities Closes sales and achieves quarterly quotas. Performs transactional sales with new and non-named existing customers. Supports sales representatives in administrative areas such as order processing, customer quotes, sales information management and finance, acting as the first point of contact for customers and prospects via telephone, website chat, social media and ticketing system. Responsible for developing and improving processes such as workflow management and procedures to support the sales process and participates in the development of requirements for sales support systems. Responsible to timely provide input for Finance (invoicing) and Operations (i.e. Capacity Management). Responsible that the web shop content always matches with available servers in the data centers by constantly managing the web shop. Assist the global customer care (L1) team with support for LeaseWeb Asia Pacific customers.  Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in any field or related area 2 - 4 years' of experience Knowledge of IT is prefered  Benefits include: Participation in annual company bonus scheme 18 days of paid time off  Startup look and feel office in CBD Access to the Leaseweb Academy, a personalized learning platform offering a variety of studies, courses, and trainings  Fun events year-round ‚Äì from virtual pub quizzes to summer parties, company runs, and much more  Monthly after work drinks (also virtual, for now!)   Want to learn more or apply? Please use the link to apply. For more information, please contact Barbara Poveda, Talent Acquisition Lead via: b.poveda@global.leaseweb.com  Recruitment agency? Thank you for your interest, but we are sourcing all our candidates directly. We appreciate you trying anyway but please keep in mind that any unsolicited profiles you send us will be treated as direct applications.

description: Life is different at N3. We are driven by our passions and propelled by our quest to innovate, thrive and learn. We are the tastemakers of technology, transforming the way the world works and shaping the future of business. We work hard. We play hard. We make moves. Here, success is no accident. It‚Äôs ours to grow.  N3, Part of Accenture, is a sales and marketing solutions firm dedicated to working with software and technology solutions providers. Our client base includes a range from small start-up companies to market leaders such as Microsoft, Cisco, Google, and more as well as their partner networks. N3 has sustained rapid growth since its founding in 2004.  We are a performance-based organization that rewards creativity, hard work, and success. N3 is not your typical corporate environment. Our business casual atmosphere and fast-paced workday make N3 a unique place to work.  Responsibilities Ability to successfully communicate with contacts via the phone on a daily basis. Requirements Fresh Graduate Bachelor's Degree may apply. Some sales or marketing experience is a huge plus. Excellent oral, written and verbal communications skills are required. General knowledge of the IT industry and leading products will be a great advantage. Ability to learn quickly, and retain knowledge. Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of integrity. Candidates who are self-motivated and have a great ethic. English & Korean speaking skills are important for this role due to the nature of business. description: Endeavor are offering the perfect opportunity for graduates to join IMG Media & Events as part of the Strategic Partnerships Sponsorship Sales Trainee Programme.
