Be familiar with all tools and systems and follow all due Sales Operations processes.  Knowledge & Experience Be commercially aware and have knowledge of brands associated with sponsorship of international events Previous work experience on events Numerate with ability to analyse and work with numbers Strong knowledge of digital landscape, active in social media Understanding of latest trends, new concepts in sponsorship Knowledge of other languages and international awareness would be beneficial Be educated to degree level (or equivalent qualification)Events, Sports, Business Studies, Marketing related degree (or equivalent)  Skills & Abilities Be a good administrator with attention to detail Possess strong IT skills ‚Äì Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Have excellent organisational skills with ability to prioritise and multi-task, and stay organised under pressure Showcase strong interpersonal communication skills to provide first rate service internally to colleagues and externally to clients Be completely discreet when handling/dealing with confidential information Demonstrate commercial and cultural awareness (as dealing with multi-national companies and international events) Be driven to achieve success and possess the hunger and curiosity to learn and be proactive in finding and chasing leads Enjoy working in a team environment with the ability to collaborate, seek feedback and build credibility through interaction with others  About IMG IMG is a global leader in Sports, Fashion, Events and Media, operating in more than 30 countries. The company manages some of the world‚Äôs greatest sports figures and fashion icons; stages hundreds of live events and branded entertainment experiences annually; and is a leading independent producer and distributor of sports and entertainment media. IMG also specializes in sports training and league development, as well as marketing, media and licensing for brands, sports organizations and collegiate institutions. IMG is part of the Endeavor network.

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand ‚Äì and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job To ensure a positive and joyful shopping experience for all IKEA visitors and customers. This includes in particular: Ensure the department is fast and efficient for our customers, and cost-effective for the IKEA store. Ensure that customers‚Äô issues are handled efficiently and with empathy. Actively working towards fulfilling the four tasks of the store. Your assignment I am helpful and friendly in my approach to my customers, always aiming for a win-win situation and for repeat business. I record information accurately in the relevant systems so that we can use the resulting analysis to make improvements to our customers‚Äô future shopping experiences. I know the Customer Relations action plan and support the goals and targets given to me by my manager to ensure the effective execution of our action plan. I know our daily and weekly service targets and this drives me to improve our service delivery. Develops a strong knowledge of the delivery and assembly facilities and provide/promote to customer. I optimise the relationship with our customers in order to drive sales growth and sustained long-term profitability. I am empowered to solve customer complaints within my level of authorisation. I recognise when I need to escalate an issue and then pass on the relevant information to a manager for him/her to be able to  deal effectively with the customer. Understanding the IKEA Concept, global solutions, tools and working methods and ensuring I use the appropriate manuals from Inter IKEA Systems to help me optimise our customers‚Äô shopping experience. I ensure safety guidelines are met within the Customer Relations area. I am able to support the front counter in E&R, Home Delivery and Merchandise & Pick Up area when required. Qualifications  You are a self-motivated, team player and desire to take on responsibility to do a good job.  Good communication skills, service-oriented, fluent in English and basic knowledge of PC skills.  Passion for retailing, positive attitude in work and able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.  You are energetic, friendly and pleasant with an out-going personality.  1 year working experience in the same capacity

As the world moves even more online due to the coronavirus pandemic, customers are connected and empowered like never before. Sprinklr is a Customer Experience Management (CXM) platform for modern enterprises with 3000+ employees helping the world‚Äôs most valuable enterprises make their customers happier. Learn more about our culture and how we make our employees happier through The Sprinklr Way .  We currently have a great opportunity for a Sales Development Representative to join our motivated and creative Inside Sales team. As a SDR, you'll be responsible for creating interest and developing conversations with contacts at enterprise corporations. Team members are passionate about the ongoing transformation of inside sales to something that is personal, value-filled, and representative of social disruption.  What You'll Do  You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking and sending personal, strategic, value-add emails, out bound calls and social messages (no copying and pasting)You will be able to quickly research a company, see opportunities, and strategise an approach to build interest You will profile potential prospects based on predetermined criteria. You will secure meetings for your Account Executives.  Who You Are And What Makes You Qualified Desire to be in a software sales (full cycle) position as a career progression Proficiency in Mandarin and/or Cantonese Have a verifiable track record of success and goal attainment in a sales-oriented role Have a passion for technology and disruptive technology Have a deep understanding of the role social media plays in business Have 1-2 years in an SDR/BDR role (Enterprise experience preferred) You have a run-through-a-brick-wall level of drive, passion, and desire for results Why you'll love Sprinklr: We‚Äôre committed to creating the kind of culture where you feel like you belong, are happier today than yesterday, and your contributions matter. At Sprinklr, our goal is to treat everyone like family and passionately, genuinely care. For full-time employees, we offer flexible paid time off and paid parental leave, medical plans, dental and vision plans, life insurance, 401(k) savings plans, employee stock options, gym and wellness discounts, Plum benefits, Lifemart discounts, and paid time off to invest in learning and career development.  We focus on our mission: We founded Sprinklr with one mission: to enable every organization on the planet to make their customers happier. Our vision is to be the world‚Äôs most loved enterprise software company, ever.  We believe in our product: Sprinklr was built from the ground up to enable a brand‚Äôs digital transformation. Its platform provides every customer-facing team with the ability to reach, engage and listen to customers around the world. At Sprinklr, we have many of the world's largest brands as our clients, and our employees have the opportunity to work closely alongside them.  We invest in our people: At Sprinklr, we believe every human has the potential to be amazing. We empower each Sprinklrite in the journey toward achieving their personal and professional best. For wellbeing, this includes daily meditation breaks, virtual fitness, and access to Headspace. We have continuous learning opportunities available with LinkedIn Learning and more.  EEO - Our philosophy: Our goal is to ensure every employee feels like they belong and are operating in a judgement-free zone regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, age, and lifestyle preference, among others. We value and celebrate diversity and fervently believe every employee matters and should be respected and heard. We believe we are stronger when we belong because collectively, we‚Äôre more innovative, creative, and successful.  Sprinklr is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. See also Sprinklr‚Äôs EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by filling out this form , and we will reach out to you. If you have additional questions, please contact accomodations@sprinklr.com.

description: Who We Are  Established in Melbourne in 2015, Airwallex is a global payments fintech transforming the way businesses move and manage money domestically and internationally. We have built a global financial infrastructure platform to help businesses transact, collect and pay across 130+ countries and 50+ currencies, without the constraints of the traditional global financial system.  Airwallex is Australia‚Äôs fastest growing fintech unicorn. We've grown to 13 global locations and have raised over $500 million in funding. Airwallex has been recognised in Forbes' Cloud 100 2020, and placed in the Top 50 of KPMG‚Äôs Global Fintech100 two years in a row. To support our ambitious growth plans, we‚Äôre looking for smart, collaborative and passionate people who are looking to make a genuine impact.  The Platform Account Manager role is a key sales role at Airwallex as we continue to rapidly grow in Asia Pacific. This role will work with our platform team on our most exciting clients through the API implementation, go-live and post-go-live phases. You will work cross functionally, engaging with many teams across the Airwallex family including sales, product, engineering, marketing, finance and strategy.  Furthermore, you are a technology-minded, Fintech enthusiast who is driven by learning the ins and outs of our platform so that you are equipped with the knowledge to solve complex problems. This will allow you to work with customers to understand their needs and how Airwallex can further add value to their business.  You Will Take a consultative approach with customers to ensure solutions provided suit their unique business needs Build relationships with internal stakeholder to manage and optimise a complex sales cycle Project manage complex customer projects across a number of technical and non-technical domains Be proactive in identifying and solving client challenges Achieve and exceed sales target volumes and revenues Report weekly and monthly performance against KPIs, metrics and targets Ensure the best customer experience and on-boarding process for new customers Skills And Experience You Will Bring You have experience - At least 5 years of experience managing complex technology sales to enterprise accounts (advantageous if this is in fintech) You are a relationship builder - you build meaningful, collaborative relationships with all people that you work with, both internally and externally You can speak to anyone ‚Äì you should have exceptional communication skills and be comfortable conversing with people of all backgrounds and domains You are a problem solver ‚Äì you look for creative solutions and understand new products and ask the right questions before figuring out a solution. You can easily simplify complexity for others You want to build something great ‚Äì you should be resilient, driven, creative, patient (and demanding!) adaptable and work well under pressure. You are success-oriented and hold yourself accountable for delivering key outcomes, including KPIs and revenue targets You are technically minded and have prior experience working in API sales or account management for a similar organisation At Airwallex you‚Äôll have the ability to make an impact in a rapidly growing, global fintech. We want you to share in our success, which is why you‚Äôll be offered a competitive salary plus valuable equity (in the form of stock options). We also like to ensure we create the best environment for our people by providing a collaborative open office space with a fully stocked kitchen. We organise regular team building events, encourage flexible/remote working and we give our people the freedom to be creative.  Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don‚Äôt regard colour, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

description: CloudGo is a consulting company that delivers digital workflows that matter. We are one of ServiceNow‚Äôs largest and fastest-growing Elite services partners in the APAC region, and due to our rapid growth, we need a great sales leader to join us as Account Manager.  This is a full-time role, based in Singapore but selling to Government and Commercial customers across South East Asia. A history of successfully selling services for SaaS platforms is essential, while a background in or understanding of ServiceNow will be an advantage, as that will be your responsibility here: working closely with ServiceNow to sell licenses and services to new and existing customers. Your role is the trusted advisor for customers to gain the most business value from the ServiceNow platform.  While you will have some initial accounts to manage in your territory, initially most of your work will be territory development: from territory sales strategy to prospect qualification, to overachieving budget. You will work closely with sales leadership and the presales team to introduce CloudGo to existing ServiceNow customers and building relationships with ServiceNow and other key partners. A key target in the first year will be net new logos, and over time the role will transition to more account management.  We deliver true enterprise value, so while you are probably most comfortable calling on IT, you will need to rapidly become comfortable calling on a range of senior stakeholders, especially finance, HR, and customer service. Skills selling services for ERP systems like SAP, or selling industry-specific solutions for Government and/or Commercial would therefore transfer well. You have a solution selling or customer-centric selling background, with excellent written and verbal communication and influence skills, history or exceeding sales targets, and a hunger to grow. You will be given direction on where you are going, not an exact map, and micro-directions on how to get there so you need to be comfortable with being a self-starter.  CloudGo hires for culture first ‚Äì our people are global go-getters, we look to the long term, we solve for the customer, and we value open, honest, early communication. We believe we don‚Äôt exist without exceptional people, so we respect and value them. We pay fair base and at-risk components based on experience and the market, with uncapped overachievement potential. You will be reporting to our group head of sales, so if you think this sounds like somewhere you want to grow, then come and talk to us.  Your Responsibilities Will Include To meet or exceed sales targets on a quarterly basis To meet or exceed individual KPIs based on outbound call volume, lead generation targets, and opportunity conversion targets. Actively promote CloudGo‚Äôs ServiceNow solutions products and services to prospects, customers, and partners via a range of channels. Follow up on leads generated from relationships, partnerships, trade shows, webinars, executive luncheons, website, email, or other sources. Build and develop customer relationships. Handle entire sales and inside sales process from lead generation to presentation to proposal to close, with support and coaching from your manager and the presales team Develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of products and services, industry trends, and competition Maintain current and accurate account and contact information, as well as lead and opportunity status and activity in our CRM Your Skills And Competencies Need To Include Minimum 4 years field sales or inside sales experience preferably in services for software or technology, focused on commercial and enterprise business A solid understanding of SaaS concepts and be comfortable discussing the business outcomes of technology with customers Demonstrate effectiveness through weekly reports to track performance and results Be able to operate successfully in a rapidly changing, ambiguous, and less defined environment. Outstanding time management and organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to be proactive and take the initiative to get things done Ability to manage multiple tasks at once (flexible and self-sufficient) Positive attitude, willing to learn, self-motivated and persistent

description: The world is changing at an accelerating rate. But we cannot take in the information fast enough, let alone make sense of it. We are fundamentally limited by the speed at which we read and write ‚Äî the speed of human thought. The challenges facing decision-makers today require a radically new technology.  Primer is at the forefront of the natural language processing revolution. Our artificial intelligence platform is capable of reading text at a rate of millions of documents per hour, extracting information and updating a knowledge graph of billions of entities. It is capable of answering natural language questions and generating the first draft of natural language analytical reports in seconds. Our mission is to empower our customers by vastly reducing the cost of curiosity. What once took days of research can happen instantly.  Our customers include some of the world's largest corporations, financial institutions, and government agencies in the world. You can learn more about Primer's technology and the problems we solve at our blog, as well as in recent media coverage of our work.  The Sales Engineer will engage with some of the largest organizations in the finance, retail, pharma, and government sectors. You will work to understand and assess customer requirements, prepare and present demonstrations of Primer's technology, and address and overcome technical obstacles that arise throughout the sales process.  You will partner with the sales team and engage with executives and leadership at potential customer organizations to understand their unique challenges and identify opportunities for Primer's suite of NLP/NLG technologies to support their needs. You will strategize on how to navigate complex sales cycles, bring your understanding of industry to value-based demonstrations, support and at times build Proof of Concepts, and win the company new business.  Your goal ‚Äì Build the rapport with the customer and secure the technical win.  The Organization: Sales & Pre-Sales  The Sales & Pre-Sales group in Primer's Go-to-Market Org serves as the interface between prospects, customers, and the company. Our charter is: (1) partner with Sales to win new business (2) scope and deploy Primer's suite of NLP/NLG solutions to our customers; (3) prototype new technologies and concepts to meet the needs of the customer; and (5) channel customer feedback and usage patterns back to Primer to drive future product development.  Responsibilities Present Primer's technology, products, and vision to technical and generalist audiences at prospective and existing client organizations Lead technical sales process for numerous customers day-to-day from initial meetings through post-sales (customer success, expansions, and renewals) Investigate and deeply understand the technical requirements of prospects and customers and scope solutions to deployment, data-related, or workflow obstacles Work hand-in-hand with sales executives to map customer requirements to current and future offerings and to close deals With minimal oversight, work with various stakeholders across the business to lead development of limited prototypes applying Primer's technology to customer data Continuously build expertise in NLP/NLG technologies and companies to understand potential competitors, partners, and vendors and how to position Primer in relation to them Marry deep customer expertise with your knowledge of Primer's suite of products to influence marketing, product design, enhancement, and deployments Partner with Customer Success Managers and Post Sales Engineers to ensure a seamless handoff at the end of successful sales cycle  Requirements 7+ years of SaaS/PaaS services experience with a minimum of 3-5 years within a pre-sales customer-facing environment. Definite plus if your pre-sales work was focused on the financial services sector High emotional intelligence and ability to think about solutions from a customer perspective Excellent communication skills to both technical and generalist audiences ‚Äì you will be the face of Primer to customers' organizations Track record for consistently exceeding goals and quota Broad range of experience in NLP and relational and non-relational databases Working knowledge of AWS and other cloud services Knowledge of distributed systems, ETL and ETL workflows Python skills Linux/Unix experience Bonus for hands-on experience with Kubernetes and Elasticsearch and/or experience in the financial services and pharma sectors  What We Offer A rapidly growing company, with plentiful opportunities to grow into leadership roles Healthcare with Dental 401K and Vision Benefits (US) Unlimited PTO (US) or 25 days Holiday (Non-US) Work from Home allowance Smart, passionate co-workers who want to deliver the best outcomes An honest and open environment for the exchange of ideas Fortune 50 companies and globally recognized institutions as customers Learning and teaching opportunities via individual book allowances, tech talks, and brown bag lunches Team virtual offsites like escape rooms and company happy hours  Primer is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.  If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at info@primer.com.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Us  Description  Our mission is to elevate leading brands through unforgettable digital connections with their customers. Sitecore delivers a composable digital experience platform that empowers the world‚Äôs smartest and largest brands to build lifelong relationships with their customers. A highly decorated industry leader, Sitecore is the leading company bringing together content, commerce, and data into one connected platform that delivers millions of digital experiences every day. Thousands of blue-chip companies including American Express, Porsche, Starbucks, L‚ÄôOr√©al, and Volvo Cars rely on Sitecore to provide more engaging, personalized experiences for their customers. Learn more at Sitecore.com.  Sitecore‚Äôs foundation is our diverse group of passionate, smart, innovative, and collaborative individuals located across four continents and over 25 countries. Having a wide range of perspectives, experiences, and skills is what makes us the company we are today. The Sitecore values are what drive and unite us across the globe.  About The Role/ The Opportunity  We are looking for a professional with an extensive experience selling e-Commerce, Web Content Management and Digital Marketing solutions. The individual needs to be independent, partner focused and able to take consultative approach in presenting the Sitecore Commerce solution to technical and business audience  What You‚Äôll Do Drive Commerce Sales and Booking Revenue in the Asia Pacific region Engage customers and partners for discussions for the fit of the Sitecore Commerce solution Partner with broader Sitecore account teams to progress and close Commerce business throughout the region (e.g. Demand Generation, Deal Progression, Customer Acquisition, etc.) Work with the Commerce Pre-sales Engineer to build demos/Proof-Of-Concept Help foster Sales Enablement to partners Work with Product Marketing to build up relevant Go To Market message to the customers/partners in Greater Asia What You Need to Succeed Deep experience selling ecommerce technology platforms and ecommerce services Ability to engage in discussions around revenue growth, ROI and TCO with commerce decision makers (usually C-Level or SVP/VP) Ability to provide guidance to marketing professionals (Director level or below) who are concerned with marketing/commerce optimization, tactics etc. Additional Skills That Could Set You Apart ‚ÄúSolution/Consultative‚Äù enterprise technology selling experience (Cloud/SaaS for both B2B and B2C preferred) Good knowledge of the eCommerce solution (Commerce Tools, Magento, Hybris, Demandware, Oracle, Websphere, etc.) Why You Should Click ‚ÄòApply‚Äô Sales and Customer Succes are the key to our success! We are tapping into an exciting $30B market opportunity that is still very much in its infancy and feel It‚Äôs never been a better time to join Sitecore as we look to grow by 30% YoY. Growth for us means growth for you and your career. Great team and company culture! You can find out more about our company culture in the Sales and Customer Success team and our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, on our YouTube Channel. description: Position Summary  The candidate will champion the NPD program management for Asia. The role requires comprehension and ownership of bringing products to market in a timely manner by effectively organizing commercial business cases into high-level strategies and day-to-day execution tactics together with corporate project managers.  The Program Manager will focus on risk and resource management within the region. The role is responsible to coordinate strategy and prioritization of incoming NPD requests with the relevant cross-functional leaders, commercial leadership, and bottlers. The Program manager needs to ensure a consistent and dependable flow of project deliveries against shared resources to ensure that the projects are prioritized in alignment with the need of Commercial leadership and ultimately delivered on time.  The Program Manager will collaborate with the corporate project managers and stakeholders to ensure proper execution of project scope, timeline development, and cross-functional team efforts to deliver NPD projects on time in full. The role will identify, strategize, and problem-solve issues and delays that may arise with the other project managers and stakeholders. The program manager will govern the stage-gate process to ensure alignment across the organization and help decision-making to move projects forward. The person will represent the department's efforts for all assigned projects and is responsible for all communication to commercial leadership. The program manager is responsible to elevates project information to commercial and supply chain leadership especially as issues arise.  The role must possess knowledge of change management to analyze the impact of new business requests on the current resources and activities. The program manager is also responsible for the day-to-day project management for China.  Project Management  Essential Job Functions: Communicate, develop timelines and project scope for China. Lead cross-functional technical and commercialization meetings with local and corporate stakeholders for relevant projects. Program Management Host and manage Stage/ Gate meetings with team members from cross-functional disciplines to ensure consistent reporting to Commercial and supply chain leadership across the region. Develop and support tools to help the program management process and stage-gate reporting. Communicate high-level progress and develop reports with local NPD leadership to provide proper communication to Sales development. Analyze cause and effect of NPD delays with local NPD, OPS leadership, and commercial groups. Troubleshoot issues that have stalled projects to prevent projects from stalling. Participate in internal NPD meetings with other program and resource managers to ensure proper process, and information sharing. Develop and maintain tools to ensure consistent information to NPD, OPS, and commercial leadership. Management of Asia resource allocation and phasing of project activities for NPD launch calendar by assigning projects according to resources available to Asia. Position Requirements BSc/ BA diploma in management or a relevant field: MBA is a plus. +5 years experience in project management, including 3 years in program management governing resources for a project team, preferably in the consumer goods industry. Native fluency in English and Mandarin Chinese. Proven track record of business sense to quickly gain an understanding of the Monster Energy company structure, stakeholders, intercompany processes. Experience in program and project management techniques/ tools. Strong communication and interpersonal skills for interaction with different levels of leadership within the organization. Sense of urgency, ability to multitask, attention to detail but also ability to see the bigger picture. Leadership and proven interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Ability to challenge and create change. Ability to perform under pressure. Ability to take ownership and responsibility for a team/process. Ability to develop and champion process, but also able to be flexible to reprioritize quickly in a very dynamic environment. Excellent presentation skills and communication. Self-starter that can question/challenge information being given, identify gaps and areas for improvements. Positive attitude to create enthusiasm with the greater NPD team.
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it‚Äôs like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let‚Äôs create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Key Responsibilities A focused strategic selling role, identifying and driving qualified opportunities from pre-sales to close of business contracts whether it is a master agreement or a single mobile line & equipment contract. Close businesses (whether new, win-back or renewal) that will add and maintain overall business and account top line revenue growth while managing and up-selling customers to avert revenue erosion. The role encompasses both growth through new acquisitions or win-back and by expanding customer expenditure with our existing businesses. Identify, lead and drive sales focused activities in scoping (prioritizing) and communicating the account opportunities, objectives, strategy and resource requirements (whether new, win-back or renewal businesses) with colleagues like Account managers and marketing managers to achieve a healthy revenue stream for Singtel from the business won or maintained. From alert and progress reports provided with customer statistics, the Sales specialist is to work with Account managers to identify and qualify to develop an account. He or She would need to lead and conduct regular account discussions with the account managers and account directors to ensure alignment in customer experience. The sales specialist upon qualifying an opportunity and communicate the strategies and approaches to the Account management team, may independently lead and drive the sales process from meeting the customer to scope, prepare sales proposals, conduct presentations, negotiate up to the closing of business with qualified customers. Resourceful in gathering the right resources (account managers, marketing managers, customer service managers and management team) to drive the sales activities to closure. During the sales process Sales Specialist will communicate the developments of accounts internally to stake holders and eventually ensure smooth account transition upon closure of contracts. Primary focus will be on Mobile (B2B and B2C), IoT Connectivity, Voice (IDD), Mobility apps, Videoconferencing apps and Mobility managed services. However, may be asked to drive sales in other services and products that management may wish to focus. Proactively monitor market changes and competition and feedback on important activities (e.g. technical developments, industry trends, new features and services etc.) to Sales and Marketing teams Requirements A degree or higher with at least 5 years of sales experience in telco/IT industries, with experience in opportunity and account leadership and a track record of successful sales in complex environments and solutions
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: About Currencycloud  Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.  We are an open & collaborative Fintech unicorn that lives and breathes our company values:  Be Human, Better Together and Own it.  About The Role...  Our Account Managers are paramount to driving the Currencycloud revenue engine strategy and are responsible for the development of strong commercial relationships. They own the commercial relationships throughout the customer lifecycle and drive sustainable revenue growth across a portfolio of clients to help meet and exceed revenue targets of our dynamic and scaling SaaS-focussed business.  YOU will be responsible for up-sell, cross-sell and renewal activity across a portfolio of clients; partnering up with Customer Success Managers to develop account strategies that enhance sentiment, protect against high-risk churn, co-designing success plans and developing strategies to increase product adoption and satisfaction.  The details... Expertly manage a sales pipeline of expansion opportunities to achieve and exceed the goals of the business Develop a deep understanding of the problems clients experience, the impact of these problems, and how our technology and new products can be a solution for them Build strong relationships with key senior client contacts Forecast revenue and opportunities accurately Skills Knowledge & Expertise Have at least five years‚Äô experience in a similar marketing role Understands different marketing disciplines, and the ability to deliver campaigns across the breadth of the marketing mix Might have used salesforce, pardot, wordpress, but not required Have the ability to build strong relationships and influence key stakeholders Can build strategy, but also roll-up sleeves and do the delivery Have excellent communication skills both written and verbal Work well in teams with the ability to manage own workload and tenacious attention to detail Are comfortable working in a start-up environment Understands the payment industry, tech background (SaaS/PaaS) preferred Why Currencycloud?  We are a remote-first company; whichever location you‚Äôre contracted to, we leave it up to you and your manager to agree on how often you come into the office. To make things easier we offer an allowance so you can create your own working space at home because we REALLY mean it when we say remote first.  Your health and well-being are of paramount importance to us, and so our jampacked employee benefits reflect this!  We offer a competitive salary, an individual learning and development budget, a pension or 401K contribution, mental health days and comprehensive health care that includes annual optical and dental allowances, access to mental health support and a monthly allowance that you can spend on anything health or wellness related!  At the moment we are unable to consider applicants living outside of our entities and we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.  We aren‚Äôt currently looking for additional Recruiter support on this role and won‚Äôt be accepting any unsolicited CVs
industries: Financial Services

description: Job Description Reporting to the company‚Äôs Managing Director Key interface between the company and key clients Responsible for development and performance of all sales activities in 3rd Party Logistics (3PL) market Creating sales pipeline and monitor monthly sales performance Directing sales team and provides leadership towards the achievement of maximum profitability and growth in line with company vision and values Participating in local and global logistics bids, creates and conducts proposal presentations and RFP/RFQ responses Participating in Monthly Business Review Meetings with key clients Requirements Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or above in Business Administration or Sales & Marketing Minimum 5 years of working experience within 3PL industry and of which, 3 years on a management capacity Possessing proven business development experience with people management and strong leadership experience Customer oriented mindset with good communication and interpersonal skills Proficient in Microsoft Office ‚Äì Word, Excel and PowerPoint

description: About The Company  Founded in 1984, my client is a global design, distribution and innovation company with a diverse portfolio of world class brands,specialising in a variety of lifestyle accessories. If you have an interest for a career with a renowned retail brand and seek to be a part of a growth focused company, apply now.  About The Job  As a Sales Support Officer, you will be expected to contribute to the efficient operation of the business by providing immaculate coordination and administrative support. This position will act as the single point of contact for order management for the sales team with various other departments within the organisation. Your job responsibilities would include processing purchase orders received into the SAP system, issuing order confirmation and following up closely until products are delivered and invoiced, providing customer support and resolving issues faced by customers by acting as a liaison between multiple departments. You will also be required to track and initiate escalations to the sales team on orders with a long lead time, and maintain an accurate account of orders in the system.  About The Manager/team  This position sits within the Distribution Markets Department and reports directly to the Manager of the department.  Skills And Experience Required  The incumbent should be tertiary educated and come with at least 2 years of relevant experience in the order fulfillment department. To succeed in this role, you must be organised and possess a high level of problem solving ability to identify and resolve arising issues in a timely and efficient manner. Additionally, great interpersonal and communication skills are essential to communicate with counterparts across different countries. The ideal candidate should be organised, self motivated and well versed with SAP (SD and MM Modules) and Excel (Vlookup/ pivot table).  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Carmen Tan at 6510 1333.  (EA: 94C3609/ R2196577)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

Respects other people ideas and aims to improve the team atmosphere on hand. No experience needed 18 and above

description: Management Associate The ideal candidate is a thinker, doer, passionate and aspires to become a value-adding investor. He/she will be responsible for contributions that will improve the Return on Investment for the portfolio of investees assigned . As the investees are SMEs who need much assistance , there is a delicate balance between facilitation and involvement .   Business savvy individuals who by nature enjoy analysing business problems , be resourceful and have the ability and perseverance to identify and work with the right external people or offer assistance indirectly until problems are solved. Team Players who are Achievers, perpetually hungry to learn, and acquire new abilities, helpful, creative, focused on results, and demonstrate courage to do difficult things right .   Roles and Responsibilities Manage Investees at ownership level yet assist as mentioned above . Active participation in EXCO and Board meetings, Identifying Corporate Challenges and Resources needed, helping to identify solutions to achieve effective outcomes, demand reporting and performance tracking systems, assisting in senior staff recruitment, helping to review and compensate personnel plus augment procedures and controls for operational efficiency and to safeguard investments Identify problems, solutions and parties that will yield results Improve Returns on Investments Externally or Indirectly instead of taking on Executive Functions in Investees Become an attractive non-executive resource in helping SMEs do well and grow Assist by way of Identifying, Introducing, Mediating and Facilitating in a very Wide Breadth of Business Aspects such as  Sales, Marketing and Distribution Product Design, Development and Management Innovative Deal Structuring Pricing and Packaging Business Modelling and Strategies Government Grants and Incentives Operation Controls & Efficiency Funding and Banking Requirements HR Recruitment, Training, Appraisal, Promotion, Compensation   Organisation and Management Structures Organic growth vs Mergers and Acquisitions Internal , External Audit , Risks and Controls Industry and Globalisation Trends and Opportunities. Ensure Investees implement Business Frameworks includes SOP, ISOs, Processes, Policies, Corporate Governance, Risk Management, Corporate Finance, Cash Flow Management, Financial Reporting, Project Management And Related Corporate Work Assist in Fund Raising Projects : Establishing appropriate capital requirements, structuring appropriate terms, sourcing of appropriate resources, ensuring appropriate documentation, organizing quality presentations to investors, negotiating, mediating and closing subscriptions. Be able to charge for assistance with much appreciation . Propose Management Succession, Business Continuity or Exit Strategy as appropriate Build a career in Value Investment Management Earned the trust of all around them by their transparent and honest ways. Become Junior Partner and aspire to be part of Future Senior Management Focus on China & Chinese speaking companies culture Challenge for Significant Growth and Leadership in Growth Areas   Requirements: 1 - 3 years Relevant Work Experience. Degrees from Reputable Universities in Science, Accountancy, Business Management, Engineering or Law. Strong References of Past Assignments which describe the Candidate as being an Achiever, with the courage to lead as an Organiser, an excellent Coordinator, Negotiator and Mediator yet able to Work Independently in Depth within a Wide range of Relationships. Candidates are encouraged to promote themselves with a one page narration of some achievements to date which reflects their ability, tenacity and perseverance to identify, work and solve problems in a team. It would demonstrate a high degree of initiative and passion to think, plan, develop, write, communicate, and present verbally, both individually and as a team. Required language(s): English, Mandarin (to liaise with Mandarin speaking associates)

description: About Us  Fairmart is an early-stage community commerce company with a mission to help local stores thrive in the digital age. It is our belief that local stores should have access to the same capabilities that larger businesses have, but built for their scale. To achieve this, we take a multidisciplinary approach to building solutions that are simple to use, yet powerful in their impact.  We're based in the JTC Launchpad - a heart of Singapore's startup community.  We are a diverse team of technologists and builders who love to see the direct impact of our work on the lives of our customers. Those who are successful at Fairmart are intensely curious and bring a fierce passion to their work. You should be results-oriented, but also be people-oriented and understand the broader context of each problem you solve. Our culture is our competitive advantage, and you will have a unique opportunity to nurture its evolution and growth.  Our founders bring a combined 25 years of experience from industry giants such as Shopback, Redmart, and DJI. The company is supported by prominent VCs such as Entrepreneur First, HAX, and SOSV.  What You'll Be Doing Representing Fairmart as the first point of contact for potential customers and partners. Daily levels of proactive outreach activity presenting opportunities to partner with Fairmart. Owning and maintaining a consistent pipeline, to exceed monthly sales targets. Drafting outreach templates and proposals to convert pipeline to sales. Maintaining records to provide transparency on all sales activities via the CRM. Passionately representing Fairmart and resolving customer objections. Negotiating partnership pricing to ensure business objectives are achieved. Skills You‚Äôll Need You‚Äôll be comfortable on the phone and walking into stores, talking to people and building rapport with them quickly. Comfort with high levels of activity and a fast-paced environment. Closing sales: getting buy in and agreement from potential customers. Experience and confidence pitching things you‚Äôre passionate about. Experience with technology and capturing your activity in a CRM You‚Äôll have an interest in all things retail and digital shopping. Fairmart is changing the game for a specialist by helping them compete with the larger marketplaces. Perseverance and grit ‚Äì you‚Äôre a hustler, and you‚Äôre not afraid of rejection. Top-notch people skills ‚Äì you have bags of emotional intelligence and can persuade even the toughest of prospects. Perks And Benefits Performance based incentive scheme. Open, respectful and fun company culture. Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution. Work with people who love what they do every day. Qualifications Diploma in Business, communication, or related field. At least 0 - 2 years of relevant work experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Mandarin. All additional languages are a plus. Ability to work independently, multi-task, organize and prioritize work. Check out our website: https://fairmart.app/

Secure Code Warrior is the secure coding company.  Secure Code Warrior makes secure coding a positive and engaging experience for developers as they increase their skills. We guide each coder along their own preferred learning pathway, so that security-skilled developers become the everyday superheroes of our connected world.  ‚Äç  We succeed through a human approach that uncovers the secure developer inside of every coder - helping development teams ship quality code faster, so they can focus on creating amazing, safe software for our world  As our newest Business Development Representative (BDR) you'll find yourself working within our Global Inside Sales team, in tandem with our global sales and marketing teams, where you'll use and expand your business development experience.  You'll be a critical part of our customer acquisition strategy for our newly expanded East Asia region, including China, Taipei, South Korea and Japan, ensuring the continued growth of our footprint in the market. You‚Äôll interface across all levels of a target/ prospect's organisation (CTO, CISO, Ops managers etc) to understand their business objectives and help them understand how Secure Code Warrior can help empower developers to build secure code from the start.  What will I do? In partnership with an Account Executive (AE), you'll develop lists of target prospects. Using your effective introductions and resilient nature you'll make contact with potential prospects; qualify those leads and set up meetings for the AEs for further follow-up. Make a great first impression with prospects by demonstrating strong knowledge in cyber / application / information security and the Secure Code Warrior value proposition, as well as a deep understanding of our competitors. Represent our brand and vision at conferences, events, industry meetups, and on social media, with a goal to develop interest in Secure Code Warrior. Take responsibility for pipeline growth and forecast accuracy in accordance with targets set by sales leadership. Take initiative in documentation of all activities and business development efforts within Salesforce, as well as leveraging historical information from our CRM to inform your actions. 2+ years minimum experience in B2B sales, ideally within cyber, info or app security businesses, or similar. Proficient in English and at least one East Asian language (e.g. Korean, Japanese, Mandarin etc). Other additional languages are a plus. A proven history of quota over-achievement. Experience using Salesforce and other sales tools. Experience prospecting and generating qualified sales opportunities through email, phone, social media and any other innovative method. Ability to handle a large volume of inbound leads. Ability to uncover customer needs and effectively communicate Secure Code Warrior‚Äôs value proposition. Why Work at Secure Code Warrior  You're joining us at an exciting stage in our journey, and are key to our future success. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to create impact, deliver on your ideas, and use your spark; experience and expertise to help us live long and prosper.  Warriors have full flexibility. We appreciate that you‚Äôll do your best work when you‚Äôre rested and energized. With our business operating globally, there‚Äôs no 9-5 grind at Secure Code Warrior. You‚Äôre encouraged to work the days, times and in the way that suits your best. We also offer generous leave and work from home options so you can make work work for you.  We‚Äôre a tight-knit team that values humility, diversity, giving back to the community and to each other. Giving back is key to being a Warrior, and we do what we can to make the world a little bit brighter as we work to make it more secure.  Diversity. Inclusion. They‚Äôre more than just words for us. They‚Äôre the hard-and-fast principles guiding how we build our teams, cultivate leaders and create a company where every single person feels safe and celebrated. We have a global, multicultural following‚Äîwe want to reflect that inside our walls and ensure people come as they are, we like it that way!  Sound like a good fit? Apply Now
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Marketing Operation Assistant  Smile Makers is the first sexual wellness brand focused on bringing the topic of female sexuality to the mainstream space and shaking up how we think and talk about this category. Since the inception of the brand in 2012, our friendly vibrators have made their way to the shelves of the most prestigious fashion, beauty, and department stores around the world, from North America to Europe and APAC. Covered in Vogue, Elle, Marie-Claire, Coveteur, and more, the brand has sparked a conversation on the importance of vulva owners‚Äô sexuality for their overall wellbeing. We‚Äôre looking for a dedicated, strategic, proactive, and service-oriented Marketing Operations Assistant to support the Sales and Marketing team in driving our marketing efforts, laying the foundation of marketing success, and enable scale.  The Marketing Operations Assistant‚Äôs key responsibility is the end-to-end optimization and governance of marketing processes at Ramblin‚Äô Brands.  This key team member ensures that technology and automation are integrated and deployed effectively, funnels are optimized, goals are defined clearly and kept in focus, data is tracked properly, reports are used and insights applied, budgets are respected, planning is actionable, marketing assets are up to date and shared and communication routines are smooth. Our ideal candidate will have a passion for driving processes and systems, project management, and analytics. The ideal candidate would strive in finding ways to support and optimize the marketing and sales process.  Our Marketing and Sales team has a variety and depth in our channel mixes and funnels, as well as significant opportunities for improvement. The Marketing Operations Assistant sees opportunities such as underutilized automation, siloed analytics, conflicts between sales and marketing, misunderstood customers, or leaky funnels. The Marketing Operations Assistant sees overarching opportunities in marketing infrastructure or a slow pace of execution.  Objectives of this Role  ‚óè     Act as the traffic light for the Sales and Marketing team. ‚óè     Oversee the tools, data, automation, and integrations. ‚óè     Maintain and fetches the data and supports the executives in building out reports. ‚óè     Ensure that processes keep running smoothly.  Key Areas of responsibility  ‚óè     Technology: Managing marketing automation systems to cover the whole marketing infrastructure. ‚óè     Data expertise is essential for acting on the insights that technology provides. It is equally essential for making sure the data is flowing properly in the marketing technology stack. ‚óè     Process is essential to moving the team forward to a common goal. Guides how technology and data are applied, and how they are then translated into team alignment. ‚óè     Alignment experience is applied to enable the whole team to use the data and technology. This can happen in the form of training internal stakeholders on the tools, decision-making support with data, planning, and establishing communication routines.  Daily and Weekly Responsibilities  ‚óè     Take inquiries and requests from customers and address their needs. ‚óè     Meet regularly with other members of the team to discuss progress and find new ways to improve business. ‚óè     Generate progress reports to give to clients and higher-ups within the organization ‚óè     Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives. ‚óè     Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders. ‚óè     Track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts). ‚óè     Prepare reports on account status. ‚óè     Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed. ‚óè     Managing, customer, pricing, product, and Sales Databases. ‚óè     Coordinate Internal Calendar of processes and Initiatives. Project Management. ‚óè     Set up and manage a CRM Funnel. ‚óè     Manage Marketing Assets databases such as images and reviews. ‚óè     Manage B2B sales sites. E.g. Faire and Bulletin.  Skills and Qualifications  ‚óè     Strong analytical skills. ‚óè     Ability to multitask and juggle several responsibilities simultaneously. ‚óè     Strong written and verbal communication skills. ‚óè     Must be able to influence and drive team members. ‚óè     Good attention to detail and organizational skills. ‚óè     Service-oriented ‚Äì ready to go the extra mile for their retail partners. ‚óè     Proactive ‚Äì doesn't wait to take action, is in charge. ‚óè     Preferred Qualifications. ‚óè     Familiar with account management software (CRM), such as Salesforce, Slack, click up. ‚óè     Experienced with Canva and PowerPoint. ‚óè     Advanced proficiency in excel, Data Query, data scrapping. ‚óè     Familiar with e-commerce software: WooCommerce, Sales funnels, Canva, HTML, or other programming language is a plus. ‚óè     Experience with Project Management tools.

description: Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currency and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide. Circle platforms and products provide a suite of internet-native financial services for payments, treasury infrastructure and capital formation. Circle is also a principal developer of USD Coin (USDC), which has become the fastest growing dollar digital currency in the world. USDC has grown to over 23 billion in circulation and supported over $640B in transactions in the past year. Circle‚Äôs payments and treasury infrastructure services available through the Circle Account and APIs helps bridge the legacy financial system and digital currency and blockchain based finance. Circle‚Äôs SeedInvest service brings internet-native fundraising and capital formation to startups and growth companies. Combined, Circle‚Äôs suite of services helps companies to participate in a more open, global and inclusive financial system.  What you‚Äôll be part of:  With the mission ‚ÄúTo raise global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value,‚Äù Circle was founded on the belief that the internet, blockchains and digital currency will rewire the global economic system, creating a fundamentally more open, inclusive, efficient and integrated world economy. We envision a global economy where people and businesses everywhere can more freely connect and transact with each other with new technologies for digital money and internet-native finance. We believe such a system can raise prosperity for people and companies everywhere. Our mission is powered by the values we espouse and which we expect all Circlers to respect. We are Multi-stakeholder, serving the needs of our customers, our shareholders, our employees and families, our local communities and our world. Furthermore, we are also Mindful, Driven by Excellence, and High Integrity.  What you‚Äôll be responsible for:  You‚Äôll be a part of a truly amazing team of people working directly with customers of all sizes around the world. You will help them to utilize the full potential of Circle whilst providing an outstanding customer experience with every interaction. Daily activities will include resolving general inquiries all the way through to troubleshooting complex technical issues within defined service levels and timescales. You‚Äôll work closely with peers and internal stakeholders on projects and initiatives designed to scale our 24/7 operation.  What you'll work on:  Engaging with customers to resolve issues that come through as support tickets to our team Crafting well written, tailored communications to help customers resolve their issues Partner with Customer Success, Sales, Product and Engineering to diagnose and solve problems Serve as a trusted advisor with an open, caring and approachable style of working Manage multiple competing priorities to achieve results for our every customers Proactively identify opportunities to develop solutions that help the team achieve our goals  You will aspire to our four core values:  Multi-stakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities. Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail. Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.  What you'll bring to Circle:  2+ years of prior experience working in a fast paced global support team Have a talent for writing and a skill for communicating complex problems clearly You care deeply about the customer experience and strive to refine your skills everyday You‚Äôre highly motivated and a caring person who has a passion for learning A core principle of yours is sharing knowledge and helping people do their very best work You enjoy the challenge of solving open-ended problems in a timely manner Fluent in English and Mandarin and/or Cantonese Familiarity with financial services or payments businesses preferred Experience providing Live Chat Support and/or Social Media Support preferred Proficiency in Google Suite and Slack preferred.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Our Team  Mighty Jaxx is a unique future culture company that creates quality products across multiple categories such as art collectibles and lifestyle items, bridging the physical & digital world by powering it with technology. Since our inception in 2012, we have produced over 1,000 designs in collaboration with world-renowned artists and global entertainment brands like Hasbro, Sesame Workshop, Toei Animation and Warner Bros, delivering 5 million units of tech enabled collectibles to collectors in over 60 countries in 2020 alone.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a diverse, inclusive work environment and encourage our employees to bring their true fun-loving and high-energy selves to the workplace. With big, vibrant dreams and a culture of high performance in our workplace, you will always be engaged, empowered and feel positively challenged.  At Mighty Jaxx, we always extend our full support to the team to help them reach their full potential personally and professionally. If you love keeping up with the latest trends across different sub-cultures, love technology and are ready to embrace your creativity, we love to have you join us in creating the most unique experiences, products and content for our collectors!  The Job  Reporting to the Chief Strategy Officer, you will be assisting the Business Development team in driving and managing key partnerships, collaborations and special projects through strong account management and development. In this business critical role, you will have tactical responsibilities identifying growth opportunities and playing a pivotal role in the successful management of the account. You will serve as the primary contact for assigned clients, partnerships and a liaison/communication channel between internal departments to ensure delivery of optimal service and client satisfaction. 5 years experience in an Account Management role, ideally from consumer products, IP, entertainment or tech-related industries Multi-tasker with good time management skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to engage senior management at a business and technical level Good networker with a track record of developing new and successful business relationships Effective planner with aptitude to identify business needs, challenges and opportunities Resilient and agile, quick to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment Strong understanding and appreciation for e-commerce, art and subcultures Team player with the ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines Autonomous and proactive attitude in problem-solving Highly motivated, self-starter with a passion for business development and project management

At NTT DATA SINGAPORE, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that puts our people and clients first. We welcome different ideas, backgrounds and passionate individuals to join us in our inclusive environment to achieve stronger and better results through teamwork, foresight, and innovation. description: Who is Maine Streets Securities?  Maine Streets Securities collateralized stock loans give investors another mechanism to realize near-immediate liquidity from the unrestricted, publicly-traded stocks that are in their portfolios. In a typical stock loan, the investor will borrow a sum of cash that is a percentage of the value of the collateral stock that the investor will pledge to secure the loan. Most stock lenders will lend from 20% to 70% of the value of the stock. The final loan-to-value that a lender will offer will be a function of the fundamental financial strength of the issuer of the stock and the average daily trading volume of that particular stock.  Most collateralized stock loans are for terms of between one and five years. The borrower pays simple interest during the loan term and repays the loan principal balance on the loan maturity date. Alternatively, the borrower can elect to retain the full principal balance, in which event the lender assumes full possession and ownership of the collateral stock and the transaction terminates with no further liability on the part of either party.  As with all transactions involving publicly-traded stock, a borrower should always consult his or her financial, legal, tax, and accounting advisors to understand the full implications of a stock loan and a potential default before engaging in a collateralized stock loan transaction. A stock loan lender will facilitate a transaction but will not make or provide any warranties or representations on how the transaction will affect the borrower‚Äôs financial profile.  The Role  You Will Be Responsible For Acting as the primary point of contact and delivering excellent service standards and advice to clients for their enquiries, complaints, and other service-related issues. Working closely with internal stakeholders to solve client issues. Performing root cause analysis of issues and non-compliance of service levels and work with various stakeholders to identify and implement opportunities for improvement. Developing account plans to enhance service delivery. Capturing and processing corporate action events in a timely and accurate manner in line with service standards. Resolving any discrepancies by liaising effectively with internal stakeholders and external parties. Ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. Contributing to improving existing processes by identifying opportunities and proposing solutions to improve to improve controls, efficiencies and/or client services. Ideal Profile You have at least 3 years experience including solid experience in a similar role within Financial Services. You have good interpersonal and communication skills and are adept at working with multiple stakeholders to drive desired outcomes. You are a strong networker & relationship builder You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments You are a strong team player who can manage multiple stakeholders You are willing to undertake 0-30% travel. What's on Offer? Work alongside & learn from best in class talent A role that offers a breadth of learning opportunities Attractive Salary & Benefits
industries: Financial Services

description: The role is primarily to conduct sales & market analysis, intelligence and forecasting to support senior management‚Äôs business strategy and decision making in the region for the Aerospace group. This would include and providing regular sales reports/forecasts for the APAC region and support the field sales teams with relevant information.  Key activities would include collecting, compiling and analyzing: market trends & data, competition and customer information, sales performance/analysis against the plan, in order to develop key growth drivers and strategic projects for the business. This includes integrating information from various data systems within the organisation, and generating regular reports for the APAC region and supporting the field sales teams with relevant information.  The position will also be responsible for organizing various tradeshows and events in the region, and ensuring that the marketing communications in region (news releases, social media, literature, merchandise, etc.) are aligned with the corporate branding guidelines.  Key Responsibilities Deliver weekly and monthly sales reports/forecasts for the APAC region. Work closely with sales team to analyze sales and business progress, and its alignment with the goals. Lead predictive and trend analysis to identify sales and growth opportunities within the region. Participate and lead part of the process for the Profit Plan and Strategic Plan and track the performance of both plans for the APAC region. Organize, consolidate and prepare presentation materials/reports for annual Profit Plan, Strategic Plan and various business review meetings. Accounts Receivables analysis and reporting, and support to the US/European finance team as an escalation contact for regional credit control. Collect market information from various sources and aid in the creation of the marketing vision required for the business strategy development and decision making in the region Conduct competitive analysis to support value- proposition and identify competitive advantages, in order to formulate marketing strategies and sales approaches to target customers and aircraft platforms to gain market share. Develop business cases used to support decisions regarding growth drivers through setup of footprint, joint ventures, or mergers & acquisitions. Work out detailed proposals for building up local capability (through partnership, acquisition, or JV), and implementing accordingly after the approval by the Aerospace senior leadership team. Plan and organize marketing campaigns, together with the sales team, including tradeshows, Techdays, technical seminars, media events, advertisements, etc., to promote organisation‚Äôs name, image, products and brand in the region, as well as assess the effectiveness of these events for continuous improvement. Interact with media, industry associations, and industry pundits, to increase the awareness and recognition of the company and products in the market. Update and translate marketing collaterals/sales material to be used in the region and manage the existing literature print review process. Job Requirements Bachelors Degree in Business Management or equivalent At least 5 years in similar capacity Prior experience in Aerospace industry is advantageous. Self-starter, able to proactively seek new information and data sources. Excellent analytical, financial and strategic thinking skills Highly proficient with Microsoft Business Software (e.g. Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) for analysis and reporting, and comfortable manipulating large amounts of data in Excel Experience with ERP and CRM systems Effective in a matrix management environment Good knowledge and understanding of the aerospace market and customer base in the APAC region Excellent communication skills ‚Äì both verbal and written, with ability to make necessary status reports and presentations to Management and customers Ability to think ‚ÄúOut of the Box‚Äù and to provide innovative solutions Demonstrated ability to influence the directions and attainment of objectives without having direct control over resources Prior experience in organising conferences and events is advantageous Other Information Industry: Aviation Salary: $8,000 - $10,000 Working Location: West Working days & hours: 5 days work week, Mon to Fri, 9am to 6pm

description: About The Company  Founded in 1984, my client is a global design, distribution and innovation company with a diverse portfolio of world class brands,specialising in a variety of lifestyle accessories. If you have an interest for a career with a renowned retail brand and seek to be a part of a growth focused company, apply now.  About The Job  As a Sales Support Officer, you will be expected to contribute to the efficient operation of the business by providing immaculate coordination and administrative support. This position will act as the single point of contact for order management for the sales team with various other departments within the organisation. Your job responsibilities would include processing purchase orders received into the SAP system, issuing order confirmation and following up closely until products are delivered and invoiced, providing customer support and resolving issues faced by customers by acting as a liaison between multiple departments. You will also be required to track and initiate escalations to the sales team on orders with a long lead time, and maintain an accurate account of orders in the system.  About The Manager/team  This position sits within the Distribution Markets Department and reports directly to the Manager of the department.  Skills And Experience Required  The incumbent should be tertiary educated and come with at least 2 years of relevant experience in the order fulfillment department. To succeed in this role, you must be organised and possess a high level of problem solving ability to identify and resolve arising issues in a timely and efficient manner. Additionally, great interpersonal and communication skills are essential to communicate with counterparts across different countries. The ideal candidate should be organised, self motivated and well versed with SAP (SD and MM Modules) and Excel (Vlookup/ pivot table).  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Carmen Tan at 6510 1333.  (EA: 94C3609/ R2196577)

description: Job Summary:  To assist the ANI sales team in the execution of marketing campaigns, generation of equipment leads and progressing the sales process through the demonstration of Olympus ANI products for OSP region. You will be responsible for supporting high end sales through demonstrating the capability of the equipment and ensuring that all the relevant technical issues have been addressed whilst answering the customer‚Äôs and sales specialist‚Äôs questions.  Duties & Responsibilities:  Respond to new and existing customer inquiries within a set/ designated time frame with an aim towards customer education as it relates to the strengths of our product offering for their application and budget requirements. Ensure that suitable information is obtained for effective use in demonstrations, ensuring that you are providing a solution to the customer requirements. Provide intermediate and advanced training and education to key internal and external personnel. Training will encompass quarterly Olympus staff training on basis of needs analysis, and also refers to customer training. Appropriate & accurate customer and internal training records will need to be maintained and stored in a secure location for future reference. Recommend and coordinate effective travel throughout allocated territory that efficiently covers current and potential customer/key account maintenance and development. Provide briefing on the purpose and objectives of planned travel and submit a concise report via email on objective outcomes within one week of trip completion when strategic information must be documented and circulated (not for relatively routine trips). Effective coordination of demo equipment usage between Sales Specialists‚Äô and your needs. Responsible for addressing all questions from Sales Specialists regarding ANI hardware and software. Response time to questions from Sales Specialist with answers or a course of action to obtain an answer will be 48 hours ‚Äì unless sickness or other unavoidable circumstances do not permit.  Additional Tasks & Responsibilities:                                                                                              Manage & coordinate any ANI new product launches, ensuring compliance to internal quality processes and procedures. Provide feedback to the factory to assist with development & execution of product lifecycle plans for ANI products.  Knowledge and Skills Requirements:  A Tertiary degree within an appropriate scientific discipline (e.g. Physics, Earth Sciences, Materials Science, Chemistry) and/or highly developed skills in the use of X-Ray Fluorescence [XRF] or X-Ray Diffraction [XRD] technologies will be highly regarded. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, especially the ability to present logical and cohesive arguments. Achievement oriented, tenacious and a determination to succeed. Ability to negotiate at all levels. Ability to work harmoniously in a team environment. A desire to deliver excellent service. Previous Product Management/Technical Applications or Technical Sales experience.  Credentials and Experience:  Preferably 2-3 years of application/technical experience. Fresh graduate is also welcome.  Special Requirements:  Able to travel at least 50% regionally.

Performance Selling methodologies Results-driven, analytically proficient, strategically minded with an operational outlook Excellent people management, leadership and coaching skills Strong record of developing and retaining high potential employees Experience in a fast-paced high-volume sales environment with tight deadlines in a dynamic working environment Excellent listening and problem-solving
