description: Job Description  Inventory Management Alerts and suggests optimization of stocks to Store Manager. Guarantees the application of all stock procedures are in accordance to Company guidelines. Ensure proper inventory replenishment are received, recorded scanned and reconciled in COMPASS system. Ensure 100% accuracy and compliance on the process. Ensure all inbound and outbound products from Corporate or International requests are manage in a timely manner. Report any defective products to Corporate and facilitate the return and get closure on the cases. Ensure assigned product category prices tagging process is completed in a timely manner. Maintain high level of inventory accuracy and complete any rebalancing stock request with Regional Merchandising team. Assist in all stock inventory cycles including High Value Count, Cycle Count, Repair Count, requested by Corporate and Random Inventory Count, Annual Count and Wardrobe Count requested by local Management are completed as scheduled. Manages all omni-channel orders for fulfillment and stock management. Liaises with other store and relevant departments (including E-Commerce) for any stock related issues. Price labeling and manages price changes Prepare weekly STN administration support between stores and office.  Store Operations Constantly review and improve operational flow and give recommendation to enhance, create tools to improve operational efficiency and productivity. Implements store policies, procedures and guidelines. Take co-lead on projects with Store Manager to ensure smooth and effective store operations. Involve in the preparation of valuation letter, request for diamond certification and Gem reports for customers and compliance with local and regional p rocess. Support store maintaince related activities including occasional night work. Support Merchandise on Loan for events by staff and management and Wardrobe Merchandise Ensure products are return on time and in good condition. Pull out Merchandise list and provide proper documentation and compliance. Support & Co-ordinate the changing of Merchandising Assortment including removal of E-Flag products Provide Logistics support for Customer Service Repairs to Hong Kong and New York. Provide Support to : Support TEI reporting including printing and updating scoreboard daily. Update CRM Gifting tracking sheet and provide gifting reconciliation report to Store Manager  Store Administration Administration - Responsible for back office and administration of the store. Order store supplies & maintenance needs (carriers, drinks, store facilities and etc). Finance & IT Provide information to Hong Kong Shared Services as requested including retrieval of documents (sales receipts/ shipping documents) for internal audit annually. Ensure necessary steps are taken to resolve Missing sales. Provide IT support and liaises with IT department to resolve all IT related issues in store. Promote Team Collaboration Be a strong team collaborator and team player with the various stakeholders. Be a Individual contributor role and set personal excellence in work standards. Minimum 4 years retail or luxury retail experience or supply chain/ logistics or relevant customer related experience (i.e. hospitality, etc.). Willingness to work non-traditional business hours including nights, weekends and holidays. Ability to work with a diverse working environment. Ability to do analysis and reporting work. Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment. Has work in Store environment and understand store operations and process will be an advantage. Based in the store.  Proficiency Microsoft Outlook/e-mail and in COMPASS systems (as applicable)
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Luxury Goods & Jewelry, and Retail

description: Secure Code Warrior is the secure coding company.  Secure Code Warrior makes secure coding a positive and engaging experience for developers as they increase their skills. We guide each coder along their own preferred learning pathway, so that security-skilled developers become the everyday superheroes of our connected world.  ‚Äç  We succeed through a human approach that uncovers the secure developer inside of every coder - helping development teams ship quality code faster, so they can focus on creating amazing, safe software for our world  As our newest Business Development Representative (BDR) you'll find yourself working within our Global Inside Sales team, in tandem with our global sales and marketing teams, where you'll use and expand your business development experience.  You'll be a critical part of our customer acquisition strategy for our newly expanded East Asia region, including China, Taipei, South Korea and Japan, ensuring the continued growth of our footprint in the market. You‚Äôll interface across all levels of a target/ prospect's organisation (CTO, CISO, Ops managers etc) to understand their business objectives and help them understand how Secure Code Warrior can help empower developers to build secure code from the start.  What will I do? In partnership with an Account Executive (AE), you'll develop lists of target prospects. Using your effective introductions and resilient nature you'll make contact with potential prospects; qualify those leads and set up meetings for the AEs for further follow-up. Make a great first impression with prospects by demonstrating strong knowledge in cyber / application / information security and the Secure Code Warrior value proposition, as well as a deep understanding of our competitors. Represent our brand and vision at conferences, events, industry meetups, and on social media, with a goal to develop interest in Secure Code Warrior. Take responsibility for pipeline growth and forecast accuracy in accordance with targets set by sales leadership. Take initiative in documentation of all activities and business development efforts within Salesforce, as well as leveraging historical information from our CRM to inform your actions. Why Work at Secure Code Warrior  You're joining us at an exciting stage in our journey, and are key to our future success. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to create impact, deliver on your ideas, and use your spark; experience and expertise to help us live long and prosper.  Warriors have full flexibility. We appreciate that you‚Äôll do your best work when you‚Äôre rested and energized. With our business operating globally, there‚Äôs no 9-5 grind at Secure Code Warrior. You‚Äôre encouraged to work the days, times and in the way that suits your best. We also offer generous leave and work from home options so you can make work work for you.  We‚Äôre a tight-knit team that values humility, diversity, giving back to the community and to each other. Giving back is key to being a Warrior, and we do what we can to make the world a little bit brighter as we work to make it more secure.  Diversity. Inclusion. They‚Äôre more than just words for us. They‚Äôre the hard-and-fast principles guiding how we build our teams, cultivate leaders and create a company where every single person feels safe and celebrated. We have a global, multicultural following‚Äîwe want to reflect that inside our walls and ensure people come as they are, we like it that way!  Sound like a good fit? Apply Now

description: JPMorgan's Futures & Options business is recognized as a dynamic market leader with a strong reputation in both the domestic and offshore markets. Providing the highest level of research, trading and clearing services to clients since 1979, the business offers fixed income, cash equity, foreign exchange and commodity related products. The Futures & Options team maximize JPMorgan's diverse product lines as well as international markets to deliver an exceptional service to our clients.  As we continue to strive to grow our successful Futures & Options franchise, there is a need for a highly driven individual to join the existing sales and execution team. This role will be responsible for order management and client execution as well as servicing and further broadening the firm's institutional client base.  Key Responsibilities Management and execution of client orders across all major markets and asset classes Manage existing client relationships and develop new ones with a view to leveraging our cross-product offering Prepare regular market analysis for clients and generate trade ideas relevant to client needs to maximize our relationships Prepare and present professional marketing material for senior management of our institutional client base Work with our internal global partners both in the sales and execution function and in clearing to further develop our voice and electronic business Qualifications/Experience Minimum Bachelor's degree in a relevant field Minimum of 1 years' financial markets experience, preferably in a front office role Experience with futures and options on futures would be highly regarded Strong competence on dealing platforms and market practices as determined by regulators Sound control processes and accuracy of execution J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

description: JOB PURPOSE  The Product Marketing Manager is responsible for the overall performance of a business unit with regards to sales, margin, inventory, quoting strategies, suppliers, and the ongoing development of the employees.   JOB DESCRIPTION  Set & achieve sales and margin budgets & objectives Perform all necessary research and analysis to establish achievable but yet aggressive sales and profit margin goals by class and by supplier.  Business unit quarterly business review Review entire business KPI (Key performance indicators) with business unit. Determine actions required to meet objectives. This is an all-encompassing review: sales, inventory, profit margin, in addition to performance to SLA (Service Level Agreement); supplier performance, customer performance, staff development, etc.  Supplier relationship management Build and maintain relationships with all suppliers at the appropriate levels. Supplier Champions are assigned for each supplier.  DPP pricing negotiation In conjunction with the Global Commodity Manager, negotiate preferential pricing for Future on stocking devices. For focus suppliers, the Director is responsible.  Product knowledge Understand the basic technologies for which you are responsible. Top end applications, basic electronic function the product does in a circuit. Understand the market trends of the end application as fluctuations can influence supply and demand.  Market knowledge Understand and communicate competitive landscape, product availability, pricing trends. Maintain close scrutiny on market conditions (lead-time and lead-time trends) to establish when inventory needs to be increased in anticipation of future market developments.  Margin enhancement Based on business unit strategy, review all CBO for assigned branches to identify potential issues and sales and profit margin opportunities.  Supplier quarterly business reviews Prepare and execute quarterly reviews and ensure that we deliver on our commitments to suppliers by creating realistic objectives and follow through on action items.  Business unit specific quote training During weekly meetings and as required based on escalations and changing market conditions.  Business unit communication meetings Plan and prepare meeting agenda for communication meetings. Present & discuss relevant information in a timely and effective manner. It should include topics such as Service Level Agreement, sales, profit margin, quoting, training, market conditions.  Business unit global communication meetings Conduct formal monthly business reviews with other regions.  Negotiate special returns Negotiate special returns with suppliers where we require additional flexibility outside of contractual rotation/scrap allowance. In addition, special returns need to be actioned by any individual who is able to use their relationship, developed with the supplier, to gain a favor.  Red alert & yellow alert flag maintenance Identify and maintain parts in inventory where sales and marketing needs to be alerted to tightened availability for appropriate business reasons (market conditions, manufacturing issues, etc).  Escalations Assist team in escalation from team members, from sales and suppliers.  Quote approval ‚Äì Branch generated Approval of quotes based on a dollar threshold set by business unit.  Customer visits to Corporate As appropriate, visit selected customers in the field, and participate in customer visits at corporate headquarters. Prepare and present appropriate information.  Performance improvement plans When required, and at times in conjunction with the HR department, implement corrective disciplinary actions. Provide feedback to employee to improve and develop on specific areas of weak performance.  Complete PMP and development plans Ensure employees have a training & development path.  Mentoring & coaching Ongoing, as managers of people can spend the majority of their day coaching others.   REQUIREMENTS A minimum of a Degree or equivalent Minimum 5 years in product marketing at Future Electronics or equivalent electronics industry experience within distribution, component manufacturers and/or EMS companies. Must be able travel when required Effective communication in English‚Äì additional languages an asset Proficient in using MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook) Results oriented Strong Leadership and People Management Skills ‚Äì mentoring, motivating others, monitoring and facilitation. Strong Decision-Making Skills Strong Communication Skills ‚Äì verbal and written Strategic rationale ‚Äì able to take concepts and apply them into tactics that can be executed upon Ability to work in a competitive, fast paced and multitasking environment Business Acumen Strong ability to negotiate and communicate ideas effectively

jobTitle: IKEA Tampines - Customer Relations Officer (Easy Buying)
description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand ‚Äì and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  ABOUT THE JOB  Reporting to the Manager & Team Leaders in Easy Buying Section of Customer Relations Department, you will be the liaison officer and work with the team to provide a positive customer-serviced experience for our customers. You will support the front counter in Easy Buying, Home Delivery, COF/EComm and Merchandise & Pick Up areas when required.  YOUR ASSIGNMENT  Your Tasks Will Include You handled and resolved customer enquiries and complaints, exchange and returns claims, refunds, IKEA Family Member Card issues, home delivery and other related customers enquiries. You handle enquiries from both walk in and phone in IKEA customers and provide service recovery of IKEA's external contractors. You will follow up on delivery when stocks arrived cases, no stocks cases and manage cash on delivery cases and payment has not been collected You will check accuracy of purchase orders and hand it over to customers or home delivery team in merchandise pick up section You will record information, handle paper works and compile statistics, general housekeeping and other duties related to the job You ensure that after-sales service is provided in positive and efficient manner. You work with the department to ensure the department goals and action plans and implemented and follow up. You record information accurately in the relevant systems so that the Department can use the resulting analysis to make Develops a strong knowledge of the delivery and assembly facilities and provide/promote to customer. Understanding the department policies and procedures, you will support the department in its functional review and sec check to ensure compliance and to provide customers a positive shopping experience Qualifications  YOUR PROFILE  Your Knowledge, Skills And Experience Include You have min 3 years of customer relations work experience in the hospitality sector. You are a strong team player who value togetherness, is committed to your role and possess a strong customer serviced focus mind-set. You have a warm personality with strong interpersonal and communication skills. You are able to remain calm and controlled and able to provide solutions when faced with customers in stressful situations. You are able to handle stress and work in an extremely face-paced environment You are skilled at multi-tasking and follow up and be able to deliver within the deadlines. You have basic knowledge of PC and enjoy hands on operations and physical role You are able to work AM/PM shift during store operating hours inclusive of both weekends and public holidays. Additional Information  Please apply by 09 August 2021
industries: Retail, Furniture, and Consumer Goods

description: Job Description  We are looking for a sales strategist who brings innovative thinking to help drive the growth of Moody's Analytics APAC and Middle East Sales organization. The growth of our Sales organization requires a sales strategist to support projects and programs that will significantly drive customer acquisition, customer expansion and increased market share. Working directly with the sales management team, you will partner with colleagues in Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Business Systems and Sales Operations to design and deliver new capabilities to our Sales organization.  Responsibilities Lead and develop customized analytics and reporting of sales performance to senior management. Be the central point to liaise with the various MA's Operating units. Conduct regular assessments of sales activities, formulate process changes and execute the implementation plan to drive sales strategy effectiveness, accelerate growth and enhance efficiency. Working with sales enablement team to evaluate sales enabling technology tools & services. Coordinate and implement customized onboarding program of new sales professionals and facilitate the integration of newly acquired firms into our Sales organization by collaborating with internal stakeholders. Assess, coordinate and implement relevant training programs (internal and external) to enhance sales performance . Lead the collaboration of sales generating activities such as lead generation, sales campaigns, events, awards programs with internal stakeholders. Analyze the performance of lead generation, sales campaigns and events performance based on quantitative results. Develop and execute solid and innovative sales strategies by keeping updated on the market developments and trends. Qualifications 2 to 5 years working in sales strategy and/or sales operations. Experience in firms selling risk and financial assessment solutions, understanding of the sales process, the customers' personas, customer's journey and evolving buying behaviours. Experience with and understanding of sales process and functions such as pipeline management, forecasting, and lead generation and qualification is required. Highly organized, with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Skilled at active listening. Able to independently translate general feedback or broad visions from the field into actionable, structured plans with measurable metrics. Strong teamwork and demonstrated leadership skills. Highly responsive and proactive in issue resolution and communication across numerous stakeholders. Highly self-motivated and results-driven. Able to manage projects, complete assignments, and resolve issues proactively without oversight or direction. Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills (including presentation skills); proven ability to build relationships at all levels and across different departments or teams. Demonstrates good judgment, strong critical and creative thinking skills in problem-solving and issue resolution. Highly analytical and detail oriented with proven advanced MS Excel and Powerpoint, Business Intelligence (e.g. Tableau), CRM (e.g. Salesforce.com) skills and ability to convert data-driven analyses into actionable recommendations Moody's is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.  Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody's Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: Due to Val-Technik‚Äôs plan to increase its presence and expand its business, we are looking for an aspiring and driven Sales Engineer.  You will be based in Singapore, and will be responsible for acquiring new customer accounts and grow existing customer accounts assigned to you. Your role‚Äôs main focus is to grow the sales of the company. In addition, you will perform secondary functions such as communicating the obtained market information internally, assisting the business development and marketing activities, and providing technical support to the customers. You are part of the Business Development and Sales Team and will report to the Managing Director and the General Manager.  Specific Key Responsibilities Assume full responsibility of the existing customer accounts assigned to you. Create and manage a list of key personnel from these existing customer accounts to ensure secured business continuity with them. Grow the existing customer accounts assigned to you. Find and develop new customer accounts in the targeted market assigned to you. Conduct market surveys and identify opportunities and trends in the market. Create and manage a project list. Prepare for and deliver compelling technical presentations to consultants and owners with our Engineering and Technical Team. Effectively communicate all information that you have obtained or created to the management. Contribute ideas and content to the marketing tools of the company (i.e not restricted to but include the company‚Äôs website, social media accounts, brochures, leaflets, datasheets and spec sheets). Manage the day-to-day customer enquiries, questions and issues. Attend any site meetings whenever required.  Requirements You have obtained an academic degree in mechanical or electrical engineering. You are highly interested in the commercial element of engineering while being technically adept. You want to be part of a progressive and expanding company that makes a difference to the market. You want to be part of a company with plans to expand in and beyond the region. You have the ambition to be part of a dynamic sales team, with a strong technical background. You are ambitious and want to have a progressive and exciting career. You are proactive and willing to learn. You are driven with enthusiasm to succeed in task(s). You are outgoing, energetic and resilient. You have good communication skills and ability to foster good personal relations. You are a good team player who is able to prioritise opportunities and think strategically. You are fluent in English; other languages are assets.

As part of our growing Inside Sales team, you‚Äôll own everything to do with generating new qualified leads into our sales pipeline: strategy, planning, and making it happen. You'll have input into and be expected to deploy a creative mix of inbound and outbound sales methodologies and tactics. You'll own specific activity targets and qualified lead gen goals; you'll explore and recommend new ways to drive sales qualified leads; you‚Äôll bring a high-energy, positive attitude to the office and challenge yourself, your team and your leadership to get better every day. This is an opportunity for someone who wants to be part of the ground floor of building a great company (and sales team culture) and will play a critical role in driving our success across the ASEAN / ANZ region. A leadership team that is first and foremost dedicated to your success, your career and working together as a team A innovative solution that was named a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for iPaaS for the 7th straight year A high energy culture where we are all focused on learning, earning and having fun together Work / life balance ‚Äì working remotely options Teamwork + innovation + fast-growing + fun = personal, professional and financial growth Ideal Skills You have regularly met & exceeded quota in a similar inbound/outbound sales role previously Strong motivation to grow in the area of Outbound prospecting Excellent verbal/phone and written communication skills Excellent organizational/follow up skills Ability to be assertive and persuasive without being aggressive Active listening & questioning skills Ability to lead & mentor younger reps in this role Ideal Experience 1-3 years of pipeline generation/business-related experience (preferably in the technology industry) 1-2 years in a team lead capacity and/or demonstrating leadership qualities and abilities Experience with Salesforce (or other relevant CRMs) Up-to-date with the latest technologies and best practices in inbound/outbound sales BS/BA degree in Marketing or other field with relevant work experience.

Minimum one year‚Äôs work experience in retail / sales leadership, or an equivalent role Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, marketing, retail or related field (preferred) Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) Detail oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills Ability to multi-task and coordinate ongoing projects, plans and people development Love of brainstorming, problem-solving, being creative and resourceful Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon, community, and people Passion, knowledge and involvement in yoga, and/or athletics Strong sense of personal style and athletically minded Excellent decision making and problem resolution skills Entrepreneurial, proactive and solution-oriented To Apply for this position  If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness, personal development, growth, change, responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.

Who is Unruly?  Unruly is one of the leading programmatic video ad platforms (SSP) in the world. Publishers use Unruly‚Äôs self-service tools, global relationships with premium demand partners, user-friendly ad formats and dedicated support team to maximize their revenue across a range of different screens, including CTV, mobile and desktop.  A pioneer in bringing emotional intelligence to the ad ecosystem, Unruly's innovative, multi-format tech, unique audience insights and creative solutions also enable brands and agencies to seamlessly engage global consumers in premium, brand-safe environments.  Where in the Unrulyverse will I be working?  Currently our teams are working remotely, however once it is safe to do so this role will be based in the Singapore office for some of the week.  What will I be doing? Develop a solid revenue stream from leading media agencies and direct clients and exceed quarterly revenue targets. Ensuring Unruly continues to be perceived as a true thought leader in the premium video marketplace. Presenting the Unruly value proposition, and getting under the skin of your clients and their opportunities and challenges. Deliver ongoing management and development of client relationships to ensure ongoing business including Managed Service and Programmatic bookings running in Singapore You will use Unruly‚Äôs full product suite to ensure that Unruly continues to be a key partner for all the clients in your allocated agency patch You‚Äôll be a source of knowledge and inspiration to agency partners ‚Äì pushing the boundaries of cross screen programmatic and managed service video, ensuring Unruly continues to be perceived as a true thought leader in this space Thinking strategically about opportunities for revenue growth, and will work with internal teams at Unruly to achieve these Work towards (and pushing to exceed) significant targets in both IO and Programmatic spend Communicate complex, creative solutions to agencies and clients who may be unfamiliar or uncomfortable with the space effectively in an accessible way Understanding of client challenges and able to explain how Unruly‚Äôs solutions can be advantageous and successful What will I bring? An established network of Singapore based media agency and client decision-makers A track record of prospecting for new business and converting this into revenue Demonstrated digital or video sales experience (minimum 3-5 years' experience) Understanding of and enthusiasm for the video space and the ability to inspire confidence and collaboration with your clients. Demonstrated ability to use and work within sales platforms, e.g., Salesforce, Tableau, etc High degree of technical understanding of the online video and programmatic video marketplace An understanding of the Programmatic landscape - including contacts at the major DSP‚Äôs and experience of selling an SSP. Ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment within tight deadlines Demonstrated experience generating leads and closing new business Presentation Skills; creating and presenting own sales pitches and presentations Experience generating revenue against personal and group targets (and love smashing them!) Solid knowledge of the ‚Äúcookieless‚Äù future and it‚Äôs impact to the digital landscape Here at Unruly, we like to think outside the box, so if you don‚Äôt tick every one of these- don‚Äôt worry! We would rather see your application than risk missing out on your potential. We also know our strength comes from our differences and varied life experiences, so we are committed to the value of diversity and inclusion in all its forms.

description: The Bettr Group is on the lookout for a motivated individual to join our dynamic business development team! We‚Äôre a specialty coffee company that provides a diverse range of offerings while remaining a purpose-driven organisation committed to changing lives through coffee.  As the landscape we operate in is constantly evolving, we‚Äôre looking for an individual with a can-do attitude, keen to take on new challenges and grow with the team.  The Business Development Junior Executive position is for a self-starter, with strong business acumen and customer oriented deposition. You enjoy new challenges, thrive in a fast paced environment and are passionate about reaching out, developing and bringing in new business.  Kickstart your career in Business Development Assist different team members to develop sales materials for potential clients and partners, including proposals, presentations and business contracts Collect data, interpret and analyse results to fulfill business needs, gain insights on business opportunities and processes Identify new trends and opportunities through market research and data analysis Identify and contact prospective clients and partners using variety of mediums, including but not limited to cold calls, emails, social media or meeting in person Participate in client meetings, presentations and actively follow up with clients Coordinate and work closely with other team members to ensure positive customer experience is provided to all clients and partners Assist with daily business administration tasks Assist with enquiries when required Technical Skills Good command of the English language, confident in written, phone and in-person communications Experience in creating professional proposals and presentations slides Basic design knowledge, able to use Canva, Google Workspace (google sheets, google slides) / Office Genuine interest in the coffee and/or retail industry, with any previous experience an advantage Experience with crafting reports and analysing data (optional) Soft Skills Able to work both independently and as part of a team and comfortable with taking direction from different team members Enjoy interacting and forming relationships with potential clients and partners and is customer-oriented Nimble, adaptable, comfortable in high-pace, dynamic startup environment and emboldened by challenges Ability to meet deadlines and produce quality work. This means you are willing to put in the effort/time required to get the job ‚Äúdone right‚Äù ‚Äì not ‚Äúdone right now.‚Äù Self-starter, creative problem-solver and have initiative to keep up to emerging market trends and opportunities Responsive to feedback and willing to learn Set of core values which aligns with Bettr‚Äôs social mission of using business as a force for good This job has everything for the right applicant, and is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially. Only successful candidates will be contacted.  About The Bettr Group  The Bettr Group is a home-grown specialty coffee company founded in 2011, and Singapore‚Äôs first certified B-Corporation. Currently comprising Bettr Barista and Bettr Coffee Company, they offer world-class professional coffee education, sustainably sourced coffee products and caffeine driven experiences.  The Bettr Group works to empower lives through a Holistic Training Programme for marginalised women and youth, by nurturing direct and sustainable trade across its supply chain, and by building socially conscious communities wherever they operate.  The 2017 President‚Äôs Challenge Social Enterprise of the Year was awarded to The Bettr Group, and they were also recognised as a Best For The World (Community) organisation from 2016-2019. More at bettr.group  BETTR@WORK  We're a diverse, mad flock of multi-hyphenates... all united behind our purpose of wanting to make the world a Bettr place through the work we do.  Some of us are a little geeky, some are a little OCD and some are all over the place all the time. But we have a lot of get-it-done gung ho and share a collective commitment to bringing the best of our individual super powers to work everyday to keep the Bettr world buzzing.  Bettr Group is an equal-opportunity, non-pigeonholey organisation and Singapore's first certified B Corporation . We have an open door hiring policy, where we offer employment opportunities regardless of educational attainment, work history, or past social barriers.  We're certainly not your average cup of Joe.

description: We are hiring new associates in Singapore! Located at the UIC Building in CBD, this exciting job allows you to immediately work in the world of hedge funds, private equity, consulting firms, and expert networks.  We're giving rolling start dates beginning from October 18, 2021.  Job Responsibilities  Associates connect our clients with the linguists and editors that help to power their multilingual due diligence and market research.   This is an 18-month role, where top performers will be invited to remain at Cadence on one of our five teams. In this fast-paced role, an Associate can expect to interact with up to 20 projects on any given day.  You will begin your tenure as a member of the trading desk. In that capacity, you are focused on project management and primarily communicate with language professionals. Day-to-day responsibilities will include:  Project management of large-scale translation/interpretation requests; Using Salesforce to review a pipeline of projects and determine task prioritization; Matchmaking client requests according to translator/interpreter/transcriber availability; Phone or in-person briefings with account managers for project management updates; Recruiting new translators/interpreters/transcribers as needed using LinkedIn and other communities; Chronicling your interactions in Salesforce.  Strong performers on the trading desk will be promoted to join the sales desk. In that capacity, you are focused on client communications and project scoping.  Responding to client service requests within 10 minutes; Providing feasibility statements regarding cost and timing to clients; Delivering any translations, transcriptions, or call summaries to clients within 20 minutes; Engaging with new and dormant clients with outbound prospecting;  Practically speaking, the two desks form a symbiotic relationship to enable client success, so strong teamwork and communication skills are a must.  Working Hours  The Associate role is demanding. It requires long hours, as well as an "always-on" mentality. Successful Associates will demonstrate resilience in the face of these demands.  We have structured working hours to balance our clients' needs with the goals for predictable work by our Associates.  Monday through Friday, you will have dedicated "desk time", where you are expected to be present and support the goals of your desk; One or two days a week, you will have three hours of protected "off-desk time", where colleagues cannot schedule meetings and you can ensure free time on your calendar for personal errands or side projects. "Aftermarket" coverage refers to passive monitoring of projects and email on weekends. Associates should expect to spend up to one of every four weekend days on this aftermarket coverage.  In Singapore, "desk time" is either 10am-7pm or 1pm-10pm (subject to change). Outside of these hours, Associates in other offices are working to delight clients. Therefore, successful Associates will demonstrate the "always on" mentality and recognize that they should be responsive to changes in business conditions. Sometimes this can merely mean checking Slack messages before and after your desk time. Other times it can be starting your day early or staying late to help colleagues.  Qualifications & Ideal Background  Qualifications You speak English fluently. Bonus points if you are also fluent in another language; You're not afraid of the long hours that come with rapid professional development at a small and growing company; You find passion and value in client service; You solve problems independently; You are able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment; You are easy to communicate with;  Ideal Background You are a recent college graduate or have 1-2 years work experience in a sales or customer service role; You have entrepreneurial experience either as the founder of a small company or as an early employee at a seed-stage venture; You studied finance as an undergraduate or have some exposure to the investment industry; You‚Äôve utilized CRM tools in the past, especially Salesforce; You have experience/familiarity with business in Mainland China.  KPIs, Reviews and Compensation The KPI for the role differs across the two desks. For Trading Desk, it is based on the number of jobs you advance through our pipeline. For the Sales Desk, it is based on the amount of engagement you conduct with your clients.  Compensation is SGD 4,500 per month.  Reviews are held quarterly and at the 12- and 18-month mark, you will be eligible for promotion to one of our five teams:  Account Management, to strengthen client relations. Demand Generation, to scale our company through business development, marketing and sales operations. People Management, to manage the learning, development, and overall lifecycle of our language professionals and employees. Platform Development, to build out the technologies and user experiences of our company. Product Development, to ensure we're offering the best levels of service to our clients.  Perks  Professional development: Annual allowance to fund professional development expenses (e.g., online classes, test prep). Direct access to clients and problem-solving in some of the world‚Äôs most important and fast-moving industries, such as hedge funds and consulting firms; Daily experience with important industry software such as Salesforce and HubSpot, with ability to receive official certifications; Ongoing training on the finance and due diligence industries.  Business travel: Periodic ‚Äòculture carrier‚Äô trips to our Beijing and LA offices for full-time employees.  Work/life balance: Company outings  Want to learn more about us?  Check us out on Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/3uOQ7sd

description: Circular sits at an exciting intersection of fintech, e-commerce and the Circular Economy. We‚Äôre on a mission to enable a future where physical products‚Äô useful lives are maximised by efficiently cycling them between loving users and careful refurbishment - until they are ready to be recycled. Our customers get affordable and convenient access to the best products in any category, and the environment sees less waste and carbon emissions.  Backed by renowned venture investors, angels and entrepreneurs across the e-commerce and fintech sectors in South East Asia, we're building a diverse team who are passionate about generating social impact, are motivated by the opportunity to deliver new experiences, change consumer behaviours and establish new industry norms, and who thrive in the uncertainty and speed of a startup environment.  Mission  We‚Äôre looking for a high-energy and goal-driven individual to oversee Circular‚Äôs SME client accounts and generate sales opportunities. You will generate sales volume by developing credible long-term relationships with our customers. You will nurture accounts, cross sell solutions and develop business relationships and opportunities for new client acquisitions.  In A Nutshell Maintain and develop existing accounts through appropriate propositions and sales methods Proactive identification of new users and business opportunities for accelerated product penetration Work closely with internal stakeholders to develop comprehensive solutions to address business opportunities and coordinate client deliverables Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships Prepare reports on account status Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts) Respond to and follow up sales enquiries Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing or related field 1-2 years experience within an account management role Ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) Strong analytical skills Excellent interpersonal and communications skills Self-motivated and able to work under pressure Cultural Competencies Be a positive team player Engage constructively, disagree and commit Exercise Good Judgement Take charge of your professional growth Learning Opportunities Master skills in analysing the account information and developing plans that improve profitability and align with client‚Äôs goals Hone skills in creating a long-term customer success plan Learn and apply the best practices to propel client success Other Benefits Unlimited Paid Time Off Private Medical Healthcare, Dental and Outpatient Care (SG positions only) $400 per month expense budget WFH and Remote Work flexibility WeWork work location

And we want to help realize their goals. Working with us, you embody one of our most important selling points: personal support of our customers. description: About THG THG is one of the world‚Äôs fastest growing and largest online retailers. We have over a decade of experience building and growing brands in the Beauty and Wellness sectors, in over 160 markets. We create brilliant digital brand experiences and our in-house team design, develop and build a bespoke proprietary technology platform that is used by hundreds of millions of people worldwide. With a world-class business, a proprietary technology platform, and disruptive business model, our ambition is to be the global digital leader. Our culture is fast-paced and ambitious ‚Äì we like to move twice as fast others believe to be possible. This belief is a fundamental part of the DNA that has supported our incredible growth. Our people are our strength and we have over 4,000 diverse, smart thinkers across the globe who are encouraged to think creatively and empowered to turn their ideas into actions. To support our ambitious growth, we are looking for commercially astute, ambitious individuals that can bring fresh and innovative thinking to THG and play a part in driving the Group forward on its truly exciting journey.  About Beauty Our Beauty division is Europe‚Äôs No1 Online Destination for Premium Beauty. Our mission is to empower people globally to look and feel fantastic every day. To enable us to do this we have offices across the UK, Europe, America, Australia and Singapore filled with passionate beauty fanatics who are committed to delivering rapid growth in this exciting industry. We work with over 800 of the world‚Äôs greatest beauty brands such as MAC, Kerastase, GHD, Tom Ford and YSL to bring our customers the widest offering of beauty products from around the globe. Passion, innovation and commitment are key characteristics in this ever expanding team as we strive to become the Worlds No1 Online  About the Lookfantstic and Your Role Lookfantastic is Europe‚Äôs No1 Online Destination for Premium Beauty. Our mission is to empower people globally to look and feel fantastic every day. To enable us to do this we have offices across the UK, Europe, America and Australia filled with passionate beauty fanatics who are committed to delivering rapid growth in this exciting industry. We work with over 800 of the world‚Äôs greatest beauty brands to bring our customers the widest offering of beauty products from around the globe. Passion, innovation and commitment are key characteristics in this ever expanding team as we strive to become the Worlds No1 Online. An exciting opportunity has become available here at Lookfantastic as we are looking for an Ecommerce Manager to join our growing team. The Ecommerce Manager plays a key role in our success, responsible for the delivery of the P&L performance for their territory and driving the growth strategy across SEA. The ideal candidate will come from a similar online trading role, or core merchandising background.  Responsibilities (clearly linked to KPIs): Strategy Development: Keeps up to date with industry/market trends and networking opportunities in Japan. Identification and execution of best in class marketing activations and new marketing channels to drive new customers in an efficient manner whilst improving the retention and value of our existing customers. Promoting and embodying the brand identity and ensuring trading decisions align to this identity. Ensuring all key trading moments are well planned and executed with a 360 market activation plan, clearly phased targets by day, site, channel and brand that have been collaboratively produced with brand and merchandising functions and a clear awareness of any activity from last year has been considered. Driving continuous site improvements to maximise conversion and AOV and reduce bounce rate on site and reduce barriers to buying online Deliver best in class customer experience partnering closely with brand and editorial teams to brief and build engaging product pages that provide the customer with relevant information, advice and conversion opportunity. Support wider project to tech to create an immersive exposure onsite that support both education, brand identity and conversion. Cross Team Collaboration: Collaborating with Brand and Marketing teams to plan and ensure execution of overall brand and NPD strategies. Driving the Ecom Team to proactively plan ahead with trading and offer activations giving full visibility of these activations to all other teams in the division. Collaborates with THG Retail team to review key brand activations and launches, plotting in marketing exposure to maximise each of these and build a strong JBP and brand budget from. Collaborates with Merch function to ensure budgets are reflective of stock position prior to each month and actively reviewing stock position throughout the month ensuring these considerations are taken into account before any incremental activity is pushed out. Delivery of the site campaign plan for the year collaborating with each marketing channel and brand to ensure a consistent campaign plan catered to each channel. Working closely with Brand team to actively drive forward planning of campaign schedule for the following year. Reporting Regular reporting of brand performance from topline through to site, marketing channel, territory and sku/range specific performance and actively driving improvements in any underperforming areas. Setting KPIs targets and monitoring KPI performance across the site, included in reporting (including reporting owned by direct reports). Active collaboration with the data team to drive process improvements and identify new reporting that can drive growth Using analytics and our in-house reporting platform to gain a strong understanding of the customer journey to optimise sales, measure performance & define strategy Share insights on customer behaviour and trends across beauty functions to drive best practice behaviour and learnings Team Development Builds and motivates an effective and competent team beneath them Gives clear guidance to team members ensuring quarterly objectives are set, monitored and continuous feedback is given to team to aid their development Develops skills of the team - identifies individual training needs as well as encourages effective teamwork, KPI setting and communicating clear goals/targets. Motivates team - gives recognition and praise, implementing incentives to drive performance within the team. Provides support to new team members - ensures a full induction is provided and support during the learning process Responsibility for driving sustainable growth in site performance and marketing activations Sales and GP growth targets Improvement in AOF KPI target accuracy and performance vs target New & Returning Customer rates  Role Requirements Experience in a similar role is essential, ideally working for an ecommerce brand / retailer in beauty or fast-fashion Highly organised, able to prioritise to hit key deadlines in an agile environment Pro-active and positive attitude Driven and goal orientated Working collaboratively across teams Strong commercial ability with knowledge of P&L management People management: Inspire and motivate a team to deliver a shared goal Prioritise, structure work & effectively manage time Excellent communicator - able to give clarity and set direction Awareness of the beauty industry Ability to form good working relationships with internal teams and external clients Critical thinker and problem-solving skills Project management skills Negotiation skills Proficient in Japanese language to communicate with partners & clietns Initiative - able to think outside of the box

description: Hi there, we‚Äôre ContactOut.  We have a database with everyone‚Äôs email in it. So B2B professionals use ContactOut to get conversations going with key people.  Since our launch in 2015, ContactOut has acquired more than 500k activated users. Our customers are primarily in the US, and include Amazon, Facebook, McKinsey, Netflix, and Nike. We‚Äôre currently a 30-person team on track to hit our goal of $5M earnings this year (1.5x growth from 2020.)  To support this high growth, we are hiring Growth Product Managers to work with our team of designers, engineers, and product and marketing teams. ContactOut growth PMs are responsible for building great experiences that delight our users while achieving our business growth goals.  Our ultimate vision is to fix cold outreach for the world ‚Äî transform it from a ‚Äúnecessary evil‚Äù into a good experience for both the sender and receiver.  We have ideas on how to continue our growth trajectory including various new products. The successful growth PM applicant will help shape our roadmap and user journey through ideation to rapid prototyping and data driven decision making.  To know more about our vision and philosophy, read the ContactOut Growth Plan: https://bitly.com/contactout-growth-plan  Because our leadership team is in Australia and head of product is in Singapore, this role is open to applicants based in Singapore, Australia, or elsewhere in GMT+8 to GMT+12 time zones.  Growth PM Responsibilities  As a ContactOut growth PM, you will drive the following outcomes:  Build the mechanisms that attract large, relevant audiences for our data intelligence products Run growth audits and conduct data analysis across all stages of the funnel to design the highest impact strategies that will increase user conversion and retention Design and run experiments to optimize UX for our 40k DAU based on user research and data insights to fulfill business objectives Implement analytics, tracking, and dashboards to make growth data accessible, meaningful, and actionable across the entire team  Potential Activities to Meet These Goals  You will work directly with the heads of growth, product, design, and engineering to identify and complete the highest ROI activities from the following:  Growth strategy/execution: discover, plan and execute a wide range of user acquisition strategies such as SEO, push marketing (email nudges, in-app notifications), paid search and paid social Conversion rate optimization (CRO): use behavioral science to drive conversion at the leakiest parts of the funnel and create habit-forming user behavior, increasing retention and customer lifetime value Product strategy, design, and UX: identify features with the best potential to achieve business objectives, then scope, prioritize, and validate them via lean experimentation; going Zero to One, owning projects end-to-end from ideation to experimentation to release and QA Data: use customer insights and statistical and cohort analysis to understand problems in the user journey and identify, validate, and prioritize which areas of drop-off to improve first Research: identify the best approach to learn what user pains and gains to work on first through session recording analysis, field research, user interviews, and user testing Execution: work with our teams to drive improvements through copywriting, wireframing, development briefs, campaign design, implementation, optimization, and weekly reports to share all your new learnings  Desired Experience and Abilities  1‚Äì3+ years experience working for a startup, scale-up, or lean operating organization; ideally working effectively cross-functionally with product, marketing, design, and engineering teams Ability to see the big picture and align activities to the highest priority business outcomes Ability to align with stakeholders, projects, and team according to first principles; to take and give constructive feedback and create value Clear and concise communicator who values producing and presenting information from a place of authenticity and fact without ego Ability to manage yourself and your time, working efficiently and effectively without the need for pressure from above Demonstrated innovation, running your own projects and clubs or building your own products or businesses Bonus for creative design or writing skills, and technical abilities such as SQL or Excel, data management, and coding / web development  Team  Rob Liu, founder & CEO. Blackbird and Hustle Fund VC investor. Two multimillion dollar SaaS companies under his belt. Joseph Louis Tan, head of product. Lecturer at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. Former VP and Employee Journey Design Coach for DBS Bank. Mentor at 500 Startups. Jeff Deutsch, head of growth. Founder of $1M ARR SEO SaaS startup (story of rise and fall here.) Startmate investor and mentor. Former head of growth for $4bn EdTech unicorn VIPKid. (You‚Äôll report to Jeff, who reports to the CEO.) Albert Jou, head of engineering. Former senior engineer at REA, Australia‚Äôs largest real estate website. Former CTO at Vent, social network with 3M visitors/mo. Doug Hall, head of sales. Early VP of sales at Glassdoor, Entelo, Beamery, and Comparably.  Compensation  $5‚Äì9k/mo SGD dependent on experience. Equity available. Budget for an office setup in WeWork or similar co-working space. Unlimited budget for self-learning through books, courses, mentorship, and similar.  Hiring Process  The process takes about 4 weeks total:  Conversion with our head of talent acquisition. The goal is to understand your motivation and goals to see if there‚Äôs a good fit. Take-home challenge. You get a glimpse of what it would be like to join ContactOut by working on a real-life problem and showing off your skills. Meet the team. You get to have a chat with the folks behind the scenes to simulate an actual working environment. Offer. Let‚Äôs build wonderful things together.  Eligibility  ContactOut promotes and values diversity. We are happy to consider candidates of any gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, nationality, physical / mental ability, or educational background. We welcome diverse people with diverse perspectives.

Company Profile Brand You Right is a start-up advertising/marketing agency, providing social media marketing solutions. We're a lean team looking to expand aggressively in the upcoming months.  The Role We are looking for an experienced Social Media Marketing Specialist to contribute to the development and growth of the Account Management Team.   A strong passion and understanding of the advertising/marketing landscape is a must. This person is required to handle multiple clients and oversee the development of projects within the company.  The ideal candidate will help drive revenue growth by building a strong pipeline of sales leads and helping create the market strategy. You will be responsible for establishing a strong relationship with new prospects as well as maintaining a strong relationship with existing accounts. Effective communication and interpersonal skills will help you succeed as a Social Media Marketing Specialist.   Responsibilities Social media account management for clients - planning, scheduling, posting of organic and paid content/ad campaigns. Build and maintain a long-lasting relationship with the clients. Liaise with clients to understand their social media advertising requirements.  Effective management of client expectations; support your team to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of all aspects of campaign management, identifying improvements to ways of working where required. Gathering analytical research data using social listening tools. Present to client campaign ideas, budget information, and written post-campaign reports.  Strategise innovative ways to reach/close new clients.  Qualifications Min. 2-3 years' of relevant experience, agency experience is a plus Knowledgeable about social media organic and performance marketing Highly organized and able to multi-task, good with time-management Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Experience in managing senior client relationships Ability to work under pressure and assimilate large quantities of information quickly while maintaining attention to details  Interested applications please send your resume to hiring[at]brandyouright.com

description: About Aspire  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.  In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don‚Äôt take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  About The Role  As the Sales Marketing Coordinator, you will be the bridge between Aspire‚Äôs marketing and sales teams and be responsible for deeply understanding the needs of our high value clients, and translating that into marketing material and campaigns to drive growth. This is an opportunity for a growth-minded, B2B communication marketer to drive growth in one of the fastest growing B2B fintechs in the region.  What will you be doing? Developing, driving and implementing an outstanding B2B marketing strategy focused on high-value clients Talking to our sales teams to understand the needs of our high-value client segment, and using those insights to craft marketing initiatives with the goal of acquiring these startups Working closely with cross functional teams (brand & campaign marketing, sales, and operation teams) We would love to get to know you if you have the following: A minimum of 3 years of experience in marketing or communications Experience in fintech or B2B startup would be an advantage Self-starter, ability to work and thrive within a fast-paced, culturally diverse and evolving environment Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English A Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree preferably in Business, Marketing, or Communications related
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: About us Moovaz is the global movement of people and technology, dedicated to make international relocation a freeing and exhilarating experience. Our one-stop relocation e-platform and innovative solutions enable our hosts and vendors‚Äô partners to liberate the consumers to move without fear and move with hope and anticipation of what‚Äôs to come. Moovaz was founded in 2017 with a presence in Singapore, Hong Kong, and Australia. Since our launch, we have become the fastest-growing relocation platform in the region, helping over 12,000 families relocate globally across 200 cities. We have global ambitions and are up against international incumbents in a rapidly emerging field! With our emphasis on innovation and automation, we have devised revolutionary products to make international relocation easier, smarter and stress-free. We are scaling fast and expanding into the US, UK, EU and India markets and are looking for passionate talent to be part of this exciting journey. If you want to learn, grow and deliver, if you are results-oriented, love teamwork, appreciate open communication, learning and iteration, and making decisions with data, come and join our tribe and be part of our growing Moovaz team!  Position We are looking for a resourceful Account Management Associate to join the team! As an Account Management Associate, you will act as a key point of contact between Moovaz and our partners. This role will require you to possess thorough product knowledge and oversee product and/or service sales to drive acquisition and growth in key accounts. Developing strong relationships with our key partners is one of the key areas, which may include mitigating escalations that may come through Customer Support. You will need to be comfortable and resourceful working with various technological tools due to the heavy emphasis on technological processes and data workflows. This role will also involve you having to constantly improve workflow processes and service quality standards together from various service verticals. You will be working hand in hand with the Tech Development team as well as the Customer Support team to improve the management of each service vertical.  Responsibilities Manage a portfolio of key accounts and drive the growth of the accounts as measured by transactions and GMV Identify bottlenecks and potential issues related to partners‚Äô operations and deliver solutions to these issues Evaluate strategic and partnership opportunities by performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses Analyze data and develop initiatives to increase revenues for your portfolio Understand and optimise account workflow processes including partners and clients data transfer, service standards, key timeline milestones, vendor improvement Drive operational excellence by working with the partners and their operational teams Help partners optimise and grow their business with Moovaz‚Äôs tech tools and processes Resolves partners‚Äô issues or complaints actively by investigating the problem, developing the solution, making recommendations to management Work closely with the team across functions from commercial, marketing, operations and product to execute acquisition strategies and initiatives.  Requirements Excellent written and spoken English Proficient in online tools such as CRM system such as Hubspot, Microsoft Office, Google Suite and Airtable Resourceful with technological tools to find solutions to the problem Self-directed, able to take initiative to pre-empt vendor needs and help them grow Have a technology led mindset in your daily operations Thrive in working in a small team with high ambitions to learn and grow Time- oriented, good self-management skills with ability to hit goals within set deadlines. Attention to details, able to understand processes and adapt to tracking own work systematically and accurately.  To apply for this position, please submit your application via this link: https://moovaz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=35&source=aWQ9Mjc%3D
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: About ClassIn ClassIn is an EdTech SaaS unicorn aiming to create the OMO (online-merge-offline) classroom of next generation and bring education equality to the public. ClassIn was founded in 2014 with the mission of driving education sector forward with technology. The company empowers traditional education institutions by providing a comprehensive operating infrastructure they need to facilitate teaching and manage organization online and offline. Ever since its inception, ClassIn has successfully served over 60,000 institution clients in more than 40 countries. It has hosted 200,000,000 hours of e-learning activities to ensure the delivery and continuity of high-quality education to over 20,000,000 users   Key Responsibilities 1.      Develop and execute long term sales strategy with schools, universities and other academic institutions. 2.      Forge relationships with administrators and faculty. 3.      Drive new sales through prospecting and managing new leads. 4.      Maintain relationships with existing customers. 5.      Work with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships across departments. You have: 1.      A passion about education, language, travel and culture experience. 2.      Bachelor degree or above. 3.      International study or working experience preferred. 4.      Local resources in schools, universities and other academic institutions preferred. 5.      Minimum 1 years‚Äô marketing / BD / channel development / sales experience. 6.      Track record of leading cross-functional teams to implement initiatives with tangible business impact. 7.      Excellent communication, problem solving and interpersonal skills. 8.      Strong business acumen and commercial instincts. 9.      Fluent in spoken English.

description: Job Description Fully embodying the Challenger Spirit, we are always looking for ways to improve the lives of our customers daily. If you are passionate about challenging the norm, and not satisfied with status quo, StarHub is the place for you!    Do you enjoy engaging and providing the best service to our customers while at the same time achieving your sales target? As a Customer Relationship Consultant, you will be able to reach out to our customers, understand their needs and recommend appropriate plans and services while achieving individual and team target!    What can a successful candidate look forward to?    Executing and supporting marketing-led campaigns in the acquisition and retention of StarHub customers Managing telesales in-house and outsource partners Procurement of new telesales outsource partner on need to basis Providing all backroom support for online store E2E orders and follow up service to customers on online orders submitted when required Engaging customers via live chat, assisting them on issues encountered during online purchase journey Work closely with project teams, both internal and external, on backend system requirements for online store related enhancements/launches Monitor and track all faults escalated to IS, ensuring issues are fixed on timely manner Conceptualizing and materializing automations Monitor NPS results and share feedback with relevant departments Handle sales leads from Customer Experience team, Online orders, SMS blast and Precision Targeting Handle/retain high value customers/segment Promote and provide accurate information on full suite of StarHub products and services Understand customers' needs and recommend appropriate plans and services Voice of customers Achieve sales targets for a range of products and services over the phone and meet all KPIs set out in Service Quality Standards and Balanced Scorecard    Qualifications What are we looking for?    GCE ‚ÄòO' Levels or Diploma in any discipline Preferably with minimum 1 year of relevant working experience; Fresh graduates with no experience will also be considered Proficiency in Microsoft Office preferred Strong desire to achieve sales target and customer oriented Great analytical and communication skills Able to perform independently and excel as a team player    *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
