description: Job Title:  Renewal Sales Manager  Role Overview:  As one of the world's leading vendor of Cyber Security, facing the most sophisticated threats and attacks, we are expanding our team and looking for a Renewal Sales Manager. In the role of Renewal Sales Manager you will report to the Director of Inside Sales. You will manage a comprehensive range of next-generation Cyber Security renewals team across multiple countries within the APAC region. This is a quota carrying role with a predominant focus on Renewal sales growth and retention of the existing client base across all industry sectors. You will coach the account managers to develop a comprehensive view of customer requirements and goals, establish a strategy to improve renewals.  Company Overview:  Organizations and governments around the world may have different priorities and transformation initiatives, but one thing in common is that all are faced with growing risk, advanced threats, and complex environments. Today, cybersecurity strategies are critical to long-term success, and McAfee Enterprise is here to provide the industry‚Äôs only comprehensive, proactive, cloud security platform. Our technology is designed to protect the people, hybrid infrastructure, IP, and reputation of your business through our actionable threat intelligence and world-class solutions. With a cloud-native portfolio that spans from device to cloud edge and multi-cloud, you can stay ahead of threats by predicting, preventing, detecting, and correcting them. Backed by our 30+ year history, you can trust that we have the focus, experience and expertise needed to continually innovate, and are committed to help you protect what matters most.  About the role:  Set and achieve all renewal sales conversion, metrics and key goals to maximize revenue and customer satisfaction Develop field and cross functional relationships internally to help promote account success Build and implement the internal processes, tracking measurements, and forecasting. Provide training including listening in on calls and providing written/verbal feedback. Conduct pipeline review meeting on renewal business with the team. Oversee metrics-driven achievement on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis Communicate with management and field sales to ensure the team is hitting required targets within their region Help with the delivering of annual performance reviews Support the effort in Maintenance Renewal targets setting Inspects and review the renewals pipeline on a monthly basis Review renewals forecast with the Account Managers weekly Meet the quarterly and yearly target Maintain contact with assigned customers to ensure customer satisfaction, issue resolution and McAfee's footprint expansion Achieve a compelling McAfee's renewal value proposition Be familiar with the process in renewals quoting and pricing process Provide quality service to our customers in all assigned tasks, while upholding McAfee Values About you:  Track record of exceeding sales quotas and targets 8 years of experience in directly managing/leading a team of Renewals. Ability to motivate and guide top sales talents Exercise good decision making within defined procedures to determine appropriate action Demonstrated ability to work well in an interactive environment Is passionate about their work Team Player  Company Benefits and Perks:  We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee Enterprise to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.  Pension and Retirement Plans Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage Paid Time Off Paid Parental Leave Support for Community Involvement  We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: Be visionary  At Teledyne FLIR, we have a simple but ambitious mission: to develop market-leading thermal and sensing technologies which enhance everyday life. From saving energy, to saving lives Teledyne FLIR is making a real difference in our world.  Our products are used in a wide array of situations to rescue people in danger, detect criminals, conserve energy, navigate safely, provide security around the globe, and protect our environment.  We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.  Job Description  Your contribution  As a Sales Support Specialist, you will be part of our small APAC Sales team based in Singapore working with the Sales operations in a Technical Product Support capacity.  Raymarine is a world leader in high-performance marine electronics for the recreational boating and light commercial marine markets. Our technology includes everything from Marine electronic navigation aids to Thermal cameras and automation control systems. Your primary responsibility will be assisting with Raymarine/ Teledyne FLIR Maritime Product support, including both office-based support and onboard diagnostics and repair, requiring occasional travel within APAC locations as required.  The Job in plain text Responding to telephone enquiries associated with FLIR/Raymarine products, either direct to enquiries by using FAQs or knowledge base or escalating them to team members for further detailed response Assisting customers via Telephone, web and email, following up customer contacts as necessary and supporting the sales team with detailed technical guidance relating to customer enquiries Monitor and support customer communications to ensure all contacts are managed in line with department KPIs Assisting and supporting in the resolution of customer complaints, escalating as necessary to line manager To develop and publish FAQs and develop content for knowledge base to enhance customer self-diagnosis and web-based knowledge tool to be expanded and available to all customers. To identify and publish support documentation to enhance the Customer support activities and quality and scope of support materials for customers To support customers remotely via web team viewer sessions, to diagnose source of issues To supervise and engage appropriate local resources to remove and replace defective products, coordinating replacement products and spares as necessary Undertake in-field service visits as required within stated territories To support administration of returns and repairs whilst in the office To report and follow up in-field issues, initiating appropriate responses and follow-up actions within engineering and PLG. To lead escalation of fault technical diagnoses, with full triage capability to escalate fault, symptom, and potential resolution to relevant technical teams for formal resolution and launch of field fix through acknowledged company processes. To directly support engineering teams with specific technical requirements as appropriate to drive field improvement through experience, product knowledge and customer feedback To be ready to take on this role we would love if you have Strong skills in electrical and electronic repair and diagnostics Clear spoken English and grammatically correct written English Experience from a customer service role is required Methodical problem-solving abilities PC literate and competent operator of telephony is essential Excellent communication skills Organizational and time-management skills A boating interest Ability to travel overseas, at short notice within the APAC region What Teledyne FLIR Offers You Opportunity to develop your career with the world's leading company in thermal and sensing technology with over 50 years track record At FLIR, you get a unique opportunity to experience how cutting-edge R&D, software- and hardware development come together. We do our research, our development, and our manufacturing Friendly culture with a focus on collaboration, problem-solving, and creativity Interested?  If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.  The selection process is ongoing, so don't wait, but no later than the 29th of October.  We may select our final candidate before the advert expires.  When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.  We accept applications in English.  This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.  Teledyne FLIR and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.  Teledyne FLIR is an equal opportunity employer.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it‚Äôs like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let‚Äôs create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Reporting to the Director, Segment Marketing, the candidate will be involved in Market Development activities for Business Sales. The objective would be to drive interest and growth in Singtel solutions through partner engagement in the SMB sector.  The mission of the business development role is to fundamentally change how solutions are discovered, purchased, and deployed by our SMB customers. To help SMBs discover and develop solutions to deal with daily operations and position for growth through an ecosystem of partners.  A passionate and innovative individual who has both the business acumen and technology knowledge to help establish Singtel as a preferred partner and solution provider.  Responsibilities  New Business Generation Work closely with SMB Customers, Partners, Marketing, Sales, Product, and Specialists teams across the organization to work on the value proposition to position Singtel as enabling SMB customers to digitalise and achieve growth. Research, ideate and design potential solutions and offers, including proactive proposals to drive adoption of Singtel solutions ‚Äì in collaboration with government agencies and ecosystem of industry & like-minded partners. Drive structured programs with partners (across Sell-to & Sell-Through sales motions) for lead generation and to accelerate adoption of Singtel ICT solutions ‚Äì including 5G. Implement customer usage metrics & implementation of solution-focused Sell-To & Sell-Through reporting. Manage the lifecycle of assigned initiatives, including demonstrating operational success and recommending further iterations. Market Development/Thought Leadership Keep abreast of key trends affecting the business ‚Äì new developments in the market, progress of SMBs and development in the market environment specific to certain vertical industries. Must possess a strong intellectual curiosity and desire to understand and solve enterprises/ SMBs pain points. Possesses strong critical reasoning skills; Able to provide meaningful, well-reasoned critiques and suggestions on the direction on various initiatives. Requirements Degree in Marketing, Business. At least 5 years of working experience in Telco/ICT industry. Technical and/or operational background with experience in managing projects. Proficient in Microsoft Office/ Tableau. Operational rigor, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping focus on execution and delivering results consistently. Proven ability to work cooperatively with various teams, including operations, sales and professional services.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: This position will play a pivotal role in our rapidly growing business of Ripple and SBI Ripple Asia (a joint venture company of SBI Holdings and Ripple) in the Japan and South Korea markets. You will collaborate with multiple teams at Ripple to own and execute technical programs and manage business initiatives in collaboration with the joint venture and Ripple teams to expand the adoption of RippleNet and On-Demand Liquidity (ODL) solutions. This role will report to the Senior Manager of Joint Venture Partnership based in New York.  What You‚Äôll Do Drive alignment between Ripple and SBI Ripple Asia to accelerate the RippleNet adoption. Partner with technical delivery teams to ensure successful execution of high-priority projects and seamless customer experience Drive complex initiatives from conception to implementation and become sought out as a trusted advisor by our partner teams. Create and manage project plans; monitor and review project progress and timelines; adjust schedules and plans as needed; and identify and resolve issues to ensure project success. When required, interface directly with RippleNet customers with our joint venture partner. Facilitate timely resolution of product issues and escalate product requests and regional insights to the Product organization Manage difficult conversations regarding budget, resources and timeline and formally capture and communicate outcomes of those meetings. Develop and execute volume expansion strategies in collaboration with the joint venture team to achieve team OKRs Become an expert of the cross-border payments markets in Japan and Korea What We're Looking For 7 to 10 years of experience in technical project or program management. Experience working in technology and financial companies. Experience working with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, technical support, data, sales, operations, compliances, legal, etc). Ability to manage multiple, time-sensitive projects with competing priorities, while working independently to drive projects to completion with minimal guidance and high attention to detail. Natural leader with proven effectiveness in leading cross-functional / organizational / cultural teams. Ability to streamline complex processes and implement workflows designed to increase efficiency. Strong communicator of ideas; able to engage and lead client and Ripple teams in challenging the status quo, implementing change, and driving action with a sense of urgency. Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills. Ability to proactively identify and manage project risks. Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, high energy, team-oriented environment. Flexibility to take meetings in the US time zone as needed. Must be able to travel. Experience in business program management is a plus. Proficiency in Japanese is a plus. What We Offer The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact Competitive salary and equity Medical and vision with 100% employer contributions for employees and dependents Industry-leading parental leave policies Generous wellness reimbursement program Weekly company-wide meeting - ask anything you may want to know Who We Are  Ripple is doing for value what the internet did for information: enabling its instant and seamless flow around the world. We call this the Internet of Value (IoV). Using blockchain and cryptocurrency technology, Ripple is dedicated to creating powerful gains in financial efficiency, equity and inclusion. In addition, Ripple is developing and enabling the future use cases that will catalyze the new digital economy for governments, businesses and consumers.  Ripple has offices in San Francisco (HQ), New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore, S√£o Paulo, Reykjav√≠k, Washington D.C. and Dubai.  Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance. description: What You Can Expect  Our teams are active in all major Commodities globally, and develop financial solutions to help clients manage risk, increase returns and solve complex financial problems. Globally, we hold leadership positions across Commodities and all major financial markets. This approach means you'll be part of a dynamic team, helping to solve a range of challenging and interesting business issues and will be challenged in your work.  In an ever-changing global markets you'll spend your time exploring the sophisticated financial solutions we deliver across Commodities to a wide set of clients. The skills you develop and the professional network you build will serve as a solid foundation for your career.  About You  A strong interest in Commodities and global financial markets is essential, as are analytical and quantitative skills, flexibility, teamwork, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to handle pressure and enjoy a collaborative environment. Bachelor's degree required Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Confidence and initiative to take on responsibility and manage your own projects. Exceptional quantitative, analytical and communication skills Excel, PowerPoint and Word proficiency Excellent leadership and collaborative skills As this role will involve significant interaction with Japanese clients, fluent written and spoken Japanese is required J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. description: Company Description  At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative. A focused strategic selling role, identifying and driving qualified opportunities from pre-sales to close of business contracts whether it is a master agreement or a single mobile line & equipment contract. Close businesses that will add and maintain overall business and account top line revenue growth while managing and up-selling customers to avert revenue erosion. Drive growth through new acquisitions or win-back and by expanding customer expenditure with our existing businesses. It‚Äôs their pioneering spirit, blended with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry that truly makes us unique as an employer. description: We are looking for passionate customer support representatives to join our rapidly expanding team. You will be responsible for delivering concierge-level, white glove support to our customers and differentiating Twist Bioscience as a biotech industry leader. You‚Äôll interact, support and build strong relationships with a wide range of sales staff including account managers, field application scientists and technical support specialists. You‚Äôll also support a broad range of customers who are engaged in ground-breaking genetics research. Your goal is to achieve high customer satisfaction scores, drive loyalty to Twist Bioscience‚Äôs products, and reinforce the quality of our brand.  What You'll Be Doing Respond to and resolve product, service and order inquiries and problems via email, chat and phone by: identifying the cause of the problem collaborating with other stakeholders to develop a solution presenting the solution to the customer following up to ensure the customer is completely satisfied. Process sales purchase orders by entering and validating the accuracy of the information provided by customers and sales staff. Resolve any errors effectively and efficiently. Some orders require an advanced understanding of Twist‚Äôs product line to process. Provide information and guidance to help customers: decide which product to buy navigate and use our ecommerce website understand the status of their order Stay current on the status of key account orders currently in the production pipeline and provide proactive updates to internal stakeholders. Generate sales quotes for sales reps within Salesforce quote to cash system. Provide guidance on Asia region import / export logistics and compliance. Each Twist employee is responsible for complying with applicable Quality Management System (QMS)/Information Security Management System (ISMS) standards in the execution of their daily activities and ensuring product or service meets regulatory requirements, customer requirements and the established QMS/ISMS policies and procedures. What You'll Bring to the Team: Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferably in life sciences or related field. 2+ years‚Äô work experience in biotech industry. 2+ years‚Äô customer-facing experience. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Attention to detail. Able to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively. Strong computer skills, familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite and/or G-Suite, preferably including Salesforce and Zendesk. Familiarity with Asia region import / export logistics and compliance. About Twist Bioscience  Twist Bioscience synthesizes genes from scratch, known as ‚Äúwriting‚Äù DNA. Just as children learn to both read and write, the next phase of development for the genomics revolution is the ability to write DNA.  At Twist Bioscience, we work in service of people who are changing the world for the better. In fields such as health care, agriculture, industrial chemicals and data storage, our unique silicon-based DNA Synthesis Platform provides precision at a scale that is otherwise unavailable to our customers.  Twist Bioscience Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Twist Bioscience Corporation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic characteristics, or any other category protected by law.

Want to be part of the fastest growing startup that is at the intersection of Retail, Fintech and Data?  Qashier is looking for an amazing Customer Support Specialist to support our growth!  We are a dynamic and fast growing team that is excited about commerce, retail and payments, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology.  We are looking for passionate individuals that can provide a helping hand to our F&B and Retail merchants as they grow their business on both weekdays and weekends. Our Support team adapts quickly to the needs of individual merchants and deliver a human and consultative support experience through creative problem-solving and a thorough knowledge of how Qashier works.  In this role you‚Äôll work closely with our merchants covering key business hours. This is a full time position that will require a commitment to work on 4 weekdays and 1 weekend.  In short, you‚Äôll be driving Qashier‚Äôs success in the following ways: Develop deep knowledge of Qashier's hardware, software and suite of services Partner with our merchants to effectively resolve issues through phone, email and live chat Answer how-to questions and help merchants navigate a variety of tools within Qashier Diagnose hardware and software issues and engage with our Product and Engineering teams using established processes Collaborate with internal teams such as Account Managers and Sales teams, and identify opportunities for existing customers to use more of our platform or services Show composure, resilience, professionalism and flexibility  What you should bring along Passionate about technology, Fintech and the retail/F&B space Strong communication with good bilingual oral skills (English and Chinese) and readiness to go the extra mile for our merchants Highly driven and energetic individuals with a strong willingness to learn Strong creative problem solving skills A keen attention to detail  Why join Qashier? Be at the forefront of a fast-growing startup in an exciting sector. Qashier‚Äôs innovative platform combines the latest developments in Cloud technology, Payments and Data to transform the Retail & F&B industries. You‚Äôll play a crucial role on the growth of a revolutionary product that will become a key platform behind successful retail businesses in the region. Amazing growth and learning opportunities. We are a tight knit team where everyone grows together. We‚Äôll continuously work with you to refine your strengths and strengthen your weaknesses to further your personal and career development. Make a strong impact with your work. You‚Äôll be working directly with hundreds of small businesses across the region where the work that you do will make a direct impact to the success of these businesses. Attractive compensation and equity bonuses  ABOUT QASHIER Qashier (qashier.com) powers SMEs with a technology platform that combines a smart POS terminal and integrated payment acceptance with a diverse app store of both in-house and third party business applications. By pairing technology with a strong commitment to merchant success, Qashier helps retail and F&B businesses increase revenue, streamline operations, and create loyal customers.

description: General Information  Job Title Sales Transaction Coordinator  Department: APAC, Sales Transactions Support  Reporting Working Relationships  Reports to: APAC Quote Support Manager  Supervises: none Internal: APAC Sales: Sales Reps, Sales Transactions Support, Sales Engineers, Finance, CSM, Capacity, Billing, Data Team, Global and Regional Sales Ops; BSA/IT,  External: NA  Job Description  Roles  The Sales Transaction Coordinator for APAC is part of the APAC Sales Transactions Support. Main responsibilities include creating quotes for the Customer and Sales Representatives and shepherding all these quotes through the approval process up to booking.  This role also involves coordination with Sales Reps and working cross-functionally to solve issues related to quotes. The nature of the accounts will require working across different countries of APAC and engage with counterparts in the Global organization of Equinix if applicable sure the customer is aware and help the internal customer through adoption.  In addition, the role includes creation of quotes and will also be responsible to handle order and assets related requests coming from different internal departments.  The Sales Transaction Coordinator will get engaged via cases in SFDC and will work off a queue. The role will have a close working relationship with SSA, Sales Reps, Customer, CSM‚Äôs and Sales Engineers for obtaining the required order information to ensure quotes are not delayed.  Responsibilities  Monitor/manage the quote request queue (cases in SFDC/Siebel)  Validate the quoting info provided by Sales Rep, SSA and CSM. Follow up directly on any clarifications or additional info required to accurately generate quotes.  Accurate and timely creation of all assigned quote requests in Siebel. This applies to both initial quotes and revisions to existing quotes (especially for SO amendments, Custom, Migration, Replacement, Add/Delete/Change SO‚Äôs and Terminations)  Monitor all approval queues within the Quoting Processes and escalate any delays.  Manage the manual signature process and ensure contracts are stored and provided to customers if signature process is handled outside of the system.  Provide 1st level support to SSA, Sales Reps on generating legal Agreements in SFDC and submitting nonstandard term requests to Legal (e.g. for MCA, GTC, Policies)  Work cross functionally with a variety of departments within Equinix and function well within a team.  Job Requirements  Education and Experience  BA/BS degree or equivalent experience, preferably in computer-related field  2-3 years of experience in Sales Support preferably in Telecommunications or IT industry with a basic understanding of the Order Processing cycle  Siebel, Oracle and Salesforce.com knowledge/experience is a plus  Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities  Ability to work and adapt in an international, fast pace and continuously changing environment  Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Strong team player  Ability to professionally communicate and interact with all levels of internal and external customers  Customer service focus  Ability to juggle multiple priorities  Data analytical skills, ability to make structure in complex situations. Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy  Self- starter attitude, ability to work independently, a fast learner  Expertise in MS Word, Excel (including Excel pivot tables), PowerPoint required  Good command of English language (Written and Oral)

description: At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.  Position Summary  The Technical Account Manager (TAM) works as liaison between STERIS Life Sciences, our local channel partner (distributor) and our end Customers in Singapore and South East Asia (SEA) in order to promote the sale, application, and support of our contamination control product offering. Working both independently as well as closely with the local distributor, the TAM will meet directly with Customers to promote the full range of Life Sciences consumable product offering in the pharmaceutical, biotech and cosmetic industries. Utilizing their strong business acumen, selling skills, and technical knowledge, the TAM will act as a bridge from the Customer to STERIS and ensure that the end Customer receives excellent service throughout the entire sales cycle. This role is critical in increasing our Customers‚Äô trust, confidence, and reliance on STERIS throughout Singapore and SEA.  Duties  Sales (60%) Achieve assigned monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales quota for assigned sales territory. Identifies and proactively seeks out valid sales opportunities with new and existing Customers but not limited to, Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Medical Device, and Research accounts to focus activities. Develops strong long-term business relationships with Customer base and STERIS‚Äôs Singaporen and SEA distributor. Provides high level of service to Customers, including timely and accurate responses to inquiries, and to maintain/build STERIS reputation in the marketplace. Develop and maintain sound business relations with customers as well as internal cross-functional teams such as Customer Service, Marketing, Technical, and Field Sales. Communicates leads to appropriate Account Managers/Sales Managers in other territories. Evaluates non-routine complaints from Customers and takes appropriate action to bring to resolution. Represents STERIS in a professional and ethical manner according to the STERIS Code of Business Conduct. Duties - cont'd  Technical (30%) Presents STERIS Life Sciences consumable to pharmaceutical and biotech manufacturers. Consults with Customers and evaluates needs in order to recommend, sell and support innovative solutions and ensure Customer satisfaction. Understand and articulate product features and how they apply to given customer requirements and needs. Utilize product knowledge to provide customer solution. Maintains current knowledge of industry and market trends as well as technical knowledge and understanding of products and services. Attends educational workshops, reviewing professional publications and participating in professional societies. Educates Customers in the area of cleaning and contamination control. Business/Administrative (10%) Communicates regularly with STERIS management, Customers, and local distributor in order to support their needs. Must be able to identify needs, articulate those to management, and justify potential solutions with a business case. Provides competitor ‚Äúintelligence‚Äù to marketing and operations functions and other duties as assigned. Provides timely reporting of activities in order to measure progress against goals. Education Degree Bachelor's Degree in Biological Science or Science Required Experience Minimum 3-5 years working for a pharmaceutical manufacturer in a technical role with degree; Specific experience in cleaning validation, disinfectant validation, contamination control, product quality, technical services or manufacturing experience preferred. Experience selling technical products/services in Singapore and S.E.A region preferred. Experience in the production of oral solid dosage forms and biopharmaceuticals preferred. Demonstrated track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals. Skills Technical and business communication, both written and verbal in English; technical vocabulary required. Excellent interpersonal, written, verbal, analytical and formal presentation skills, with ability to interact effectively across all levels of the organization, as well as with Customers. Willingness to travel 30% approximately international travel for business purpose. Strong understanding of Customer and market dynamics and requirements in Singapore and S.E.A, with demonstrated ability to expand existing Customer relationships as well as develop new ones. Ability to work in a self-directed capacity, adapt to change, and set priorities and balance sales and administrative duties. Strong business acumen, with ability to understand and monitor trends, maintain and develop knowledge and apply that knowledge to effectively influence sales. Excellent computer skills, including strong experience with Microsoft Outlook and Office Suite. STERIS is a leading provider of products and services that meet the needs of growth areas within Healthcare: procedures, devices, vaccines and biologics. description: We are Sinch. Even if you don't know us by name or recognize our logo yet, chances are you have used our products in one way or other. We bring businesses and people closer with tools enabling personal engagement. We are a leading global Communication Platform as a Service (CPaaS) provider, offering messaging, voice and video communication solutions to a large global customer base. Our APIs and the platform deal with over 145 billion engagements annually. Enterprise customers include 8 out of 10 of the largest US tech companies by market capitalization, major airlines, banks, retail, e-tail, internet, ride-hailing, parcel delivery companies and more. Sinch is growing fast and we are now seeking a Junior Sales Engineer to join our Sales Engineer team and help us deliver to our clients. The essence of the role As a Junior Sales Engineer you will act as subject matter expert for the Sinch products. You'll provide pre-sales support, initially working mainly with internal teams. The Sales Engineer team works closely with the Sales team to plan and execute account strategies, take part in executive meetings, solution presentations, technical workshops, and follow-up discussions. The team's objective is to help prospects understand and customers to achieve the highest business value possible from our products in a way that is financially rewarding for both the customer and Sinch. As Junior Sales Engineer you'll contribute to the team's objective through supporting the team with various tasks and enable them in their work. As our new Junior Sales Engineer you will: Provide product expertise: act as subject matter expert to support the Sales Team. Act as internal pre- and post-sales support including coordination and administrative tasks. Collaborating internally and externally to ensure smooth delivery of projects. This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking for a company and role where they can consistently grow. This is you We look for someone who is solutions oriented with a strong sense of accountability and sees things through to the end. You comfortably interact with all levels of organizations and enjoy building business relationships both internally and externally. In order to be successful in this role you have: University Degree in a technical field or sales related degree. 3 to 5 years' experience from mobile, telecom, network, or related technology field. Excellent communications and presentation skills. Language: Fluency in business English both written and spoken. Big plus! The following are meritorious but not a requirement: Fluency in Mandarin Experience from a hands-on technical role is a big plus We will review applications continuously so please submit your resume in English as soon as possible but no later than August 27th, 2021. Are you ready? Join us on our journey! About the recruitment process:To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties making a decision in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process.

The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways ‚Äî from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.  The RoleAspenTech is a market leader, providing software that optimizes process manufacturing ‚Äì including oil and gas, petroleum, chemicals, pharmaceuticals and other industries that manufacture and produce products from a chemical process. The Lead Development Representative (LDR) must develop an understanding of the value AspenTech provides to our customers and communicate our value proposition in both written and oral communications with customers. Candidates must possess the ability and confidence to engage customers, evoke interest in Aspen Technology‚Äôs solutions, qualify and disqualify potential customers, think quickly on their feet, and speak intelligently with a variety of buyers. This person will work as a member of a sales team which includes business consulting, customer support and sales operations. The LDR role is directly responsible for generating new leads and further qualify leads generated from various marketing activities. They will use proven sales methodologies taught in an onboarding program. The LDR role is an opportunity to join an industry-leading team while building a strong foundation of skills centered on our customer‚Äôs business goals, needs and value.Your Impact Consistently achieve and exceed individual sales metrics. Manage the lead qualification and prospecting process for defined AspenTech pipeline generation programs. Maintain and nurture relationships with key stakeholders at prospective accounts. Manage the account profiling process, which includes understanding the customer‚Äôs buying process and communicating the AspenTech value proposition to prospects. Pass qualified customer account leads to Inside Sales Account Managers. Assist in securing technical demonstrations. Utilize a Customer Relationship Management (Salesforce) system to manage prospective customer information. What You'll Need A University degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or equivalent). A positive attitude and strong personal integrity. Self-motivation with an innate desire to win and to achieve stated goals/targets. Highly disciplined and well organized. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Team oriented, self-starter who is willing to be coached in a collaborative environment. Personal computer literacy including, Excel, PowerPoint, CRM tools (Salesforce). Fresh graduates may apply.

description: With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others.  If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it‚Äôs with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike.  Hilton‚Äôs Commercial Services organization is comprised of team members driving our sales, revenue management, call center and analytics functions. These functions are the core of Hilton‚Äôs ‚Äúcommercial engine‚Äù and are key to Hilton‚Äôs ability to drive profitable growth.  Our Sales Governance team coordinates the administrative, auditing, reporting, Opportunity management efforts and processes of Hilton Sales teams. The team is focused on ensuring that Hilton is the most sought‚Äêafter sales partner in hospitality, by freeing up seller‚Äôs time, driving efficiency, and establishing governance to maximize performance and make things happen.  Are you looking to be an integral part of the team supporting our sales group? Hilton is looking for a Specialist to support the automation, standardization, and governance necessary to drive our holistic support of the sales teams. You will utilize a strong can‚Äêdo attitude and innate ability to identify / resolve issues and to ensure that Sales systems are reflecting accurate data / business processes. You will help take our support to the next level by proactively searching for challenges and working with hotels / partners / teams to reflect accurate data. This will help shorten selling timelines and drive efficiency and consistency across Hilton Worldwide Sales.  What will I be doing?  As the Specialist, Sales Governance ‚Äì Asia Pacific, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: Work cross‚Äêfunctionally with our hoteliers and sales teams to identify and resolve discrepancies in systems that are supported by our Sales Governance team. Provide email / case support to customers in gathering and directing their needs. Engage with other teams on setting best practice and standard methodologies to ensure a consistent partner experience. Maintain clear and concise documentation for all support, administrative, and auditing processes. Manage own mailbox and monitor workflow with internal / external partners and team members. Thorough working knowledge of all relevant systems required to perform essential daily job functions as well as project-related tasks. Support administrators, hotels and corporate partners by updating systems for rate loading, informational content, booking policies and corporate contracting. Support necessary cleanup initiatives related to quality checks and audits to ensure accuracy of information in all relevant systems and processes. Assist all customer inquiries / issues, user requests, policy / procedural inquiries, and escalated situations, responding professionally with Best Practices regarding products and services, within stated authority. Bring to attention any opportunities or risks which may affect the customer or business and take ownership to work with management to implement solutions to address. Other projects related to supporting hotels and / or corporate initiatives. Contribute to and take part in training and development activities within the team and on a personal basis. Develop and maintain constructive and cooperative working relationships with internal team members, key corporate personnel and stakeholders. Exercise sound judgement, balance workload and prioritize demands with the greatest impact. Carry out any other job duties as directed. What are we looking for?  Skills  To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow  A Specialist, Sales Governance ‚Äì APAC serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. High School Degree / GED. 2 years of travel industry or systems / product / project support related experience. 3 years of advanced use of Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook applications. Self‚Äêstarter who takes initiative in implementing goals, utilize analytical skills and possess flexibility. Accountable individual who makes great use of time to provide extraordinary customer service, communicating results and improvements. Strong communicator, influencer and solution‚Äêseeker. Passion for detail when creating a perfect report or responding to an email with the right amount of clarity. We are looking for someone who cares deeply about getting it right. Formulate, affect, interpret and implement management policies or operating practices. Carry out major assignments in conducting the operations of the business. Perform work that affects business operations to a substantial degree. Contribute to the employer in matters that have significant financial impact. Team Member has the autonomy to waive or deviate from established policies and procedures when situations arise, but also the responsibility to bring to the team for solutioning. It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: BA / BS Bachelor‚Äôs Degree. Advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUP, pivot table). Salesforce experience. 1 year of proficiency with Microsoft Access / SQL / VBA / Visio, Tableau or MicroStrategy applications. What will it be like to work for Hilton?  Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision ‚Äúto fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality‚Äù unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!  Work Locations  Hilton - Area Office - Singapore  Schedule  Full-time  Brand  Hilton Corporate  Job Level  Team Member  Job  Administrative

The role involves selling advertising space into our digital magazines throughout Asia. You will spend your days speaking with senior executives on the phone, gaining unrivalled exposure to a whole new network of game changers and decision makers from all industries.  Responsibilities include:  Achieve sales revenue of $20,000USD or above per month. Meet key activity and productivity metrics, including an average of 40 calls per day or 1 hour, 30 minutes dedicated to phone calls throughout the workday. Build and maintain strong, effective client relationships via engaging phone conversations. Accurately maintain and input sales data into Salesforce daily. Maintain the productivity spreadsheet with accurate daily activities. Respond promptly to customers enquiries and effectively handle any customer complaints as they arise. Continually pursue and develop new business opportunities. Attend weekly sales meetings with the Regional Sales Manager ‚Äì Asia & Greater China to communicate pending sales. Build brand awareness and act as a Brand Ambassador for The CEO Magazine. Maintain a strong level of awareness of the economic & commercial market. Possess a desire to continually learn and adapt to new skills, sales techniques and ways of working. Live and breathe our values of Passion, Accountability and Creativity & Innovation!  Skills required:  Fluent in English and/or Mandarin languages, highly desirable. 1 - 2 years of sales experience, with experience working to KPIs in a high pressure sales environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. An impressive telephone manner (interesting tonality, clear mature sound, etc.) Outstanding time management and organisational skills. The ability to maintain the accuracy of a CRM/database by inputting data correctly and efficiently. A positive attitude, self-motivation, and a natural persistence. Ability to work well autonomously and as part of a team. Confidence in speaking with senior executives of large international companies. Able to handle constructive feedback from external and internal stakeholders. A hunger to learn, you enjoy being mentored and constantly seek improvement and ways to develop yourself.  What's in it for you?  Good base salary package with uncapped commission! Work in our fantastic office in Singapore from 9:00am to 5:30pm. Monthly team events and employee awards. Working from home options available when you pass your six month probationary period.  How to apply:  As part of the recruitment process, we require you to upload a copy of your CV when submitting your application.  Applicants must be Singaporean or Permanent Residents of Singapore. We do not offer any work visas.  This role requires working from our Singapore office five days per week (given Covid 19 rules and regulations) for the first six months of employment.

description: Our Team  Mighty Jaxx is a unique future culture company that creates quality products across multiple categories such as art collectibles and lifestyle items, bridging the physical & digital world by powering it with technology. Since our inception in 2012, we have produced over 1,000 designs in collaboration with world-renowned artists and global entertainment brands like Hasbro, Sesame Workshop, Toei Animation and Warner Bros, delivering 5 million units of tech enabled collectibles to collectors in over 60 countries in 2020 alone.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a diverse, inclusive work environment and encourage our employees to bring their true fun-loving and high-energy selves to the workplace. With big, vibrant dreams and a culture of high performance in our workplace, you will always be engaged, empowered and feel positively challenged.  At Mighty Jaxx, we always extend our full support to the team to help them reach their full potential personally and professionally. If you love keeping up with the latest trends across different sub-cultures, love technology and are ready to embrace your creativity, we love to have you join us in creating the most unique experiences, products and content for our collectors!  The Job  As Sales Manager, you will play a pivotal role in growing our business globally. You will be responsible for building and leading the product life cycle from conception, go-to-market to operational plan. You should thrive in a start-up environment and work well with cross-functional teams to build and roll-out products that deliver our vision and product strategy.  Responsibilities Design and execute sales strategies to meet set targets. Accounts mapping within the assigned region to identify new partners opportunities. Cross functional collaboration within the organization to execute Mighty Jaxx‚Äôs portfolio of client-centric campaigns from conceptualization, to evaluation metric setting, to target definition and creative content specification. Coordinate and see to all aspects of executions. Actively engage key accounts in joint creative content creation for campaigns and promotional activities. Manage all aspects of the sales cycle and demonstrate leadership in pursuing and winning large deals. Accurately forecasting sales performance to enable the company to make informed decisions for appropriate resource planning and ensuring the right level of inventory to optimize revenue and product costing. Propose optimal selling prices for new release products by building a comprehensive pricing model through close monitoring of costs, competition, market trend, as well as, the interplay of supply and demand. Possess a hunter mentality by actively gathering new leads, source for new accounts to bring in new source of revenue to the company. Build strong rapport and long-lasting customer relationships by understanding customers‚Äô needs and having a ‚Äúyes‚Äù approach to customer service. Constantly assess current business distribution channels, develop and evaluate channel performance and drive excellence through territory expansion plans. Research and identify emerging industry trend, market shifts, new products innovations and competition activities to provide timely feedback to the company for counteractive response. Requirements BS/MS degree in business administration or a related field. 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience in a Sales or Account Management role, preferably for a consumer product company selling direct to large, national retailers. Knowledge of collectibles/toy industry is a plus. Knowledge of pop-culture preferred. Out of the box thinker; creative and strategic mindset. Proven track records in account management and sales achievements. Highly ambitious, and results oriented. Resilient and agile, quick to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining attention to details. Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal. Highly organized and effective time management skills. A high level of self-motivation, commitment and dedication. The ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines. Experience in mentoring, coaching and people management skills.

description: Job Description  Babel Finance is expanding its international Business Development business to help achieve aggressive business growth goals in onboarding clients to our Enterprise-grade custody and execution services offerings. As a member of Singapore Business Development team, your primary objective will be increasing asset under management (AUM) and revenue. You will collaborate with product manager, sales support, and other Babel Finance teams to support our clients‚Äô activities and the growth of our business.  The Purpose of Your Role  As part of our International Business Development team, you will interface with internal & external stakeholders to identify, develop, and execute strategies that create deep and lasting partnerships with high-net-worth (HNW) individuals and institutional clients. As we continue to explore opportunities in crypto assets, you must be able to represent the voice of the client while continuing to achieve our business goals.  The Expertise We‚Äôre Looking For 3-5 years‚Äô experiences in forex trading or sales role in a bank, trading funds, broker-dealer, or other financial institutions. Good knowledge on fx trading or market making is a big plus. Understanding of one or more of the following marketplaces: cryptocurrencies, blockchain. Experienced in sales, business development and/or relationship management, with strong hunting drive Ability to conduct market research independently and present deal opportunities. Exceptionally strong interpersonal skills in managing internal and external relationships in a proactive, energetic, and customer-oriented way. Comfort managing concurrent priorities across a diversified workload and ability to drive results in a thoughtful and collaborative way. Experience with the sales toolkit, including experience with CRM systems and development of pitchbooks and sales materials. The Value You Deliver Manage our high-touch client pipeline from lead generation to implementation Build strong relationships with clients, prospects, and other market participants, to drive new revenue and ensure customer retention. Develop presentations and sales materials for audiences with varying levels of seniority and understanding of finance, cryptocurrencies. Represent the voice of the market and the client with internal stakeholders in product, marketing, legal, risk, compliance, relationship management, implementation, operations, and client service. Identify opportunities for internal process improvement within the Business Development team, present such opportunities and drive change Monitor, evaluate and improve your sales toolkit on market trends and signals, including competitor business models, industry news and regulatory developments. Contribute to a corporate climate that values and rewards contributions, drive, initiative, and achievement of results. Company Overview Aiming to be the most prestigious institution in crypto finance, we're committed to offering our clients full crypto financial services. By offering an easy, smooth, and secure experience, we're building a solid crypto financial infrastructure for the world. Learn more at https://www.babel.finance

jobTitle: Strategic Sales Manager, Service Provider - ASEAN, HK & Taiwan
description: We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That‚Äôs the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, fearless team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!  Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 350,000 customers and almost 2 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  As a Strategic Sales Manager on the Service Provider Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with large Service Providers in the ASEAN, Hong Kong and Taiwan region. You‚Äôll be playing a key role in growing Meraki‚Äôs Service Provider route to market and shaping the go-to-market strategy in this segment.  Part strategic selling, part business development and part channel sales, this high-profile role requires a diverse skillset and entrepreneurial mindset. Your success will be dependent not only on your ability to sell, but also on the relationships you develop with Meraki and Cisco account teams. This position requires an individual to be very motivated with a strong hunter mentality!  Responsibilities: Hunt and acquire new service provider business for Meraki‚Äôs growing Cloud Networking portfolio Develop partnerships that lead to new managed service offers based on Meraki technology Negotiate business relationships and contracts Drive marketing and demand generation programs that build new pipeline Partner with Cisco and Meraki account teams to penetrate new SPs and close deals with end users  Qualifications: 8+ years of large scale strategic selling experience Background selling to or through service providers and/or selling managed services Shown ability to quickly build new relationships, navigate complex organisations and influence multiple stakeholders Documented track record of success Background selling IP networking, wireless and security technologies Able to travel up to 50% You will be working across the region including key partners in Taiwan and thus, proficiency in Mandarin is preferred, in addition to English  At Cisco Meraki, we‚Äôre challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We‚Äôre building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Carousell is one of the world‚Äôs largest and fastest growing mobile classifieds marketplace. Since our launch in May 2012, we‚Äôve expanded into 19 major cities with over 200 million listings. As part of our effort to improve the classifieds experience, we are reimagining how users buy secondhand by launching ‚ÄòInstantBuy‚Äô. ‚ÄòInstantBuy‚Äô offers a trusted and convenient shopping experience with curated items which promises variety, quality assurance and hassle-free returns.  The operational team is made up of passionate individuals working together to realise our vision of making secondhand the first choice. We are mission-oriented; we want to build products that make it easy for anyone to sell and inspire them to fill their lives with more meaningful things.  With increasing online transactions on Carousell, we are looking for a dedicated Customer Experience Specialist who will play a critical role in the design and safeguard of the transactional goods experience for both Buyers and Sellers. The right person will have applicable experience in ecommerce, logistics, and/or customer service. He/she will support our users to be successful on Carousell by sharing their feedback and suggestions with internal teams so that Carousell can build an app that serves the needs of our community.  The role will be based in Singapore, reporting to the Marketplace Experience (MX) regional head.  You Will Develop and execute operations strategy for seller account management matters including: Contract updates and seller comms Sales Progress Reports Documentation requests for accounting purposes Incentive program updates Payment issues and/or seller warranty claims Communicate between Carousell and third party logistics partners to manage operational issues relating to shipping/ returns Manage and oversee the handling of disputes in transactions and manage the service recovery processes, with support from Regional MX customer support team Work directly with customer support team to review new, existing or potential operational problems, complaints/queries and support agents in delivery of quality and efficient service to our Recommerce users Offer user-related insights on trends and recommendations to the lead of this business segment in Singapore, to: Assist with the execution of new product features and/or marketing campaigns Identify and address user pain points or improvement areas Drive accountability of MX/ Transactional Goods team‚Äôs deliverables for the market(s) by: Monitoring metrics performance relating to Transactional Goods Investigating and responding to escalations relating to user issues Identify anomalies to take remedial action Storytelling and escalating findings to the appropriate team Project manage between the Marketplace Experience and the Transactional Goods team on new initiatives that are to be rolled out, including: Working as a team to execute the initiative (e.g. coordinating for FAQs, Help Centre, Macros to be updated, and internal team briefing and agent training to be conducted) Providing insights on the new initiatives‚Äô performance to both the Marketplace Experience team and local team‚Äôs leadership. Own and have knowledge of all user-facing Carousell matters related to the local market, so as to be the Point of Contact among teammates and local authorities where needed. Skills, Behaviours, Competencies Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience (e.g. in Ecommerce, Logistics, Customer Service, and/or Business-focused roles); Able to self direct and complete assignments independently and without much prompting/ supervision; Recognize and take appropriate action to effectively address problems and opportunities; Ability to prioritise tasks and work autonomously in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment; Confident and creative problem solver; able to drive progress and explore innovative solutions; Collaborative; skilled working with cross-functional or remote peers/teams; and Open-minded; open to varied points of view and able to adapt to different cultural environments. We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you.

description: What's the role?  We are looking for candidates with strong business acumen to unleash high potential at Hilti, starting as Account Manager. This is no ordinary job. Our people come from all different backgrounds with a shared dedication to high performance, consistent results and outstanding customer service.  Who is Hilti?  If you‚Äôre new to our industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and first-rate service. With 30,000 people in more than 120 countries, we‚Äôre a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow and carve-out your career.  What does the role involve?  As an Account Manager, you will directly report to the Area Sales Manager. You‚Äôll be out and about visiting our customers, wherever they‚Äôre busy working, to find out how we can help them. You could find yourself on construction sites and plants or in offices and warehouses.  Ours is a model of consultative selling, and it‚Äôs really a hands-on job. Professional knowledge in products, market and service are fundamental to the role as key responsibilities involve developing and growing the assigned sales territories. You will need strong winning mindset to identify new sales potential and turn leads into our customers. Far from traditional cold calling, it‚Äôs about nurturing relationships with warm and responsive customers. From day to day, challenging tasks and responsibilities will help you pave your way to becoming an ambitious market leader.  What do we offer?  We‚Äôll give you what you need to excel in your role, including ongoing training from the start. Your responsibilities will be great and, with them, we'll give you the freedom and autonomy to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results.  Show us what you‚Äôre made of and we‚Äôll offer you opportunities to move around the business ‚Äì to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It‚Äôs a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you‚Äôre after.  On top of these, we have a thorough people review process, unlike any we know of in any other business. We screen everyone in the company in a yearly career performance matching process. It means we can pair talent with opportunities - developing our people in their current roles or challenging them to work in new ways or in new places. It‚Äôs how we find the right fit and further our teams personally and professionally.  Why should you apply?  We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. So, if you‚Äôve never worked in construction, that‚Äôs fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.  What You Need Is Preferably Degree / Diploma in any discipline, in Engineering preferred Sales experience or equivalent customer facing experience gained in MNCs Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Dynamic personality with strong winning and high performance mindset Self-motivated and a quick learner Highly adaptable with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude A driving license is essential based on the nature of the position By submitting your resume, you confirm and agree that Hilti Far East Pte Ltd and its related companies worldwide (collectively, ‚ÄúHilti Group‚Äù) may collect, use and disclose your data for their recruitment purposes. This may include selecting, evaluating and recruiting candidates for roles or positions that differ from the above job description, but for which we believe that you may be interested in or appropriate for.  We look forward to receiving your application and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Construction, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About The Role  Reporting directly to the Area Sales Manager, Services (ASEAN), the ‚ÄúServices Sales Specialist‚Äù will be responsible to drive and grow the services business in the Public Sector in Singapore through prospecting, qualifying opportunities, developing and executing sales strategy, pricing models, targeting at Public Sector.  In close partnership with the Account Managers, Architecture Sales Specialists and Services Delivery team, the Services Sales Specialist will focus on understanding the customer's strategy, their needs and business requirements/priorities in order to recommend the appropriate solution and services offering and to close complex, transformational deals. The goal of this role is to drive service-led solution sales, marketing Cisco Services portfolio by establishing trusted, advisory relationships with key customer executives, driving continued year over year bookings growth.  Responsibilities Drive and grow professional services business for Cisco Solutions in collaboration with Account Managers and Architecture Sales Specialists to effectively package, price and present service proposal to customer with support from Services Pre-Sales Consultant Develop and lead Services account plans and strategies for key accounts using all cross- functional resources (executive sponsors, marketing, technical pre-sales, services delivery team, customer success team, Cisco-on-Cisco, etc) to achieve assigned quota Engage with prospect customers to position Proactive and Reactive Support Subscription Services through strategic value-based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data Build executive-level relationships with key existing accounts to develop incremental services business Lead cross functional teams to propose a solution to meet the customer's specific requirement to validate solution feasibility during the qualification stage Manage end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources from both Sales and Delivery organisation Develop and handle territory sales strategy to meet or exceed services bookings targets Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long-term perspective to drive substantial long-term revenue generation Ensure customer success and satisfaction leading to repeatable, scalable, profitable business opportunity Accurate weekly, monthly and quarterly forecasting and booking Requirements 10+ years of relevant experience of solution selling within a major services or software vendor Experience selling into enterprise customers with proven ability to meet and exceed quota Understands customer‚Äôs business environment, proactively assesses, clarifies and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis Ability to structure and sell services portfolio from Proactive/Reactive Support Services to Architecture Design and Advisory Services Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against sales targets Good interpersonal and communication skills both written and verbal; able to create and deliver presentations and proposals that clearly articulate value for the customer An energetic, enthusiastic and entrepreneurial approach to running a business Dedicated with ability to succeed in a dynamic environment Self-starter Bold and takes ownership High level attention to detail Desired Characteristics High energy sales professional who has a good track record, experience in consultative selling and an independent self-starter Trustworthy, customer obsessed, and able to foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement Goal-oriented and driven to succeed in a collaborative manner Superior cognitive ability and intellectually curious Authentic and humble with a high degree of integrity Demonstrates sense of urgency, ability to handle multiple priorities and collaborate with multiple stakeholders Willing and able to be coached and mentored and adapt to a fast-changing business environment Proven ability to successfully operate in a highly collaborative selling environment Why Cisco  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.  We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we‚Äôre ‚Äúold‚Äù (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we‚Äôre also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do ‚Äì you can‚Äôt put us in a box!  But ‚ÄúDigital Transformation‚Äù is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.  So, you have colorful hair? Don‚Äôt care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That‚Äôs cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!
